About Challah for Hunger
Eli Winkelman started Challah for Hunger as a student at Scripps College in 2004. She missed baking challah with her family, and was looking for a connection to the Jewish community at her school. To solve this, Eli began baking challah with friends, and quickly realized she and her friends could use challah-baking to mobilize and educate others. They began selling the challah and donating the profits to social justice causes. Word of Eli’s project spread, and soon Eli was guiding students, from all corners of the globe, as they started their own Challah for Hunger chapters.A decade after Eli’s first challah sale, Challah for Hunger continues to thrive. Currently, thousands of volunteers on 78 campuses across the US, Canada, Australia, and England gather on a regular basis to continue the centuries-old tradition of baking challah together in an inclusive environment. For all the volunteers and many of the customers, Challah for Hunger provides opportunities to be involved in a fun and dedicated community, address humanitarian problems, develop and practice new skills, and gain business and leadership experience.



Impact

Since 2004 we've: 


Raised $800,000+ for hunger relief and social justice causes


Baked and sold 200,000 loaves of challah


Expanded to include 78 chapters around the world


Engaged 8,000 student change agents



During the 2014-2015 school year: 


3,000 students participated in baking and selling challah and educating their peers about global and local hunger issues


7,000 students supported Challah for Hunger by purchasing our homemade challah


$175,000 donated to local and international organizations, including our philanthropic and advocacy partner MAZON: A Jewish Response to Hunger.



When we asked participants to share how Challah for Hunger has transformed their lives, here’s what we found:


86% increased their understanding and communication of the importance of giving. 
84% increased their likelihood to stay involved in leadership.
77% of respondents answered that CfH positively contributed to their Jewish identity to a good or great extent.
75% of respondents answered that CfH supported them in making responsible philanthropy choices to a good or great extent.
70% increased their awareness of hunger issues.








Honors

Featured in President Bill Clinton’s book “Giving: How each of us can change the world,” 
Named one of the most innovative Jewish organizations in North America by Slingshot  four times
Participated in Presentense fellowship twice! (The only organization to do so) Founder Eli Winkelman participated in the Global Summer Institute in 2007 and CEO Carly Zimmerman participated in the Tribe 12 Fellowship in 2014




Our Team
With a decade under our belts, we are uniquely qualified to inspire the next generation of change agents. Challah for Hunger is led by two chapter alumnae - Carly Zimmerman, CEO and Liz Smulian, Board Chair - who have experienced first-hand the joys and challenges of making change at the chapter level. Our small, but mighty professional team and incredible volunteers - including a network of 300+ alumni and powerhouse board of directors - have grown the organization by leaps and bounds.



You can help by:


Making a donation and inviting friends and family to make a contribution.
Follow us on Twitter, Facebook and Instagram 
Post a Challah Selfie and use hashtag #ChallahDays
Participate in a Challah tweet-up
Buy a challah from a chapter near you!

story:
Short Summary

I am going to distribute these planters to every State Government Garden for free and maybe every city with your help. That’s why I need your heartful click of the button on your right, please.

To distribute these planters to every city, a lot of funding will be needed, but it will not be difficult to do with your heartful help. We can easily level up our community by breaking our prejudice.

About Me and the Levelup Project

Married with 2 sons. Have been running 3 miles a day for 25 years. A green Designer; An inventor; Self-employed at a small restaurant for 14 years (for now).


I almost lost a finger because of the Level-Up-Planter. It’s about trying to find something hidden. Numerous trials and errors of breaking the precedent bias led me towards patenting the Level-Up-Planter. (Actually I have some more things to be patented later.)

The bias I am breaking is: “If I really want to own something, I have to forsake the greediness of possession. If not, I would be possessed by the ownership itself, which will turn out as something meaningless.

If I want to make some money for myself, I can do it with this patent, but I want to practice my recognition of “Happiness comes from sharing,” for our society.

Therefore, I am going to share my right of the patent with our community. Ultimately, if someone who can wisely handle it shows up, I will definitely give up my privilege without hesitation.

What We Need & What You Get

$200,000 can’t cover the whole expenses to place lots of planters each city but I can make it possible with sharing the right of my patent to each city.

If I can’t make my goal full funded, I only can donate less cities in the beginning. But I definitely can feel sure you will help us for the LevelUp Planter project.

What you will get is on your right, you know.

SIZE

Small Planter OS1: 24” x 12” x 10”

Small Planter CS1: 24” x 08” x 10”

Small Planter CS2: 18” x 10” x 10”

Large Planter OL1: 24” x 24” x 10”

Large Planter OL2: 36” x 12” x 10”

Large Planter CL1: 24” x 24” x 10”

*Please send an email stating which “type/shape” of planter you would like when receiving the rewards of individual small and large planters. If we do not get an email specifying which type, we will send a random one out.

The Impact

LevelUp is not only for a person or an organization, but for the community of World. The starting point just looks small, but the happiness of LevelUp will be spreaded out to the whole world.

I can’t help being excited with the imagination of supplying fresh vegetables for 3 meals a day from the LevelUp. How good is it, because it can be used for displaying purposes. Being short of starting costs to order, I preferred the longevity of the planters to price, so the price is a little bit high but the future pricing will be cheaper. 

Any person who is willing to join this project is more than welcome to contact us.

Most important factors to make it succeed is “Compatibility and Collaboration,” like I mentioned in the video clip. Like I said I am ready to give up my main role for the success of the Global happiness if someone else qualifies to step up.

LevelUp Organization will be composed of 3 parts: Manufacturing, distributing and practicing. All 3 parts will share whole profits together. 

The records of profits will be absolutely open  to  the  public as well, including this project.

Risks & Challenges

Although many things could potentially delay the project, the product only requires funding as of now. A prototype has been created and if I get enough sponsors, production can be accelerated. The facility I am currently in contact with, the same one that created the prototype, is reliable in obtaining the resources required to build the products and can readily produce the planters. The rewards listed will be started in production as soon as the first supporter donates to my project to ensure my sponsors are happy. The biggest potential problem may be shipping problems or resource management due to uncontrollable forces (nature, etc.).

story:
Planet Pulse is a social and information platform for people, organizations and news groups where all users can share or rate social and informational content on the platform.

Planet Pulse aims to provide the first social & informational map of the world.

The 3 main objectives of Planet Pulse:

1) Provide a social platform for people to share content and meet people around the world who share similar interests.
2) Provide an informational platform for people, organizations and news groups to share information in their areas of interest.
3) Motivate Change through our Change in Progress Page where people who deserve rewarding can be rewarded for making our Planet a better place.


Categories:


Users can share content in 12 different categories, namely:
Community,
Crime,
Economy,
Education,
Environment,
Health,
Music & Talent,
Animal Awareness,
Sport & Fitness,
Technology,
Travel & Tourism and
War & Terrorism.

Users can rate shared content in these 12 categories as Green (Positive), Yellow (Neutral) and Red (Negative).

Users can also share social content without having to choose a category, social content will be consolidated as a social heat-map for the Central Pulse.

All shared content is automatically consolidated and sent to the Platform's Central Pulse where Global Heat-Maps are generated.

Central Pulse:

Users can access the Central Pulse Page and view Global Heat Maps by the 12 Categories and by Global, Country or State/Province.

Each Map viewed by users include:

  1) Discussion Section: Users can discuss similar interests in selected area.

 2) Trending Pulses: Trending content in the selected area shared by People, Organizations and News Groups.

Alternatively users can view the social heat-map to view trending social activities around the world.

Change in Progress:

The Change in Progress Page provides people and organizations the opportunity to post rewards & incentives in specific areas of interest. Rewards can be shared by category and by area (Global, by Country or by State/Province)

Leading Change:

People can enter to win rewards posted in their areas.

1) Enter for a posted reward in your area
2) Share your story (with Pictures/Videos)
3) Get re-shares from other users
4) Win a reward!

Perks:

50 % of all perks received will go towards the Change in Progress Page for the first round of Rewards & Incentives around the world. These rewards will be global so that all our members from around the world can enter! :)

All funders have the option to send us a message and dedicate your funding 50% to any of the 12 categories of choice.

Funding Breakdown thus far: (Updated 1 August 2015)





Why we need your support:

Where is funding going?

1) Planet Pulse website launch: We need to complete the development of the Planet Pulse Platform to have our users start pulsing ASAP!

2) Mobile Application: Development of our Planet Pulse mobile application so users can pulse in many ways.

3) Marketing: Letting the whole world know about Planet Pulse and how they can share their stories for the world to see.

Our Goals:

Here are our main goals for the next 12 months we aim to achieve:

story: The ROKPA Women's Workshop located in Boudha, just minutes from the world heritage listed Boudhanath Stupa in Kathmandu, Nepal has been shaken up by these massive earthquakes. They have been so lucky. No lives were lost or the building badly damaged, but everyone has definitely been emotionally and physically affected by this massive natural disaster. At the moment all of the women and their families are sleeping outside, along with all of the kids from the ROKPA Children's Home on some open land behind the ROKPA Guest House. There are tents everywhere in any open space, including the guest house garden. And there would have to be at least 150 people out there. The first quake was bad, but then second big one (as there have been over 200 aftershocks) really has scared the Nepali people. The ROKPA Women's Workshop needs help. Some need new housing, some bills paid, food, family support, some extra help in this time of need. Help is needed everywhere. Please help where you can. Seriously, you have no idea what donating $20 does. $100 is better. That is 10,000 Nepali rupees and above the monthly minimum wage in Kathmandu, just. The average person here earns nowhere near that, just in case you needed some perspective. Thank you for anything you give. $5 adds up quickly when 1,000 people donate.

story:
Hi!  I'm Musoke, and my wife Jen and I are here with the goal of opening a creative lounge called Onto Paper. We're a husband and wife team with a lifelong for writing and the arts, and our goal with this funding campaign is to open a space where like-minded artists and creators can gather to, well, get their thoughts onto paper as it were!

In describing Onto Paper as a creative lounge, we mean to create a distraction-free place where artists, writers, and creators of all kinds can come together to do what they do best; to write, to paint, to draw, or even just to sit and chat with their peers.  In our time in San Antonio we've come to notice a distinctive lack of dedicated gathering places for creative individuals to come together: we've seen gatherings announced in crowded coffee houses, restaurants, even churches, and the donations you provide will help Onto Paper become a place where everyone will always feel welcome to create!

How You Can Help

To begin with we're looking for $5,000, which we can get doubled thanks to a local grant!

Things we're going to need the funding for:

  • Our space! We have a location chosen, but if we can't occupy it, then we're no good to anyone! We're also going to need to make the area ready for you guys! A room is great, but a room with chairs and tables is a bit more comfortable!
  • We want to have supplies on hand for people, as soon as possible. Our first goal is to have some PCs on site for those who need use of them, but eventually we also want to have art supplies, lots of different sorts. The better this fundraiser goes, the more things we can have from the start!
  • We're also hoping to have a bit of money set aside to help with advertising. Particularly in schools, to help kids learn about our existence. We believe that getting kids interested in writing and art is a great thing, and actually intend on having a program for kids in specific, eventually!

The Impact

We feel that our creative lounge will help many people in different ways.

Not everyone has space to create in, whether because they live in a small place, or have a loud family, or whatever may have you. We feel like these people could benefit most from having a dedicated place that hey can be creative, without all of the troubles that come from not having your own space.

On top of having creative space however, we also want to have a distraction-free area for people. When you're at home and trying to write, focus, work, on anything, there's so much around... Video games, TV, Netflix, the family dog wanting to play RIGHT NOW, your parents asking what on earth you're doing now... Here, it's just you and the computer, or canvas. We will encourage gathering together with a group to discus things, but if you're on your own, we won't pester you!

Above all, we want to be able to help people who may not be able to get noticed, BE noticed. With a community of writers and artists, you often find people who want to also support their fellow artists and writers. This is where the gallery comes in handy, on-site, all of the creations made by our members, ready to be bought by other members.

All of this can only be possible if we have somewhere to begin, by way of opening up shop, with the help of the community at large...

Risks & Challenges

Admittedly, this is our first time running a business, of any sort, on a professional level. Jen was a regular Thomasina Sawyer as a kid, running many a lemonade stand and neighborhood car wash, but that's nothing quite like this. So we realize we'll be learning as we do. This isn't always an awful thing though. Since we're something new, we're willing to make changes as our members need or want them.

For example, maybe no one enjoys a certain art, we'll put less attention in that direction, and focus more on something that we never even thought of introducing. Maybe we need small sectioned off rooms, instead of one large room. Maybe no one likes coffee, and we should only serve water and juice. We don't know until people say something though!

We are ready and willing to learn, to make it work!

Other Ways You Can Help

If helping us financially isn't in the cards, (we know, there's a ton of things out there that need to be taken care of first, we're parents after all,) then help us out by spreading the word! Tell people about us! Share our IndieGogo page, our Facebook page, our website! Tell your writer/artist friends about the fact that we're going to be opening up soon, we're going to open up either way, so we're going to need a customer base!

Thanks so much guys!

story:
OUR STORY

The US Census bureau measured Bend’s growth from 2013 to 2014 at 2.7%. This rapid growth further weighs down a pre-existing affordable housing deficit. Teachers, small business owners, nurses, restaurant servers, maintenance workers, grocers, and public servants are consistently priced out of homes within city limits. These people contribute to our city’s thriving economy and provide necessary services, yet Bend’s current economy excludes them from buying homes and having stability. The median household income in Bend Oregon is approximately $50,000.  The median home cost is $325,000, and the average home cost is over $500,000.  The median home cost requires an income of approximately $77,000.  This is 154% of the median income! Without any options on the horizon over half of the people in our town cannot afford to own or buy a home in this market, let alone a safe, healthy, sustainable home. For a population of over 80,000, there were only 51 homes for sale in August which were affordable to those making median income or less. Many of those 51 homes were in various stages of disrepair and would need work done in order to bring them up to today's safety standards. What is the cultural loss if we continue to overlook solutions to the housing crisis? Who will teach your children?  Who will answer the phone when you need dispatch? Who will bag your groceries? Who will serve your latte'?

OUR STORY IS YOUR STORY TOO

Our-town, U.S.A. is not the only one experiencing this problem. The statistics may vary, but the need for affordable housing is the same. Sustainability is also on the forefront of everyone's mind these days, and for good reason. Anthropogenic carbon emissions have never been higher.  As citizens, we can no longer turn a blind eye to either of these issues. At Kôr, we are creating an efficient living model that can be duplicated in and around Bend where housing issues are prominent, as well as throughout the United States.

 Kôr’s community model differs from other affordable housing solutions for the following reasons:

  • Kôr is sustainable for current and future generations.
  • Kôr serves a diverse demographic.
  • Kôr will build communities instead of individual homes.
  • Kôr will be deed restricted at re-sale, and thereby create perpetually affordable housing.
We are here to create a solution for Bend, and set an example for our global community at large.
HOW WE ARE DOING IT
We are building our communities using the Community Land Trust (CLT) model.  A land trust holds property perpetually for a purpose. In the case of a CLT, that purpose is affordable housing. The land trust model as defined by the National CLT Network is: “a nonprofit corporation that develops and stewards affordable housing, community gardens, civic buildings, commercial spaces and other community assets on behalf of a community.” The CLT traditional model of community owned land and individually owned homes, allows the homes to be perpetually attainable to those with an income level at, or less than the AMI (area median income).  
We are also designing our homes to be net-zero energy. This is a benefit to both the homeowner AND the environment. While net-zero energy homes are not a new thing, our design philosophy will lean more toward passive strategies (like windows and insulation), rather that large active systems (like solar or wind), while keeping affordability at the forefront. Not only do the passive components tend to have a longer life-cycle, they are also the most versatile when using our building model in diverse climates. 
Our homes will be an average of 1000, efficiently planned, square feet, intended to house the average household size in the U.S. of 2.5.  
WHO WE ARE
Kôr was co-founded by Amy Warren and Jason Offutt. Amy has worked in construction for 14 years. She has lived in Bend for 19 years and has been able to witness its changing housing needs first hand. Amy is has been a student for the last 4 years, and is a recent graduate of Oregon State University's Energy Systems Engineering program. Jason owns Shelter Studio, Inc. in Bend, where he designs sustainable and net-zero energy homes. He is a designer whose primary focus is in renewable energy construction and sustainable design and technologies. He has a BS in Architectural Engineering Technology.

What We Need & What You Get

We are currently raising funds for our first community property.  We have identified a parcel that will accommodate 9-homes.  It is centrally located, lessening the burden of reliable transportation on those who already struggle financially.  The listing price on the property is $135,000.  Every $15,000 we raise represents the property for one more home to sit upon. Each home will house an average of 2-3 people, but some will accommodate more, and some will accommodate less. If we do not raise the full amount, or if some kind soul donates property to us in the mean time, the money will still go toward the development of the community. At the end of the process, we will have a working model for the future that is publicly available to all! 

We are asking for your support!  Help us take care of the folks that take care of us. Help us provide safe housing for those who make our community what it is.  Help us create something that can spur change nationally. We are a non profit and we rely on donations and grants.  Give what you can! Share our campaign!

We are grateful for every donation received.  In addition to the tax benefit for your donation, we are offering the following perks:


  • Donate $30 or more and receive a personal thank you note from our organization
  • Donate $100 or more and you will also receive a personal thank you note, and a custom sticker. 

                                                  

  • Donate $500-$999 and you will receive the above perks plus a Kôr Community Land Trust t-shirt.  (similar to below in male and female sizes s-xl)

                         

  • Donate $1,000 or more and receive the first two perks plus an 18-oz. insulated drinking vessel from our local Bend-based company, Hydro Flask. 

                                                             

  • Donate $5,000 or more and in addition to the first three perks we will engrave your name in the table for our first community gathering area. Your generous contribution will be remembered throughout time by the deserving members who live in the homes you helped make possible. (Table will be commissioned by a local furniture artist with reclaimed wood.)

                     


Other Ways You Can Help

Get the word out and make some noise about our campaign!  The more people who share our mission and vision, the more likely it is that we will find the right individuals to help us achieve them.

If you are interested in volunteering, visit our website at korlandtrust.org to learn more.

Remember, use the Indiegogo share tools!
story_txt:
OUR STORY
The US Census bureau measured Bend’s growth from 2013 to 2014 at 2.7%. This rapid growth further weighs down a pre-existing affordable housing deficit. Teachers, small business owners, nurses, restaurant servers, maintenance workers, grocers, and public servants are consistently priced out of homes within city limits. These people contribute to our city’s thriving economy and provide necessary services, yet Bend’s current economy excludes them from buying homes and having stability. The
median household income in Bend Oregon is approximately $50,000.  The median home cost is $325,000, and the
average home cost is over $500,000.  The
median home cost requires an income of approximately $77,000.  This is 154% of the median income! Without any options on the horizon over half of the people in our town cannot afford to own or buy a home in this market, let alone a safe, healthy, sustainable home. For a population of over 80,000, there were only 51 homes for sale in August which were affordable to those making median income or less. Many of those 51 homes were in various stages of disrepair and would need work done in order to bring them up to today's safety standards. What is the cultural loss if we continue to overlook solutions to the housing crisis? Who will teach your children?  Who will answer the phone when you need dispatch? Who will bag your groceries? Who will serve your latte'?
OUR STORY IS YOUR STORY TOO

Our-town, U.S.A. is not the only one experiencing this problem. The statistics may vary, but the need for affordable housing is the same. Sustainability is also on the forefront of everyone's mind these days, and for good reason. Anthropogenic carbon emissions have never been higher.  As citizens, we can no longer turn a blind eye to either of these issues. At Kôr, we are creating an efficient
living model that can be duplicated in and around Bend where housing issues are prominent, as well as throughout the United States.





 Kôr’s community model differs from other affordable housing solutions for the following reasons:

Kôr is sustainable for current and future generations.
Kôr serves a diverse demographic.
Kôr will build communities instead of individual homes.
Kôr will be deed restricted at re-sale, and thereby create perpetually affordable housing.
We are here to create a solution for Bend, and set an example for our global community at large. 
HOW WE ARE DOING IT
We are building our communities using the Community Land Trust (CLT) model.  A land trust holds property perpetually for a purpose. In the case of a CLT, that purpose is affordable housing. The land trust model
as defined by the National CLT Network is: “a nonprofit
corporation that develops and stewards affordable housing, community gardens,
civic buildings, commercial spaces and other community assets on behalf of a
community.” The CLT traditional model of community owned land and individually owned
homes, allows the homes to be perpetually attainable to those with an income
level at, or less than the AMI (area median income).  We are also designing our homes to be net-zero energy. This is a benefit to both the homeowner AND the environment. While net-zero energy homes are not a new thing, our design philosophy will lean more toward passive strategies (like windows and insulation), rather that large active systems (like solar or wind), while keeping affordability at the forefront. Not only do the passive components tend to have a longer life-cycle, they are also the most versatile when using our building model in diverse climates. Our homes will be an average of 1000, efficiently planned, square feet, intended to house the average household size in the U.S. of 2.5.  WHO WE AREKôr was co-founded by Amy Warren and Jason Offutt. Amy has worked in
construction for 14 years. She
has lived in Bend for 19 years and has been able to witness its changing
housing needs first hand. Amy is has been a student for the last 4 years, and is a recent
graduate of Oregon State University's Energy Systems Engineering program. Jason owns
Shelter Studio, Inc. in Bend, where he designs sustainable and net-zero energy
homes. He is a designer whose primary focus is in renewable energy construction
and sustainable design and technologies. He has a BS in Architectural
Engineering Technology.  What We Need & What You Get We are currently raising funds for our first community property.  We have identified a parcel that will accommodate 9-homes.  It is centrally located, lessening the burden of reliable transportation on those who already struggle financially.  The listing price on the property is $135,000.  Every $15,000 we raise represents the property for one more home to sit upon. Each home will house an average of 2-3 people, but some will accommodate more, and some will accommodate less. If we do not raise the full amount, or if some kind soul donates property to us in the mean time, the money will still go toward the development of the community. At the end of the process, we will have a working model for the future that is publicly available to all! 
We are asking for your support!  Help us take care of the folks that take care of us. Help us provide safe housing for those who make our community what it is.  Help us create something that can spur change nationally. We are a non profit and we rely on donations and grants.  Give what you can! Share our campaign!
We are grateful for every donation received.  In addition to the tax benefit for your donation, we are offering the following perks:



Donate $30 or more and receive a personal thank you note from our organization
Donate $100 or more and you will also receive a personal thank you note, and a custom sticker. 

                                                  

Donate $500-$999 and you will receive the above perks plus a Kôr Community Land Trust t-shirt.  (similar to below in male and female sizes s-xl)

                         

Donate $1,000 or more and receive the first two perks plus an 18-oz. insulated drinking vessel from our local Bend-based company, Hydro Flask. 
                                                             

Donate $5,000 or more and in addition to the first three perks we will engrave your name in the table for our first community gathering area. Your generous contribution will be remembered throughout time by the deserving members who live in the homes you helped make possible. (Table will be commissioned by a local furniture artist with reclaimed wood.)


                     

    
    Other Ways You Can Help Get the word out and make some noise about our campaign!  The more people who share our mission and vision, the more likely it is that we will find the right individuals to help us achieve them.
If you are interested in volunteering, visit our website at korlandtrust.org to learn more.
Remember, use the Indiegogo share tools!

story:
A green low cost house for the world.

QT homes are a cheap green low cost house that is both livable and quick to build. To help tackle the housing shortage in the world we have spent years working on developing a livable yet affordable structure for people around the globe. We need your help to spread our dream to the world.


History

The idea started nearly 4 years ago when our small family business wanted to achieve a low cost house for the population as well as a quick to build structure that could be used for nearly anything. We have been experimenting with the design, and have gone through three generations of built prototypes to come to the revolutionary design we have made today.


After learning from our previous designs we made the current version.


The QT Home


The structure was designed in mind with performing a quick and cheap solution to the expensive housing problem today in this world. However we have found that this design can be transferred to any needs one can think of. 
 ■ Lodges
 ■ Hostel
 ■ Storerooms
 ■ Small office blocks
 ■ Car garage
 ■ Floating house boat
 ■ Holiday home in the woods
 ■ Canvas Structure
 ■ Offsite housing and working facilities
 ■ Clinics
 ■ Emergency disaster housing
 ■ The possibilities are endless

We also wanted to have a house that could be professionally built quickly and after trial runs and experimentation with a trained team the house can be build in less than three days.
The QT home can be built on concrete support, or even just placed on flat ground.
Utilizing stilts for support, the QT home can be placed on any slopes or even raised above the ground and into the air.

Additions and extensions are also all welcome. You can customize your QT home by adding extra length and width at request. For your own personal additions you can add a sundeck, garages, patio, porch.. anything you think of, the QT home is compatible.
As a bonus the house is completely green friendly and all of the materials used can be recycled. The house can also be disassembled and relocated from one position to another.

The product delivered is a flat pack house, which constructed is comprised of a skeletal framework, support beams, external skin,a suspended lower and upper floor overlaid with shutter board plywood ,a stair case and comes with one sliding aluminium door and 4 windows.

Due to the suspended floor design the QT home can be placed on any surface. For example bolted to concrete, placed on stilts, mounted to pontoons or in disaster relief placed on any flat surface. The QT home only has a ground footprint of 24ft by 24ft (6m by 6m).
 
Concept side cutout view

Concept front cut out view

Our dream

We are looking to start production of houses and also work with disaster relief programs all over the world, we know our houses will help those in need to live a better life after a disaster. We want our house to solve their temporary and permanent housing problems.

We also want to expand locally to every state , eventually globally and help create employment for new areas in the globe with our low cost housing. With a few trained professionals our houses can be built easily and quickly for the world's housing needs.

Benefits of using our houses

Our design and materials used makes the house 100% recyclable with no shortcuts taken, As such the QT home is a fire retardant, lightning safe home. Your family or loved ones  would be living in a structurally sound and safe home. The entire construction is so strong that the QT home could be lifted with a crane and relocated with no damage sustained.

There is also the benefit of customizing the QT home.
What we have shown is only the base model, this model can be full customized to suit the needs of the people living in it or the requirements of the business.
The house is fully extendable both length wise and width making for a infinite possibilities of uses for the QT homes.
This will allow for larger homes, workshops , clinics just to name a few.

What would happen if we exceed our target goal?

If we exceeded our target goals, we would be setting up additional factories around the country and globally. We really as a family and company want to help all those who have been affected in natural and man made disasters around the world. We believe that these QT homes are a quick semi and permanent solution to much of the worlds housing problems.

We would also be looking to creating custom solar panels and batteries for the QT home to help alleviate the world's energy problems, by helping to remove people's reliance on non-renewable energy. This would be especially predominate if and when we get our houses to disaster relief locations.



What extra features can be made for the QT home?

The QT home can be fully customized to your preference, Wooden sun decks can be made to suit the exterior. The internal paneling can be changed to wood or metal panels. We will provide the basic house to your specifications and then your house is yours to customize, You can make your home yours.

How can you help?

We are a small family business and we are looking for funding to start a production factory. We have many people interested in the houses however we are lacking the funds to produce the houses on a large scale. We are looking for a fund boost to really step-up our production.

So fund our idea and we can help make the world a better place to live in.

Risks and challenges

We have been working on this design and project for many years now so we have ironed out most of the wrinkles and problems, However there is always room for improvements and innovation and we would always appreciate feedback. To pledge to this project you will be helping us realize an idea and a design which shall help the world.
Manufacturing - As with any manufacturing we need new tools as we move onto a larger scale production, This would help us move forward into a faster time scale on production, but would also require some time to setup.

Ease of Transport - Since this project was designed with a flat pack idea in mind the transport of this QT home is a non issue. All that is needed is a truck to transport the materials and the house is as good as delivered. No need for abnormal trucks or any other awkward transportation method. 
Product adjustments - Custom product adjustments will always slow down the process but to create the best product for the customer has always been our aim.
What happens if we don't reach our goal? - That won't stop us, it will only slow down our production. We still aim to continue the project as we have invested too much time and money to give up a dream.

How can you help us without funding?

Spread the word. We need to expose this QT home to the world and we would like everyone to know. We believe it's a fantastic concept and we want to share it with everyone, and only you can help us. Share our page with your friends, family , your bosses, and your co-workers. Spread the word on social medias, use the Indiegogo share tool to tell everyone. Help us spread our cheap home for everyone.


 Twitter: https://twitter.com/QT_Homes

 Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/QThome

 Youtube: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=-g9xK0afbbs

story:
Summary

The Miriam Loewy Friend Hillel Program at the Winnick Hillel Center for Jewish Life, commonly referred to as Hillel at Syracuse University, serves as the center for Jewish Campus Life for Syracuse University and SUNY ESF (as well as other surrounding institutions of higher education). The Winnick Hillel Center, which opened in 2003, serves the approximately 3000 Jewish students on campus, as well as members of the Syracuse community.

Since the building opened, many things have changed - perhaps with the sole exception of the relic of a TV that serves as a gathering point in the Student Lounge. As movie nights and other multimedia activities become more popular among our students, and as more and more students find our building to be a great place to unwind between classes, the need for a new TV has hit its peak - and that's why we need YOUR help!

The Junior Board of Governors of Hillel at Syracuse University, in conjunction with some graduating student leaders, have decided to turn to a crowdfunding platform to raise the necessary funds to get a new TV. Partner with Hillel today by making a (tax deductible) contribution to help create a more welcoming and functional space for students!


What We Need & What You Get

We've done our research, and have calculated that it will cost about $1,800 dollars to replace the TV in the Student Lounge. This includes approximately:
  • $900 for a new TV (We're planning to get a 60 in. Smart TV, which can be used for innovative new student programming)
  • $900 to renovate the TV cabinet to mount and accommodate the new flat-screen TV.
As a way of saying thank you, we're offering a number of options to be recognized for your donation! We highly encourage you to become a Silver, Gold, or Orange (Go SU!) Level Donor, which means you'll be recognized for your support on a donor plaque that will hang near the new TV. 

For partnering with us at the $720 level, we'll recognize you as one of our Naming Donors, which means your name will be featured prominently on the plaque for all visitors to the Winnick Hillel Center to see!

If we don't reach our entire goal of $1,800, don't worry! Unlike some other crowdfunding sites, Indiegogo will still let us keep the donations you make - and we'll still deliver on the perks - but we'll need to find a way to raise the remaining funds.

As with all donations to Hillel, partnering with us on this campaign is tax deductible. Both Indiegogo and Hillel at SU will send you proof of your contribution.

Other Ways You Can Help

Over 90% of our funding comes from friends of our program like YOU! Want to partner further with Hillel at Syracuse University on other projects to impact Jewish Life on campus? Find more information on how to do so here.

story:
I am an Assyrian Christian from the Middle East. Assyrians history goes back to 6787 and speak the ancient language of Aramaic. They  accepted Christianity as their faith when apostle James evangelized in Ninevah (today's Mosul).  Assyrians are indigenous population in the Middle East. They have been persecuted many times throughout the history for their faith as Christians.

This current persecution will destroy them as a nation.

As we hear on the news every day ISIS is killing, raping, destroying churches and historical artifacts, displacing and selling girls into sex slavery in Iraq and Syria.

The displaced Christians are in desperate need of humanitarian help. They are in desperate  need of food, clothing, medicine, water, sewer system, heaters (during winter season), water & fans (during summer season),

With summer approaching many villages are facing the problem of insufficient  water. This is a request from Nahla village to rehabilitate and clean the irrigation channels there (Bilmand & Kashkawa villages). The total work will cost $12,500. The work includes buying cements, blocks, stones, workers, etc...

Your donation will be sent directly to the Assyrian Aide Society of America via indiegogo. AAS-A is a 501c3 non-profit organization and all donations are tax deductible.

story:
Short Summary

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=jfvzkoInhs4

The biggest storm of our lives happened in Tbilisi, 13th June 2015. 15 people died and many animals from Tbilisi zoo drowned or escaped. Many more are missing. Tons and tons of water relentlessly ripped through the centre of Tbilisi leaving behind only devastation and despair.

We are a group of people who live in the UK and Georgia who want to maximise the potential support locally and globally by raising awareness and money for families who have lost everything. We want to be able to provide shelter and support for zoo animals who now no longer have a home. The links between Georgia and the UK are strong with a tradition of sharing song and culture through exchanges and visits having been established since 1985. We know there are 1000's of people across the UK and the world who want to help and because we have people on the ground who are working with local NGO's and the UNCHR (UN High Commission for Refugees) who can provide both basic food, shelter and materials as well as longer term support, we can provide that help now.

Your backing is important to us. Georgia is a small country, and a poor one. Georgian people  are full of passion and commitment but are overwhelmed and need our help. 50% of monies raised will go to people and  50% to the animals.

The current estimate to re-build is over 40 million dollars. International help has pledged only half of that. Re-building will take time. Your contribution will make a difference now by ensuring that short, medium and long term action can take place by people who live there and will be able to fill the gaps other agencies cannot.

 

The Impact

Your contribution will mean that the now orphaned lion cubs will have somewhere safe to go and some one, with expertise, to look after them. Animals will not be put down because they are so terrified they become dangerous. Instead, bears who have only ever known captivity will not be shot on sight but rather tranquilised and re located to safety.

Your contribution will mean that people who whose homes still lie under 5 metres of water will have some where to stay, and when the water eventually subsides and the mud is cleared away, they will have blankets and beds, clothes and sheets.

Who are we?

Sarah Cobham - UK Spokesperson for the Tbilisi Hippo Fund.

Adrian Scoffham, Founder

Tamara Kozyuk, Communications Director,

Bidzina Kumiashvili, Operations Director

 Luka Popiashvili, Fund Director.

 We are part of a team of people across Georgia and  the world who are all working together to raise awareness of this natural disaster.

Sarah has been involved with Georgia for the past 7 years, raising awareness of social issues and organising successful UK tours for Georgian artists through The Northern Georgian Society. www.northerngeorgiansociety.co.uk

Adrian has been involved with Georgia for the past 2 years.

Tamara lives in Tbilisi and was previously engaged doing PR in Ukraine for major companies and movements in the country.

Bidzina is a Georgian businessman who has lived and worked in the US. 

Luka is a Georgian Citizen working for one of the largest banks and previously studied and worked in the UK.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you don't feel you can donate that's fine. But please help us to spread the word by telling people or sharing this information. Every little bit helps and we  so grateful to everyone who sends us positive thoughts as much as those who donate time and  money.
story_txt:
Short Summary
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=jfvzkoInhs4
The biggest storm of our lives happened in Tbilisi, 13th June 2015. 15 people died and many animals from Tbilisi zoo drowned or escaped. Many more are missing. Tons and tons of water relentlessly ripped through the centre of Tbilisi leaving behind only devastation and despair.
We are a group of people who live in the UK and Georgia who want to maximise the potential support locally and globally by raising awareness and money for families who have lost everything. We want to be able to provide shelter and support for zoo animals who now no longer have a home. The links between Georgia and the UK are strong with a tradition of sharing song and culture through exchanges and visits having been established since 1985. We know there are 1000's of people across the UK and the world who want to help and because we have people on the ground who are working with local NGO's and the UNCHR (UN High Commission for Refugees) who can provide both basic food, shelter and materials as well as longer term support, we can provide that help now.
Your backing is important to us. Georgia is a small country, and a poor one. Georgian people  are full of passion and commitment but are overwhelmed and need our help. 50% of monies raised will go to people and  50% to the animals. 
The current estimate to re-build is over 40 million dollars. International help has pledged only half of that. Re-building will take time. Your contribution will make a difference now by ensuring that short, medium and long term action can take place by people who live there and will be able to fill the gaps other agencies cannot. 
    The Impact
Your contribution will mean that the now orphaned lion cubs will have somewhere safe to go and some one, with expertise, to look after them. Animals will not be put down because they are so terrified they become dangerous. Instead, bears who have only ever known captivity will not be shot on sight but rather tranquilised and re located to safety.
Your contribution will mean that people who whose homes still lie under 5 metres of water will have some where to stay, and when the water eventually subsides and the mud is cleared away, they will have blankets and beds, clothes and sheets.
Who are we?
Sarah Cobham - UK Spokesperson for the Tbilisi Hippo Fund.
Adrian Scoffham, Founder
Tamara Kozyuk, Communications Director, 
Bidzina Kumiashvili, Operations Director
 Luka Popiashvili, Fund Director.
 We are part of a team of people across Georgia and  the world who are all working together to raise awareness of this natural disaster.
Sarah has been involved with Georgia for the past 7 years, raising awareness of social issues and organising successful UK tours for Georgian artists through The Northern Georgian Society. www.northerngeorgiansociety.co.uk
Adrian has been involved with Georgia for the past 2 years.
Tamara lives in Tbilisi and was previously engaged doing PR in Ukraine for major companies and movements in the country.
Bidzina is a Georgian businessman who has lived and worked in the US. 
Luka is a Georgian Citizen working for one of the largest banks and previously studied and worked in the UK.
   Other Ways You Can HelpIf you don't feel you can donate that's fine. But please help us to spread the word by telling people or sharing this information. Every little bit helps and we  so grateful to everyone who sends us positive thoughts as much as those who donate time and  money.

story:
Was wir haben

- Internetseite

- Abroller

- Sticker in 6 Farben

- FOOD STICKER GbR

- Markenanmeldung ( International )

- Designschutz ( International )

- Gebrauchsmusterschutz ( International )


Was wir benötigen

- Drucker ( Jörg LablWeb 220 ) ca. 13.000€

- Werbepartner 

- Werbeaktion ca.12.000€



FOOD-STICKER verschafft endlich Klarheit und benutzt         zudem die Fläche eines der Meistverkauften                                      Fastfood Gerichten als Werbeplatz.                                                                                                                                   Jeder profitiert durch den FOOD-STICKER 

  • Der Endverbraucher wird über den Inhalt sowie die Herkunft des Produktes informiert und bekommt zusätzlich dank der Werbung darauf noch nützliche Informationen.
  • Der Ladenbesitzer kann seinen Laden auf seinen Produkten Vermarkten, der Verbraucher ist über den Inhalt bestens informiert und zudem bietet er noch eine Werbefläche auf seinem Produkt für Dritte an.
  •    Der Werbekunde hat die Chance, dass seine Werbung für wenig Geld  in die verschiedensten                         Hände und direkt vor Augen gelangt.                                ( Haushalte, Firmen, Büros, Schulen )


Im Grunde ist der FOOD-STICKER startklar für den Markt, hilf Du dabei den Startschuss zu geben und die neue Idee ins Rollen zu bringen. 
Wie bereits erwähnt, jeder wird davon profitieren. 
Bei finanzieller Untersützung bekommst Du ein exklusives FOOD-STICKER T-Shirt und wirst namentlich auf www.food-sticker.de als Unterstützer aufgeführt.
Zudem hast Du die Chance, wenn Du einen Werbepartner empfiehlst prozentual an der Werbeaktion beteiligt zu werden. (Die Höhe der Beteiligung kommt auf den Unterstützungsgrad an und wird vorher verhandelt).
Wenn Du nicht die finanziellen Mittel zur Verfügung hast um uns zu Unterstützen, dann bitten wir Dich darum unsere Kampagne und den FOOD-STICKER in deinem Umfeld bekannt zu machen.

Vielen Dank

story:
Our Story

American Foundation for Cardiomyopathy is a non-profit organization who's energy and focus is to lessen the effects of sudden cardiac arrest associated with Cardiomyopathy.  Our founder and executive director, Anthony Miller, almost lost his life to HCM and continues to battle this disease daily.  

We have seen and felt the destruction that sudden cardiac arrest can cause on a victims family and friends, and because of this personal connection to this deadly condition, we are committed to this fight.



Where will your dollars go?

In many cases, saving the life of a sudden cardiac arrest victim is  a simple as utilizing an Automated External Defibrillators (AED).  In a heart emergency every second counts.  AED's are critical in the fight to save lives.   Thats why your donation with go to help purchase AED's for as many schools, community centers and places of worship as possible.

An Automatic External Defibrillator is an extremely small and light electronic device that is extremely portable and has been designed to analyze and monitor the heart rhythm of a person who is in cardiac arrest and send a shock through their chest wall to their heart whenever needed in order to shock their heart back into rhythm. An Automatic External Defibrillator is made of a battery, some electronic circuitry and adhesive electrode pads that are placed on the patient’s chest. AEDs look much like small briefcases and are one of the safest yet most effective ways of dealing with cardiac arrest.

story:
Jesspresso Boutique Coffee has been relying on the generosity (and sometimes displeasure) of the founders parents to deliver coffee, and tow the espresso trailer, around the local area and on interstate business trips. So we're in the market for an awesome new vehicle.

We've got our eyes set on a 2015 Mitsubishi Outlander PHEV, aka a plug in hybrid electric vehicle. It has plenty of room to transport all our sacks and boxes of coffee, and will be more than capable enough to tow our espresso trailer. All the while emitting no harmful pollutants into the atmosphere.

We pride ourselves on being a green company and use environmentally sustainable and ethical products wherever possible. All our takeaway packing, for instance, is biodegradable and compostable. Our coffees are certified to be a selection of Farm Direct, Fair Trade, Rainforest Alliance, Bird Friendly, Organic and Bio Latina.

We need this vehicle to help us get on our feet and expand our business.

story:
Your contributions will be a part of planting 1000 trees, giving fair job to women in Pakistan (especially widows and divorced) to handloom the traditional organic wool and sending their children to school free of cost. Support the campaign in a cause where fashion would bring meaning and hope to many lives.

From cars to furniture, clothes, electronics; today companies deliberately design products with a limited useful time so you have to buy same thing again. And again. Sales feeds on Obsolescence, clearing the stock to make room for the next generation of obsolete stock. Companies have successfully planted in the consumer the desire to earn something a little newer, a little shinier and a little sooner than necessary. The result is that you are forced into an everlasting cycle of replacing, repurchasing and repeating.

In past, we have stood by our common sense approach of living better, with less that lasts longer.

While many of us want to update our wardrobe every season, how many people can actually afford more than one pair of shirt, jeans, shoes and socks? Why should everything be disposable? With every purchase, why companies have lowered our expectations. Since when fashion compromised the quality?

Goodwill PURE WOOLEN clothing will grow with you, getting softer & snuggly-er with every wear, stacking up all the adventurous stories every great winter. It is guaranteed to last 15 years and all items backed with free mending, as we value our customers more than anything.

Our coarse cloth will be dyed in three colors: Raven black, smoke gray and pecan brown.

OUR STORY

All the designs which will incorporate everything available in all sizes. Our sustainable textile fashion is about a strong and nurturing relationship between consumer and producer. These local products inspire and challenge the community while at the same time creating jobs and making use of local resources.

Wool has been used since the beginning of man-kind as the best alternative to keep warmest in the coldest of seasons. The air pockets in wool fibers are more deeply protected with natural shape of the springy fibers, the sheathed outer coating of the fiber, and the natural wool oils.  So even when wool is sopping wet-- so wet you can wring it out-- there are still insulating air pockets inside the fiber doing their best to help keep you warm.  The water cannot get into the interior of the fiber. Wool can absorb 30% of its weight in water without feeling damp to the touch. There is actually a degree of heat generated by wool. 

Tailors favor wool for suit jackets because wool clothes hold their shape and last a long time. 

Many of the pesticides used to treat animals on non-organic farms are toxic to humans. 

Our Inspiration:

Ancient Pagan Tribe of Pakistan known for their ever-lasting, top notch quality, 100% organic hand-woven and sewn kimono-robes. They have used the unique method for past 1000 years and define 'Fashion' as a way to adapt bodies, environments, climates and situations not the other way round. 

Featuring Style (Unisex)

Additional Features:

Nature-Friendly:

Special Offer for Women:

SIZES CHART IS COMING SOON! 

All stress seams are reinforced with a mock safety stitch for extreme durability. We begin by overlapping the pieces, then sewing it down on both exposed edges (first with a cover stitch, essentially a series of tiny knots that if broken along their chain maintain integrity elsewhere, then a double-needle) to make sure they're never coming undone. It's flat on the inside, and looks almost like piping on the outside. You will not find this on lesser-made garments.

“We can also interpret nature more metaphorically and pursue textile and fashion designs that promote flexibility, lightness or a sense of wonder, or those that speak of balance, community values or engagement and playfulness.” (Chapman, 2007)

Please leave your suggestions, comments and feedback at: urooj.ashraf@zarrindokht.com

Follow us at:

https://twitter.com/goodwill_times

story:
EXECUTIVE SUMMARY

The Founder, Alexander Klaus lost his "Labrador Dog" 8 months ago. It was a devastating experience for him and his family. The dog was never recovered. As a result his technical team started to put some research on this issue and found a way to develop and manufacture the first functional GPS Kids & Petfinder that works WORLDWIDE.


After spreading the word many parents asked us, if we could make the Tracker multifunctional also for children. 

November 2015 we launched the development of the Kids & Petfinder that works worldwide. It is simple to handle and has a battery lifetime of 4 weeks before charging it like an iPhone. It is waterproof, its weight is less than 60g and works with a GPS chip and Sim Card.  

Grab your Chance and choose a Perk, receive this Cap:

We have invested over $ 300,000 into this great opportunity and we are giving you the chance to be a part of the success story. We know that we are not the first to develop Tracking devices,  but we are the first that make it function worldwide.

MISSION

We do not like the media to report about lost pets or missing children or old people. We want nobody to get lost or missing. It is a nightmare for every parent or petowner searching for their loved ones. Imagine 23% of all lost pets or 18% of the missing children are never recovered or found. Our mission is to reduce these numbers dramatically. That is the reason why the Finder has to work worldwide. You need to be able to track your loved ones everywhere without any limitations. You must be able to display the complete tracking history, the distance or even have the ability to communicate with your kid or pet.

PRODUCT

With thousands of pets and children going missing every day and with a very small number of them being recovered, losing your loved ones can be a devastating experience. A cat or a dog is more than just a pet; too many of our cats and dogs are friends and members of the family – someone we truly love and care about. Missing your child is the worst thing that can happen to a mother or a dad. Even 5 minutes are too much, the blood pressure jumps and the fear of nver seeing your child again is really something horrible.

If you are tired of existing tracking products being marketed to you as pet or child friendly, even though they were originally designed for dogs, keys or even cars, then we have good news for you! We are developing the UAE KIDS & PETFINDER – the first ULTRA-LIGHT-GPS SYSTEM THAT WORKS WORLDWIDE WIHTOUT ANY LIMITS.

DETAILS

Over the past months the Kids & Petfinder team has spent a considerable amount of time analyzing pets and children..

At the same time we have done extensive research and pioneer work in the field of energy-efficient technology for “GPS-tracking”. Thanks to this we have managed to successfully make the base for the development of a fully functional, ultra-light and highly accurate precision high-tech GPS system.

The collar will be fully engineered and designed in Dubai and Germany.

The Kids & Petfinder GPS system is extremely small and slim  and will be super light, weighing just over 60g.

In addition to extensive battery life, a small weight is the biggest challenge in manufacturing a GPS system. From the beginning it is our ambitious goal to develop a collar that weighs less than 60 grams. Any collar weighing more than 90 grams is not suitable  to wear comfortably and you should stay away from it, no matter how tempting it may be.


BATTERY LIFETIME 4 WEEKS

The energy supply of a GPS system is a seemingly irresolvable problem. Long operational periods result in high energy usage. Therefore, a big battery is needed which inevitably leads to a heavy and bulky GPS collar. Thanks to our team and expert partner we have found an energy-efficient technology for micro GPS-tracking solution to this problem.

SAFETY

Of course, the safety of your child or pet is paramount and the Kids & Petfinder GPS collar will come with a safety release which opens instantly should your child or pet ever get caught somewhere. We use commercially available and proven safety releases since we do not want to risk your child's or pet’s health.

APP & WEBSITE

You can easily configure and manage the Kids & Petfinder GPS through our web-portal. Your child or pet is tagged on the digital map to allow you to follow the movements at any time. Set safety and danger zones around your house, adjust the alert messaging service, manage account access rights of family members or check the current battery charge among many other things. 

DIGITAL MAP

Easily monitor your child or pets’ whereabouts via Google Maps from any place at any time. The covered distance is traced constantly and can be accessed and analyzed at any chosen time. This allows you to gather a variety of statistical data about your child or pet. The child or pets walking area or his/her favorite hiding places are just a couple of examples. Have you ever wondered how many meters or even kilometers your cat/dog covers in a day, a month or a year or how fast he is when he’s or she is on the move? How large is your cat’s/dogs territory? Or are you curious if your cat/dog occasionally gets snacks at your neighbor’s house? Where is the schoolbus of my child? Is my child on the playground? 


Our future dedicated smartphone application is free and available for Apple and Android. It offers easy access to the most important features of the GPS collar. All the features of the Kids & Petfinder GPS collar are also available via web-browser and on any computer with internet access.

WHAT COMES WITH THE SYSTEM

In order to track your child or pet you will need a:

·  Kids & Petfinder GPS collar

·  Kids & Petfinder HomeStation (Receiver and Charger)

·  computer with internet connection (for initial setup)

·  wireless router (WLAN or WiFi)

·  computer, smartphone or tablet with internet connection for tracking

·  no monthly service subscription

- you only pay for the device, App and tracking is free of charge

WHAT YOU ADDITIONALY NEED

You need to buy a domestic SIM Card with a monthly DATA Package. For the GPS Kids & Petfinder you will need a data volume of max. 50 Megabyte per month. Usage 24/7. Depending on where you are located this would cost you monthly appx. $ 10 - $ 30. 

HOW DOES IT WORK

The GPS signal is received by the Kids &  Petfinder GPS collar that your child or pet wears. The GPS coordinates are then transmitted to the Kids &  Petfinder Home Station (receiver). The coordinates are forwarded through the internet connection to the Kids & Petfinder server. The server is then accessed via Smartphone, computer or tablet to locate your pet.

Tracks of your chld or pet are recorded constantly. This ensures that you will find your cat even in areas without reception.

COMPANY & MANAGEMENT

The Manufacturer: UAE Kids & Petfinder LLC operates fully since 7th May 2013  under German Management. It is based in Chicago (Suite 4250, 155 North Wacker Drive, Chicago, IL 60606)

constantly and can be accessed and analyzed at any chosen time. This allows you
to gather a variety of statistical data about your child or pet. The child or pets walking area
or his/her favorite hiding places are just a couple of examples. Have you ever
wondered how many meters or even kilometers your cat/dog covers in a day, a
month or a year or how fast he is when he’s or she is on the move? How large is
your cat’s/dogs territory? Or are you curious if your cat/dog occasionally gets
snacks at your neighbor’s house? Where is the schoolbus of my child? Is my child on the playground? 
Our future dedicated smartphone application is
free and available for Apple and Android. It offers easy access to the most
important features of the GPS collar. All the features of the Kids & Petfinder GPS
collar are also available via web-browser and on any computer with internet
access.
WHAT COMES WITH THE SYSTEM
In order to track your child or pet you will need a:
· 
Kids & Petfinder GPS collar
· 
Kids & Petfinder HomeStation (Receiver and
Charger)
· 
computer with internet connection (for initial
setup)
· 
wireless router (WLAN or WiFi)
· 
computer, smartphone or tablet with internet
connection for tracking
·  no monthly service subscription- you only pay for the device, App and tracking is free of chargeWHAT YOU ADDITIONALY NEEDYou need to buy a domestic SIM Card with a monthly DATA Package. For the GPS Kids & Petfinder you will need a data volume of max. 50 Megabyte per month. Usage 24/7. Depending on where you are located this would cost you monthly appx. $ 10 - $ 30. 
HOW DOES IT WORK
The GPS signal is received by the Kids &  Petfinder
GPS collar that your child or pet wears. The GPS coordinates are then transmitted to
the Kids &  Petfinder Home Station (receiver). The coordinates are forwarded
through the internet connection to the Kids & Petfinder server. The server is then
accessed via Smartphone, computer or tablet to locate your pet.
Tracks of your chld or pet are recorded constantly.
This ensures that you will find your cat even in areas without reception.COMPANY & MANAGEMENT
The Manufacturer: UAE Kids & Petfinder LLC operates fully since 7th May
2013  under German Management. It is based in Chicago (Suite 4250, 155 North Wacker Drive, Chicago, IL 60606)

story:
“Beautiful Iconz” celebrating NZ’s unique ecology

10% of EVERY DOLLAR you contribute will go to "Forest & Bird, Giving Nature a Voice” an amazing non-profit protects NZ environment and wildlife-- www.forestandbird.org.nz 

These sculptural reliefs capture New Zealand's amazing beauty. I'm introducing them to the tourist industry as a way for visitors to remember and appreciate this unique country. I’ve selected three “snapshots” from the North Island and created small-scale 3D landscapes. This first one is of TANE MAHUTA, The King of the Forest, a 2000 year old Kauri Tree (3”/7.6cm x 7”/17.6cm).   

         

As an American who began hiking and climbing in the 60’s and never stopped, New Zealand has offered a gorgeous new frontier. This country evolved far away from other continents with a unique and mesmerisingly beautiful ecology, fauna and flora, with dramatic coastlines and a geological history like no other place in the world

          

The second Image is of LION’S ROCK at PIHA BEACH on the West Coast of Auckland, the famous surf beach and home of the TV show, “Piha Rescue” (2 11/16”/6.8cm x 5  1/8”/13cm). I wanted to capture the beloved wildness of the Westcoast, the black sand beach, the storminess and power of the surf... and make the piece reminiscent of oriental lacquer work.

        

     

The last image in the current series is of RANGITOTO ISLAND in the AUCKLAND HARBOUR which is a young volcanic cone which sits majestically at the mouth of the harbour (5”/12.6cm x 2  1/2”/6.2cm). The island itself is a nature sanctuary and has no buildings. I was aiming for the expansive openness of the harbour, the water and sky, the sunlight on the beach. It’s framed by branches of the ever-present   Pohutukawa tree.


TECHNIQUE: The original images are developed in plasticine clay

then cast in a ceramic-like product called Forton

       

then individually painted with glazes of oil paint and coats of wax

       

Here’s the  product range at this point: Tane Mahuta (“emerald green", “deep forest green”);  Piha (“black sand”, “sienna”);  Rangitoto (“antique turquoise”, “sunlight”, “azure blue”)

PLEASE HELP ME GROW 

AND ADVANCE MY BUSINESS so that these images are widely available both to visitors and to local residents (who are deeply in love and proud of their country and who spend most of their holidays either tramping or at the beach.)

What I Need ($1,500) & What That Will Cover

* THE COST OF BRINGING THE RELIEFS TO ALL THE LOCAL OUTLETS, SMALL GALLERIES, HIGH-END GIFT STORES AND MUSEUM SHOPS IN AUCKLAND, WELLINGTON AND CHRISTCHURCH

* 2 DIES CUT FOR NEW BOXES ($300 EACH BOX)

          

* THE PURCHASE OF CASTING RUBBER,  MORE STAINLESS STEEL STANDS, FORTON AND OIL PAINT

* THE COST OF TWO SALES TRIPS TO BRING THE RELIEFS TO THE BAY OF ISLANDS AND THE NORTHLAND

*ONCE THE SALES OF THESE INITIAL IMAGES ARE ESTABLISHED I WANT TO SCULPT NEW IMAGES, SOUTH OF AUCKLAND CITY AND PARTICULARLY OF THE SOUTH ISLAND

PERKS

Here’s that “rainbow" of experimental colours (for contributions of $100 or more)

My Background 

I’ve been an artist all my life and have had diverse work experience: designing and building fine furniture in Fiji and inter-active children’s museum exhibits in LA and NYC, illustrating children’s books in LA and Auckland and working in Hollywood as a professional storyboard artist. But I keep returning to bas-relief because it combines two and three dimensions so mysteriously. I find the nuances and possibilities of "story-telling" in bas relief very fascinating. Currently I sell bas relief portraits on the Internet and am developing a graphic novel.  

My Vision

The earth is our home and it needs to be honoured, protected and sustainably managed. I feel that these reliefs are a small step in that big direction. When a critical mass of people become stewards of the earth, instead of unconscious consumers of the earth’s resources, then we’ll begin a necessary, truly cooperative and tolerant era.

The Team

Joep, marketing mastermind and designer of the stainless steel stands

Your contributions OF ANY AMOUNT will make all the difference, allow me to build this business and expand the line of bas reliefs


THE Challenge

This project has forced me to get out of the studio and onto the streets! --TO BE EXPANSIVE AND CONSTANTLY POSITIVE RATHER THAN A BIT OF A RECLUSE...... I have valued all the practical challenges, but especially this emotional demand to share myself openly WITH LOVING ENERGY and to transcend self-doubt. THE RECEPTION HAS BEEN SO GENUINE AND WARM that it’s really encouraging. Sometimes when I show the reliefs, shop keepers are just silent, kind of speechless, and say they have never seen anything like it. Your contributions will allow me to continue to make them available and to develop new images.

(MY GOAT LOVES THEM TOO)

Other Ways You Can Help

PLEASE get the word out and make noise about my campaign. www.facebook.com/beautifuliconz

Your contributions OF ANY AMOUNT will make all the difference, allow me to build this business and expand the line of bas reliefs
 
THE Challenge

I have valued all the practical challenges, but especially this emotional demand to share myself openly WITH LOVING ENERGY and to transcend self-doubt. THE RECEPTION HAS BEEN SO GENUINE AND WARM that it’s really encouraging. story:
Vision

At OneRide we strive to create a culture around peloton (from the French word platoon) bicycle riding; holding each other up to an upbeat, fast-paced, high energy workout, riding as a pack. To fulfill our mission we strive to be a respected member of the community we call home through engagement and charity.

Importance of Giving Back

OneRide wants to give back and be a part of the community. At least five rides a month will be charity dedicated rides with the proceeds donated to a local charity. This is a key tenant of the OneRide vision. We are one community!

Market Opportunity

The East Lansing market is full of male and female millennials looking for a unique and fun workout or the next big trend in fitness, including almost 49,000 students and additional 11,000 faculty. This business-type is unique to the area and appeals to millennials (average age in East Lansing is 21.6 years). The concept is at a lower price point than existing individualized fitness studios, to appeal to college-aged students and a community with a median family household income of approximately $80,000. There is a high concentration of fitness studios in the area but no individual cycling studios in the market. The concept of an individual fitness focused studio has been tested and proven repeatedly in this area and others through individual fitness activities such as: yoga, Crossfit, karate, dance, etc. The concept of a cycling dedicated studio has proven successful in urban key markets such as, DC and New York, through recognized brands: SoulCycle, FlyWheel and Ride. By bringing a similar concept down to a lower price point, the same experience that is popular in these metropolitan areas can be affordable for millennials in a large college community with disposable income. The average cost of a similar (but not the same) fitness class in the market currently is between 10 and 15 dollars. Not only does OneRide look to compete on price; they are able to offer a unique experience with value in going outside of a traditional membership model.

We Need Your Help

Help support taking our dream to reality! Any amount helps ; large or small. Please share this with people you know, so we can reach our funding goals and get this show on the road!
