story:
***If you cannot view the video, it may be due to an ad blocker on your device.  You will need to opt out of the ad blocking and refresh your page***


From local food trailer to full-feature, family-friendly restaurant: 

AJs Wings is looking to spread its wings in Portales, New Mexico – help support our project and receive some great swag and perks!

We are looking for the support of the High Plains community to help us raise the required capital for our own store front right here in Portales!

As a backer of our project you will receive awesome perks ranging from free food and event catering, to t-shirts, hats and even naming your own sauce!  See our complete list of available perks to the right! 

 

Check back often for updates and promotional offerings!


And don't forget to tell your friends! You can click the social media links to the left to share on Facebook and Twitter or create your own link to send via email!  We will be running a promotional contest rewarding the backers that refer the most support to our campaign!

FROM LOCAL FOOD TRAILER TO FULL-FEATURE, FAMILY-FRIENDLY RESTAURANT: 

AJs Wings is looking to spread its wings in Portales, New Mexico – help support our project and receive some great swag and perks!

The world of food can be a very exciting one. People dine together while enjoying each other’s company. While experiencing different flavors and savoring traditional local dishes or exotic ones, we are able to relax, reconnect with others, and let go of the stresses of our day-to-day lives. A delicious meal can provide the perfect occasion for a family get-together or reuniting of friends. All in all, it can be a rewarding experience, one that we wish to re-live regularly…not to mention the fact that those cooking and serving great food have the pleasure of knowing their efforts are paying off with satisfied customers.

In Portales, New Mexico, the world of food is exciting, however it is somewhat limited in its choices. At AJ’s Wings, we understand the need for fun places to go out to relax, eat a great meal, and gather with family and friends. We truly believe that a new restaurant would be heartily and enthusiastically welcomed here in Portales. Presently, AJ’s operates a mobile food unit in and around town, serving the best chicken wings, strips, sauces and mozzarella sticks this side of the Rio Grande! We have a growing, loyal clientele who surely would love a permanent place to kick back, enjoy some wings and refreshment, and relax after a long day.

Presently, we operate only on weekends, but the response from the public has been extremely positive in the 2 ½ years AJ’s has been in business. Because of this successful experience, we would now like to build on that success by opening a full-feature, quick serve, family-friendly restaurant in Portales. 

As for our trailer, we would continue to serve our amazing customers from our mobile food unit, serving Cannon AFB as well as operating at several special events throughout the year.

Our vision for AJ’s is to present a quick-service but high quality restaurant with a casual air. Our hope is for an indoor capacity of 50 people or more as well as offering additional seating with an outdoor patio or sidewalk café area where as many folks as possible can come to enjoy our fabulous food and visit with friends. Customers at AJ’s restaurant will be able to enjoy locally brewed beer on tap, TVs for watching sporting events, a comfortable atmosphere , extended hours, and the same friendly service you have come to expect from AJ‘s.

On the “business” side of things, AJ’s expansion will provide new job opportunities for local residents as well as stimulate the Portales and Roosevelt County economies to some extent. As much as we possibly can, we will incorporate local foods and products, thereby assisting other local operations in the process.  As an employer, AJ's philosophy is to offer our staff a living wage in addition to mutual trust and respect. We hope our employees will love coming to work because we will encourage work life balance and employee well being.  

In order to accomplish this vision, we are seeking to raise at least $50,000 for the purpose of acquiring an existing downtown building, remodeling the dining and kitchen areas, leasing and installing kitchen equipment and providing suitable furnishings to create this special place that we want to provide to the residents of Portales.

1.) Taking a look at the fabulous perks we are offering in exchange for your support of our project. You will be helping to grow a simple but popular mobile food unit into a restaurant reality in Portales, New Mexico!


AND


2.) Sharing this campaign with friends and family to maximize the potential of this campaign to support the creation of a fresh new dining environment in the little town of Portales, NM
Thank you so much for your loyal support and for considering this vision with us.

We hope to soon be serving you and your friends at our new location in downtown Portales.

We have a very specific vision for our building, and while we have a handful of locations in mind, we will take the time to acquire the building that will bring us as close to that vision as possible.

1.) Location, Location, Location:  

We hope to take possession of a building that is in or near the downtown/square area.  If this is not possible, we prefer to be closer to the ENMU campus than farther away.  We also want to find a location with adequate parking and with optimal size to allow for an indoor seating capacity of around 50.

2.) Open Kitchen: 

As we envision being a quick-service restaurant, the kitchen will not be closed off from the dining area.  Our service counter will essentially be the only divide between the seating and cooking areas.  This will provide our customers with a unique atmosphere that involves everyone in the process of cooking their meals.

3.) Casual Quick Service:  

With an open kitchen layout, the dining area will be immersed in the everyday traffic.  As people come and go, they will be able to stop and enjoy their meal at one of our tables or along the far counter.  TVs will provide entertainment, usually sporting events, and we hope to have cold beer available for those looking to unwind a little.

4.) Outdoor Patio:  

One thing that Portales does not offer is an outdoor eating option.  We would like to change this by building a patio where customers can choose to enjoy our awesome wings basking in the gorgeous High Plains sunshine or relaxing under the stars.  Our patio build would include a sound retaining wall to help reduce noise for the neighboring businesses, a fire pit to gather around during the evening, and a small stage for us to showcase local talent and live music.


We have chosen our funding option to be what Indiegogo refers to as Flexible Funding.  This means that we will retain all funds that we receive from backers even if we do not hit our project goal of at least $50,000.  We decided to go this route as we feel that if we fall short of our goal for opening a store, we can still expand our operations by acquiring a larger/newer trailer that would better suite our customers and their growing hunger for great chicken wings.

With that being said, we have set the following goals for this project:

Raise $0:  While we find this to be highly unlikely given the level of interest we have received from our customers, it is still a possibility.  If we raise no funds for this project we will continue to operate as we have for the past 2 1/2 years, serving lunch at Cannon AFB, slinging wings on the weekend in the Goobers parking lot, and attending various events throughout the year.

Raise $1 - $5K:  This level of funding will allow us to make renovations to our current trailer including, but not limited to, new fryers, new sink and plumbing, upgraded cooling capacity and general maintenance.

Raise $6K - $25K: This level of funding will allow us to look into acquiring a newer trailer with a larger capacity that will better suite our needs. This would allow us to expand our menu offerings to include new sauces and menu items.

Raise $26k - $50K:  This is the minimum level of funds required to realistically consider going forward with a store.  Given the upfront cost and our desire to remain outside traditional funding as much as possible, we would need to reach this level of support to begin work on a permanent location.

Raise $51K and Up:  Any amount above and beyond our funding goal of $50K will allow us to expedite projects such as our patio build

If our project sounds like the kind of restaurant that you would like to visit and where you would like to enjoy great food with friends and family then we invite you to take a look at the great perks that we have on offer our backers in return for helping us turn our vision into reality!

My name is Aaron Crandall, and I am the founder and sole owner of AJs Wings.  After being laid off in March of 2013 and having zero luck with employment opportunities, I turned to an idea with huge potential, but that would require an immense amount of work and dedication.  Armed with a business degree and a 20lb electric fryer, AJs Wings was born!  After a single car show in Clovis, we teamed up with Goobers in Portales to sell chicken wings to their customers. 

With hours of work put into a converted stock trailer, we began with just chicken wings and fries, all cooked from that single 20lb electric fryer.  Our capacity limit was about 12 wings at once.   Over time we have made several changes, including the addition of two 50lb propane fryers, which allowed us to step up to the increased demand.

As a father of 4 amazing children, who mean the world to me, AJs Wings has become my means of providing for them.  My team is comprised entirely of family members: My Dad, Gary; My Mom, Diane; My Brother, Joseph.  They have been a tremendous help in making sure AJs keeps up with our growing demand.

This project is immensely important to me because I want AJs Wings to give back to the community by creating jobs, bringing an exciting new venue to Portales and allowing others to benefit from the success that I have had!

The success we have had is in part due to our philosophy of staying small with a minimal menu, yet serving generous portions, providing great customer service, and, of course, thanks to our awesome customers!

We feel that the institutions that provide traditional funding tend to concern themselves too much with their own bottom line.  Instead of helping a major bank increase its profits we prefer to keep our customers involved in our growth opportunity by providing great perks in return for financial backing.  By doing this we will be able to keep our prices low while maintaining a livable wage and work-life balance for our employees, and giving back to our community. 


We know we can't do this without the help of our loyal customers and the support of our local community.  And we certainly would not ask for your backing without offering something in return.  For your generous contribution we have a variety of perks available ranging from
free food and event catering, to t-shirts, hats and even naming your own sauce!

This project will not only allow us to open a store in Portales, 
but will also provide the following benefits to our community:

A family-friendly atmosphere suitable for all ages.  


A new place for friends to gather with an 
outdoor patio/open air seating area.


A focus on local economy:  
We will use as many ingredients from local merchants as possible to ensure that our success is enabling the success of others in our community as well! 


These items will include, when available, produce, fresh tortillas, and craft beers.


All branded merchandise will be acquired from local merchants.  Your backing will not only support our project, but will also support several different merchants in the Portales/Clovis area.  
This is only one of the ways we are encouraging growth in our community.


Another way we will help stimulate the economy is by providing between 4-10 paid positions, to be filled by local residents.  We will provide a livable wage for all positions we create, which hopefully will elevate our employees' standard of living, and in turn, generate economic growth.


Help us build a permanent location where we can 
continue to provide you with the  great food 
and excellent service that you've come to love!



Our goal with this campaign is to raise as much of the required funding as possible.  However, starting any business (especially a restaurant) is not cheap, and every business venture comes with unforeseen obstacles.  With that in mind, we know there will be some challenges to overcome:

- Securing the building and location that best fits our vision:  In order to secure the building we will need either a long term lease, to borrow the funds to purchase, or purchase outright with funds from this campaign.  Our vision is very specific and we have a handful of locations in mind that would meet most of the requirements.

- Additional remodeling or electrical/plumbing requirements: We have crunched the numbers hundreds of times and we feel that we have accounted for just about anything that could go wrong during this process.  However, we will not know exactly what we are dealing with until we get started on revamping our space.  Issues could include delays due to weather, supply issues, unforeseen plumbing problems, required electrical updates, etc.  If you've ever done any type of remodel, you know that these types of challenges could potentially cause major headaches.

- Obtaining the proper licensing: As much as we would love to serve beer with our amazing wings, there will be several hoops to jump through regarding the proper licensing.  This will take some time and may delay our ability to serve.  However, we do not feel that this will take away from our vision and what we are striving to achieve.  We understand the in-depth process and reasoning for such regulations and will do our part to serve safely and responsibly.

- Overwhelming response:  While we certainly want to see as much support as possible, there is the chance we will simply be overwhelmed by the support we receive.  If we are lucky enough to face this challenge it could lead to delayed shipping and processing of perks to our backers.  During such an event, we will do our best to openly communicate with all of our supporters so that everyone will knows what to expect as we sort out the details.

Share, share, share!

We understand that not everyone is able to contribute financially.  Regardless of your contribution level, we ask that you please share this campaign with your friends and social media followers to give us the best opportunity to meet our goal and begin work on what will prove to be a special addition to the High Plains area!  Make some noise about AJs Wings and let your friends know how they can help as well!  We know we have the best customers in the world, and we have faith that you will do everything you can to help us bring our vision to life!  In the top left corner of this campaign you will find the share buttons so you can help spread the word!

We know that our project will not be successful without the help of our backers.  So we are offering a referral contest that will reward you just for sharing our project with your friends!  Its easy to enter:

Step 1: Create or log in to your IndieGoGo Account

Step 2:  Share this project using the widgets to the top left

Step 3:  The more your friends contribute, the higher you rank!



Thanks so much for checking out our campaign! 

 

As with any project, there are sure to be questions that come up.  We will do our best to answer all questions and address any concerns that our supporters may have. 
 Here are a few that we can think of:

Q: When Can I Expect My Perks?

A: Great question!  As we plan on using the funds raised to open a store for an already successful business, most perks will be available within about 3 months of our receiving funds.  We plan on to distribute perks in 2 different groups.  Those perks that only have merchandise (shirts, hats, glasses) will be distributed in September 2016, about 3 months after we receive funding.  Lunch ticket perks will be available for distribution in October of 2016.  Any additional perks that include food vouchers, catering, or memberships will not be ready for distribution until January of 2017.  This will allow us to get opened and running smoothly before giving out free or discounted food.

Q: Why Now?

A:  Many of our customers continually ask us when we are getting a store.  Some even tell us we need to.  Our big picture vision has always included a store and we feel the timing is right to take the first step in that direction.

Q: I Don't Live in Portales, or New Mexico, Why Should I Back Your Project?

A: Obviously if you don't live in or around Portales, you won't directly benefit from the impact our project will have.  However, ask yourself if you love any of the following:  Chicken wings, great food, beer, cool swag, locally owned businesses, main street, growing the economy?  If you answered yes to any of the above, then check out our backing options that don't include food related perks.  All backing levels include shipping inside the US.

Q: Where Can My Food Vouchers, VIP or Club Membership Perks Be Used?

A: All food related perks, including food vouchers, VIP discounts and club memberships, will only be redeemable at our new store.  In the event we do not obtain the required funding for opening the store front, we will honor these perks at our trailer beginning in January 2017.

Q: What About Investment Opportunities?

A: If you're interested in investing or partnering with AJs WIngs for any future endeavors, please contact us at AJsWings@live.com.  We will gladly consider any opportunity.

We can't wait to serve you!

***If you cannot view the video, it may be due to an ad blocker on your device.  You will need to opt out of the ad blocking and refresh your page***



From local food trailer to
full-feature, family-friendly restaurant: 
AJs Wings is looking to spread its wings in Portales, New Mexico – help support our project and receive some great swag and perks!





We are looking for the support of the High Plains community to help us raise the required capital for our own store front right here in Portales!
As a backer of our project you will receive awesome perks ranging from free food and event catering, to t-shirts, hats and even naming your own sauce!  See our complete list of available perks to the right! 
 
Check back often for updates and promotional offerings!

And don't forget to tell your friends! You can click the social media links to the left to share on Facebook and Twitter or create your own link to send via email!  We will be running a promotional contest rewarding the backers that refer the most support to our campaign!














FROM LOCAL FOOD TRAILER TO FULL-FEATURE, FAMILY-FRIENDLY RESTAURANT: 

AJs Wings is looking to spread its wings in Portales, New Mexico – help support our project and receive some great swag and perks!
The world of food can be a very exciting one. People dine together while enjoying each other’s company. While experiencing different flavors and savoring traditional local dishes or exotic ones, we are able to relax, reconnect with others, and let go of the stresses of our day-to-day lives. A delicious meal can provide the perfect occasion for a family get-together or reuniting of friends. All in all, it can be a rewarding experience, one that we wish to re-live regularly…not to mention the fact that those cooking and serving great food have the pleasure of knowing their efforts are paying off with satisfied customers.
In Portales, New Mexico, the world of food is exciting, however it is somewhat limited in its choices. At AJ’s Wings, we understand the need for fun places to go out to relax, eat a great meal, and gather with family and friends. We truly believe that a new restaurant would be heartily and enthusiastically welcomed here in Portales. Presently, AJ’s operates a mobile food unit in and around town, serving the best chicken wings, strips, sauces and mozzarella sticks this side of the Rio Grande! We have a growing, loyal clientele who surely would love a permanent place to kick back, enjoy some wings and refreshment, and relax after a long day.
Presently, we operate only on weekends, but the response from the public has been extremely positive in the 2 ½ years AJ’s has been in business. Because of this successful experience, we would now like to build on that success by opening a full-feature, quick serve, family-friendly restaurant in Portales. 
As for our trailer, we would continue to serve our amazing customers from our mobile food unit, serving Cannon AFB as well as operating at several special events throughout the year.
Our vision for AJ’s is to present a quick-service but high quality restaurant with a casual air. Our hope is for an indoor capacity of 50 people or more as well as offering additional seating with an outdoor patio or sidewalk café area where as many folks as possible can come to enjoy our fabulous food and visit with friends. Customers at AJ’s restaurant will be able to enjoy locally brewed beer on tap, TVs for watching sporting events, a comfortable atmosphere , extended hours, and the same friendly service you have come to expect from AJ‘s.
On the “business” side of things, AJ’s expansion will provide new job opportunities for local residents as well as stimulate the Portales and Roosevelt County economies to some extent. As much as we possibly can, we will incorporate local foods and products, thereby assisting other local operations in the process.  As an employer, AJ's philosophy is to offer our staff a living wage in addition to mutual trust and respect. We hope our employees will love coming to work because we will encourage work life balance and employee well being.  

In order to accomplish this vision, we are seeking to raise at least $50,000 for the purpose of acquiring an existing downtown building, remodeling the dining and kitchen areas, leasing and installing kitchen equipment and providing suitable furnishings to create this special place that we want to provide to the residents of Portales.


1.) Taking a look at the fabulous perks we are offering in exchange for your support of our project. You will be helping to grow a simple but popular mobile food unit into a restaurant reality in Portales, New Mexico!

AND

2.) Sharing this campaign with friends and family to maximize the potential of this campaign to support the creation of a fresh new dining environment in the little town of Portales, NMThank you so much for your loyal support and for considering this vision with us.
We hope to soon be serving you and your friends at our new location in downtown Portales.







We have a very specific vision for our building, and while we have a handful of locations in mind, we will take the time to acquire the building that will bring us as close to that vision as possible.
1.) Location, Location, Location:  
We hope to take possession of a building that is in or near the downtown/square area.  If this is not possible, we prefer to be closer to the ENMU campus than farther away.  We also want to find a location with adequate parking and with optimal size to allow for an indoor seating capacity of around 50.


2.) Open Kitchen: 
As we envision being a quick-service restaurant, the kitchen will not be closed off from the dining area.  Our service counter will essentially be the only divide between the seating and cooking areas.  This will provide our customers with a unique atmosphere that involves everyone in the process of cooking their meals.


3.) Casual Quick Service:  
With an open kitchen layout, the dining area will be immersed in the everyday traffic.  As people come and go, they will be able to stop and enjoy their meal at one of our tables or along the far counter.  TVs will provide entertainment, usually sporting events, and we hope to have cold beer available for those looking to unwind a little.

4.) Outdoor Patio:  
One thing that Portales does not offer is an outdoor eating option.  We would like to change this by building a patio where customers can choose to enjoy our awesome wings basking in the gorgeous High Plains sunshine or relaxing under the stars.  Our patio build would include a sound retaining wall to help reduce noise for the neighboring businesses, a fire pit to gather around during the evening, and a small stage for us to showcase local talent and live music.






We have chosen our funding option to be what Indiegogo refers to as Flexible Funding.  This means that we will retain all funds that we receive from backers even if we do not hit our project goal of at least $50,000.  We decided to go this route as we feel that if we fall short of our goal for opening a store, we can still expand our operations by acquiring a larger/newer trailer that would better suite our customers and their growing hunger for great chicken wings.
With that being said, we have set the following goals for this project:
Raise $0:  While we find this to be highly unlikely given the level of interest we have received from our customers, it is still a possibility.  If we raise no funds for this project we will continue to operate as we have for the past 2 1/2 years, serving lunch at Cannon AFB, slinging wings on the weekend in the Goobers parking lot, and attending various events throughout the year.
Raise $1 - $5K:  This level of funding will allow us to make renovations to our current trailer including, but not limited to, new fryers, new sink and plumbing, upgraded cooling capacity and general maintenance.






Raise $6K - $25K: This level of funding will allow us to look into acquiring a newer trailer with a larger capacity that will better suite our needs. This would allow us to expand our menu offerings to include new sauces and menu items.
Raise $26k - $50K:  This is the minimum level of funds required to realistically consider going forward with a store.  Given the upfront cost and our desire to remain outside traditional funding as much as possible, we would need to reach this level of support to begin work on a permanent location.
Raise $51K and Up:  Any amount above and beyond our funding goal of $50K will allow us to expedite projects such as our patio build



If our project sounds like the kind of restaurant that you
would like to visit and where you would like to enjoy great food with friends
and family then we invite
you to take a look at the great perks that we have on offer our backers in return for helping us turn our vision into reality!



My name is Aaron Crandall, and I am the founder and sole owner of AJs Wings.  After being laid off in March of 2013 and having zero luck with employment opportunities, I turned to an idea with huge potential, but that would require an immense amount of work and dedication.  Armed with a business degree and a 20lb electric fryer, AJs Wings was born!  After a single car show in Clovis, we teamed up with Goobers in Portales to sell chicken wings to their customers. 
With hours of work put into a converted stock trailer, we began with just chicken wings and fries, all cooked from that single 20lb electric fryer.  Our capacity limit was about 12 wings at once.   Over time we have made several changes, including the addition of two 50lb propane fryers, which allowed us to step up to the increased demand.
As a father of 4 amazing children, who mean the world to me, AJs Wings has become my means of providing for them.  My team is comprised entirely of family members: My Dad, Gary; My Mom, Diane; My Brother, Joseph.  They have been a tremendous help in making sure AJs keeps up with our growing demand.
This project is immensely important to me because I want AJs Wings to give back to the community by creating jobs, bringing an exciting new venue to Portales and allowing others to benefit from the success that I have had!
The success we have had is in part due to our philosophy of staying small with a minimal menu, yet serving generous portions, providing great customer service, and, of course, thanks to our awesome customers!   

We feel that the institutions that provide traditional funding tend to concern themselves too much with their own bottom line.  Instead of helping a major bank increase its profits we prefer to keep our customers involved in our growth opportunity by providing great perks in return for financial backing.  By doing this we will be able to keep our prices low while maintaining a livable wage and work-life balance for our employees, and giving back to our community. 

We know we can't do this without the help of our loyal customers and the support of our local community.  And we certainly would not ask for your backing without offering something in return.  For your generous contribution we have a variety of perks available ranging from free food and event catering, to t-shirts, hats and even naming your own sauce!


   







This project will not only allow us to open a store in Portales, but will also provide the following benefits to our community:
A family-friendly atmosphere suitable for all ages.  

A new place for friends to gather with an outdoor patio/open air seating area.

A focus on local economy:  We will use as many ingredients from local merchants as possible to ensure that our success is enabling the success of others in our community as well! 

These items will include, when available, produce, fresh tortillas, and craft beers.

All branded merchandise will be acquired from local merchants.  Your backing will not only support our project, but will also support several different merchants in the Portales/Clovis area.  This is only one of the ways we are encouraging growth in our community.

Another way we will help stimulate the economy is by providing between 4-10 paid positions, to be filled by local residents.  We will provide a livable wage for all positions we create, which hopefully will elevate our employees' standard of living, and in turn, generate economic growth.


Help us build a permanent location where we can continue to provide you with the  great food and excellent service that you've come to love!






   

Our goal with this campaign is to raise as much of the required funding as possible.  However, starting any business (especially a restaurant) is not cheap, and every business venture comes with unforeseen obstacles.  With that in mind, we know there will be some challenges to overcome:
- Securing the building and location that best fits our vision:  In order to secure the building we will need either a long term lease, to borrow the funds to purchase, or purchase outright with funds from this campaign.  Our vision is very specific and we have a handful of locations in mind that would meet most of the requirements.
- Additional remodeling or electrical/plumbing requirements: We have crunched the numbers hundreds of times and we feel that we have accounted for just about anything that could go wrong during this process.  However, we will not know exactly what we are dealing with until we get started on revamping our space.  Issues could include delays due to weather, supply issues, unforeseen plumbing problems, required electrical updates, etc.  If you've ever done any type of remodel, you know that these types of challenges could potentially cause major headaches.
- Obtaining the proper licensing: As much as we would love to serve beer with our amazing wings, there will be several hoops to jump through regarding the proper licensing.  This will take some time and may delay our ability to serve.  However, we do not feel that this will take away from our vision and what we are striving to achieve.  We understand the in-depth process and reasoning for such regulations and will do our part to serve safely and responsibly.
- Overwhelming response:  While we certainly want to see as much support as possible, there is the chance we will simply be overwhelmed by the support we receive.  If we are lucky enough to face this challenge it could lead to delayed shipping and processing of perks to our backers.  During such an event, we will do our best to openly communicate with all of our supporters so that everyone will knows what to expect as we sort out the details.


Share, share, share!

 We understand that not everyone is able to contribute financially.  Regardless of your contribution level, we ask that you please share this campaign with your friends and social media followers to give us the best opportunity to meet our goal and begin work on what will prove to be a special addition to the High Plains area!  Make some noise about AJs Wings and let your friends know how they can help as well!  We know we have the best customers in the world, and we have faith that you will do everything you can to help us bring our vision to life!  In the top left corner of this campaign you will find the share buttons so you can help spread the word!





We know that our project will not be successful without the help of our backers.  So we are offering a referral contest that will reward you just for sharing our project with your friends!  Its easy to enter:
Step 1: Create or log in to your IndieGoGo AccountStep 2:  Share this project using the widgets to the top leftStep 3:  The more your friends contribute, the higher you rank!



Thanks so much for checking out our campaign! 
 



As with any project, there are sure to be questions that come up.  We will do our best to answer all questions and address any concerns that our supporters may have. 
 Here are a few that we can think of:

Q: When Can I Expect My Perks?
A: Great question!  As we plan on using the funds raised to open a store for an already successful business, most perks will be available within about 3 months of our receiving funds.  We plan on to distribute perks in 2 different groups.  Those perks that only have merchandise (shirts, hats, glasses) will be distributed in September 2016, about 3 months after we receive funding.  Lunch ticket perks will be available for distribution in October of 2016.  Any additional perks that include food vouchers, catering, or memberships will not be ready for distribution until January of 2017.  This will allow us to get opened and running smoothly before giving out free or discounted food.
Q: Why Now?
A:  Many of our customers continually ask us when we are getting a store.  Some even tell us we need to.  Our big picture vision has always included a store and we feel the timing is right to take the first step in that direction.
Q: I Don't Live in Portales, or New Mexico, Why Should I Back Your Project?
A: Obviously if you don't live in or around Portales, you won't directly benefit from the impact our project will have.  However, ask yourself if you love any of the following:  Chicken wings, great food, beer, cool swag, locally owned businesses, main street, growing the economy?  If you answered yes to any of the above, then check out our backing options that don't include food related perks.  All backing levels include shipping inside the US.
Q: Where Can My Food Vouchers, VIP or Club Membership Perks Be Used?
A: All food related perks, including food vouchers, VIP discounts and club memberships, will only be redeemable at our new store.  In the event we do not obtain the required funding for opening the store front, we will honor these perks at our trailer beginning in January 2017.
Q: What About Investment Opportunities?
A: If you're interested in investing or partnering with AJs WIngs for any future endeavors, please contact us at AJsWings@live.com.  We will gladly consider any opportunity.


We can't wait to serve you!

story:
The revered and elusive Ecuadorian cacao variety known as “Nacional” traces its genetic lineage back 5,300 years. As of seven years ago, it was believed to be extinct. In the remote valley of Piedra de Plata we found nine cacao trees that are 100% genetically pure Nacional—verified by DNA testing. Each of these old-growth trees are at the end of their lifespan. When they die, thousands of years of flavor evolution will die with them. We want to save this ancient heirloom cacao variety from extinction by reproducing these trees through grafting and seed propagation. We need your help to do this. In exchange, we offer you our chocolate and cherished cacao from Piedra de Plata in various different forms:




Nacional’s genetic lineage goes back 5,300 years ago in Ecuador, which is now recognized as the native origin of cacao. In recent centuries, Nacional reached global fame for its trademark floral aroma and complex flavor profile. Then in 1916 the variety was decimated by an outbreak of Witches’ Broom disease throughout the country, and a century of hybridization followed. By the beginning of the 21st century it was believed that genetically pure Nacional no longer existed.




To’ak was born from a rainforest conservation project in Ecuador in 2007. For many years we quietly made chocolate by hand in a bamboo thatched house without electricity in the middle of our forest preserve. Then in 2013, in the remote valley of Piedra de Plata, we found one of the last known remnants of pure Nacional cacao. Many trees in this valley are so old that they pre-date the hybridization wave that began a century ago. Through the help of genetic testing provided by the Heirloom Cacao Preservation Initiative (HCP), To’ak identified nine trees in Piedra de Plata that are genetically pure Nacional. Each of these trees is estimated to be over one hundred years old, which is considered the end of a cacao tree’s lifespan. Several of these trees are visibly ailing due to old age.

These last surviving trees represent a living museum of what is most likely the most ancient cacao variety on earth. They are a connection to the dawn of humanity’s love affair with chocolate.  

Out of an estimated 25 million cacao trees in Ecuador, only fifteen are DNA-verified to be pure Nacional. That’s 0.0006% of cacao in Ecuador, the native birthplace of cacao. Nine out of these fifteen trees reside in the valley of Piedra de Plata

[Photo] Number "7" out of  the nine pure Nacional cacao trees in the valley.


Our goal is to nurse this special variety of cacao back from the brink of extinction through conservation, seed propagation, and grafting. In partnership with the rainforest conservation foundation Third Millennium Alliance and the local farmers of Piedra de Plata, To’ak will reproduce, plant, and manage 1,000 pure Nacional cacao trees in fifteen different local farms and one forest preserve throughout the region. We will provide ongoing management of the trees for the first five years of their lives, until they safely reach maturity. Once fruit production begins in 4-5 years, we will harvest the seeds and begin another round of propagation. We will also meticulously process this special cacao and offer it in all of its various forms, akin to our To’ak Cacao Sampler reward. And you will taste the historic result.

Conservationists and chocolate lovers of the world, we need your help to save this ancient relic and culinary treasure.

[Photo] Proudly standing in front of our first DNA-verified 100% Nacional cacao tree, discovered in 2014.


The DNA analysis has already been done. Now we need to:

After five years, the trees will reach maturity and begin their productive lives. We estimate the total cost per tree to be $50 over the five-year life of the project. Reaching our funding goal will allow us to plant 1,000 trees.

The more trees we’re able to plant, the greater the chances of long-term survival of this critically-endangered variety.



To’ak is a small-batch Ecuadorian chocolate company whose mission is to transform the way the world experiences dark chocolate, elevating its making and tasting onto the level of vintage wine and aged whisky. To’ak’s co-founder Jerry Toth moved to Ecuador in 2006 where he co-founded the rainforest conservation foundation Third Millennium Alliance. The Jama-Coaque forest preserve that Jerry helped create is located in the Ecuadorian province of Manabí, which is to cacao what the French province of Burgundy is to wine. As part of his conservation work, Jerry spent several years cultivating an organic fruit tree orchard that features cacao trees inter-planted with over sixty different species of other tropical fruit trees. Secluded in the middle of the forest, he began making chocolate by hand in a thatched bamboo house without electricity.

After years of honing his passion, Jerry linked up with co-founder Carl Schweizer and fourth-generation Ecuadorian cacao grower Servio Pachard. They formed a partnership with fourteen cacao growers in the remote valley of Piedra de Plata, where some of the last-known pure Nacional trees still survive. Sourced from cacao trees in this valley, To’ak produced an extremely limited edition of terroir-driven dark chocolate that has since been featured in Forbes, L.A. Times, Wine Spectator, Huffington Post, Fortune Magazine,  Daily Mail, Süddeutsche Zeitung, TV channels such as BBC, CNN, and FOX, and dozens of other publications across five continents. To’ak was awarded Heirloom designation for its cacao by the Heirloom Cacao Preservation Initiative (HCP) in January of 2016. Now To’ak is working with local farmers to protect this historically-cherished variety of cacao and nurse it back from the brink of extinction.

To’ak pays the highest price per pound in the entire country and shares 10% of profits with the fourteen cacao growers that we work with. Organic and Fair Trade certified.

[Photo left>right] Jerry Toth (Co-Founder), Servio Pachard (Harvest Master), Carl Schweizer (Co-Founder), Dennise Valencia (General Manager)


[Photo] To'ak's Vintage 2014 edition includes two variations: Cognac Cask Matured and Spanish Elm Matured, both aged for 18 months



  • What are the main varieties of cacao and why is Nacional so special?

  • How rare is Nacional, really?

  • Is anyone else doing this?

  • Why can’t you just plant seeds?

  • How does grafting work?

  • Where will the new trees be located?

  • How do the farmers benefit?

  • Is it Organic and Fair Trade?

  • Where do funds go if we don’t reach our entire goal?

  • What risks are associated with the Project?

  • What qualifications do we have to do this?

  • How else can I help?


What are the main varieties of cacao and why is Nacional so special?

DNA testing distinguishes between ten varieties of cacao: Marañon, Curaray, Criollo, Iquitos, Nanay, Contamana, Amelonado, Purús, Guiana, and Nacional, in addition to thirty-seven secondary cultivars.  Each variety has it's own signature flavor profile. It is estimated that 99.945% of cacao that is labeled "Nacional" is actually from trees that are hybrids--i.e., a blend of Nacional with several other genetic varieties (see below for details). Chocolate writer Mark Xian, in the C-Spot, describes the general Nacional flavor profile as: "naturally sweet/low fat but raw cocoa bean-taste with heavy body (paradoxically light in the upper palate) gilded in florid violet, lilac, jasmine, orange blossom… a unique bouquet (combination herbal/forest green/ fresh meadow); reds & blackberries, black mission figs (depending on region); occasional spices (especially cinnamon); lower bitterness though astringent tannins."

How rare is Nacional, really?

To give you an idea of how rare this variety is, the Ecuadorian government genetically tested 11,000 different cacao trees throughout the entire country and only 6 of these trees proved to be pure Nacional. That means that only 0.055% of "Nacional" cacao in Ecuador is actually pure Nacional. In a limited sampling of 16 old-growth cacao trees that we tested in Piedra de Plata, 9 of them proved to be pure Nacional. So of the estimated 25 million cacao trees in Ecuador, only a meager 15 are known to be pure Nacional!  This project would increase the number of pure Nacional trees to over 1,000, which would reestablish a viable population of this historic cacao variety. This is our way of building a time machine. Through this effort, present and future generations will be able to experience an ancient treasure. 

Is anyone else doing this?

As far as we know, this is the first-ever project of its kind. Previous efforts have been made to promote new plantings of hybridized Nacional, which is a far cry from the famous Nacional cacao of the nineteenth century, in terms of flavor profile and complexity. The reason nobody is planting pure Nacional is because they are notoriously finicky trees and are much less productive than hybrids. In the age of mass production, with the world’s appetite for chocolate ever on the rise, countries like Ecuador are replacing less productive heirloom cacao varieties like Nacional with high-yield hybrids that have less flavor. Pure Nacional cacao, along with its unique flavor profile, is on the doorstep of extinction. The last surviving pure Nacional trees are at the end of their lives. This project needs to be executed yesterday.

Why can’t you just plant seeds?

For one, the pure Nacional cacao trees in Piedra de Plata are so old that their cacao production is almost finished. Some of them now only produce two or three pods per year. Also, the existing pure Nacional trees are in close proximity to other cacao trees that are not genetically pure. Due to cross-pollination between these other trees, seeds from pure Nacional trees will include foreign genetic material. Grafting avoids this problem. Genetic material from the pure Nacional trees is directly grafted onto the young seedlings. The seeds eventually produced by these grafted seedlings will be genetically pure Nacional, provided sufficient distance allowed between them and all other hybrids. It’s the seeds (commonly referred to as "beans") that are used to make chocolate.  

How does grafting work?

Grafting can be done a few different ways. With cacao, a young branch is removed from the desired tree—in this case, from a pure Nacional tree. This branch (called the scion) is then attached to a young seedling (called the root stock). The scion is literally stuck into a cleft that has been cut into the root stock, and a special kind of tape is wrapped around the scion so that it remains attached. Slowly but surely, the wood of the two different trees fuse together, and the scion becomes a living part of the root stock. It’s actually an amazing process. Grafting can also be utilized to reproduce grape vines, citrus trees, and all sorts of other fruit trees.

Where will the new trees be planted?

The new trees will be planted in each of the farms of the fourteen cacao growers in Piedra de Plata with whom To’ak works, in addition to Harvest Master Servio Pachard's farm. New trees will also be planted in an experimental agroforestry plot in the nearby Jama-Coaque Reserve, managed by the rainforest conservation foundation Third Millennium Alliance.

How do the farmers benefit?

  • We pay the cacao growers of Piedra de Plata the highest price per pound in the country.

  • We sponsor the Organic and Fair Trade certification process not only for their cacao, but for all of the other crops they produce on their farms, which increases the price they receive by 20%. 

  • We sponsor ongoing sustainable agroforestry workshops for all participating farmers

  • The fourteen cacao growers of Piedra de Plata share 10% of To’ak’s profits.

Is it Organic and Fair Trade?

Yes and yes. All cacao sourced by To’ak and all chocolate made by To’ak is certified Organic and Fair Trade.

Where do funds go if we don’t reach our entire goal?

Our goal is to graft and plant as many pure Nacional cacao trees as we can. For every $50 that we raise, we’re able to propogate, graft, and manage a pure Nacional tree until it safely reaches maturity, which is a five-year process. That said, the success of this project depends on planting enough trees in enough different farms to ensure the survival of this genetic variety. What is the magic number of trees required to achieve that goal? 500? 1,000? 2,000? It’s impossible to put an exact number on it. Our belief is that 1,000 trees would provide a strong foundation from which to rebuild this genetic variety, although our long-term goal is much higher. We will plant as many trees as we can with the funds we raise.

What are the Risks Associated with the Project?

The greatest risk to this project is time—especially time wasted. The first risk is that one or several of these trees will die before we’re able to propagate them. This is mitigated by moving on this project quickly. Once the young seedlings have been grafted with scion material from the pure old-growth trees, the next issue is the health of the graft itself. Tree grafts in the tropics require skillful execution and proper care for the first few years of growth, to ensure the health of the graft and its primacy over other branches. This requires close personal attention and on-going management for the life of the tree, with particular emphasis on its first five years. Timely pruning and organic soil fertilization greatly improve the odds that each tree not only survives, but thrives. Spreading these golden seedlings around to many different farms also hedges against unforeseen tree deaths at any one given farm.

What qualifications do we have to do this?

To’ak co-founder Jerry Toth has eight years of conservation and sustainable agroforestry field experience in coastal Ecuador. As co-founder of the nonprofit rainforest conservation foundation Third Millennium Alliance, Jerry has managed the reforestation of over 10,000 trees in the region, including several thousand cacao trees. Project coordinator Servio Pachard is a fourth generation cacao farmer who has been planting and managing cacao trees his entire life. Servio was a field technician for the Ecuadorian government’s agricultural investigation institute (INIAP) and is an agroforestry instructor at the University of Calceta. To’ak was awarded Heirloom designation for its cacao by the Heirloom Cacao Preservation Initiative, which assisted To’ak with DNA analysis of cacao trees at Piedra de Plata.

How else can I help?

  • Think of a few people you know who appreciate chocolate and please send them a link to this webpage. Invite them to learn about our project and help us with our goal. You can use Indiegogo’s share tools for this.

  • As with all food, take the time to learn about where the cacao comes from in the chocolate you eat. The more you know about where the cacao was grown, who grows it, how it was grown, and how it was produced into chocolate, the more this forces producers—including us—to grow our cacao and produce our chocolate with integrity.
story_txt:
The revered and elusive Ecuadorian cacao variety known as
“Nacional” traces its genetic lineage back 5,300 years. As of seven years ago, it was
believed to be extinct. In the remote valley of Piedra de Plata we found nine
cacao trees that are 100% genetically pure Nacional—verified by DNA testing.
Each of these old-growth trees are at the end of their lifespan. When they die,
thousands of years of flavor evolution will die with them. We want to save this
ancient heirloom cacao variety from extinction by reproducing these trees through
grafting and seed propagation. We need your help to do this. In exchange, we
offer you our chocolate and cherished cacao from Piedra de Plata in various different forms:

Nacional’s genetic lineage goes back 5,300 years ago in
Ecuador, which is now recognized as the native origin of cacao. In recent
centuries, Nacional reached global fame for its trademark floral aroma and
complex flavor profile. Then in 1916 the variety was decimated by an outbreak
of Witches’ Broom disease throughout the country, and a century of
hybridization followed. By the beginning of the 21st century it was believed
that genetically pure Nacional no longer existed. 
To’ak was born from a rainforest conservation project in Ecuador in 2007. For many years we quietly made chocolate by hand in a bamboo thatched house without electricity in the middle of our forest preserve. Then in 2013, in the remote valley of Piedra de Plata, we found one of the last known remnants of pure Nacional cacao. Many trees in this valley are so old that they pre-date the hybridization wave that began a century ago. Through the help of genetic testing provided by the Heirloom Cacao Preservation Initiative (HCP), To’ak identified nine trees in Piedra de Plata that are genetically pure Nacional. Each of these trees is estimated to be over one hundred years old, which is considered the end of a cacao tree’s lifespan. Several of these trees are visibly ailing due to old age. These last surviving trees represent a living museum of what is most likely the most ancient cacao variety on earth. They are a connection to the dawn of humanity’s love affair with chocolate.  Out of an estimated 25 million cacao trees in Ecuador, only fifteen are DNA-verified to be pure Nacional. That’s 0.0006% of cacao in Ecuador, the native birthplace of cacao. Nine out of these fifteen trees reside in the valley of Piedra de Plata[Photo] Number "7" out of  the nine pure Nacional cacao trees in the valley.Our goal is to nurse this special variety of cacao back from the brink of extinction through conservation, seed propagation, and grafting. In partnership with the rainforest conservation foundation Third Millennium Alliance and the local farmers of Piedra de Plata, To’ak will reproduce, plant, and manage 1,000 pure Nacional cacao trees in fifteen different local farms and one forest preserve throughout the region. We will provide ongoing management of the trees for the first five years of their lives, until they safely reach maturity. Once fruit production begins in 4-5 years, we will harvest the seeds and begin another round of propagation. We will also meticulously process this special cacao and offer it in all
of its various forms, akin to our To’ak Cacao Sampler reward. And you will taste the historic result.Conservationists and chocolate lovers of the world, we need your help to save this ancient relic and culinary treasure.[Photo] Proudly standing in front of our first DNA-verified 100% Nacional cacao tree, discovered in 2014.The DNA analysis has already been done. Now we need to: After five years, the trees will reach maturity and begin their productive lives. We estimate the total cost per tree to be $50 over the five-year life of the project. Reaching our funding goal will allow us to plant 1,000 trees.The more trees we’re able to plant, the greater the chances of long-term survival of this critically-endangered variety.To’ak is a small-batch Ecuadorian chocolate company whose mission is to transform the way the world experiences dark chocolate, elevating its making and tasting onto the level of vintage wine and aged whisky. To’ak’s co-founder Jerry Toth moved to Ecuador in 2006 where he co-founded the rainforest conservation foundation Third Millennium Alliance. The Jama-Coaque forest
preserve that Jerry helped create is located in the Ecuadorian province of
Manabí, which is to cacao what the French province of Burgundy is to wine.

As part of his conservation work, Jerry spent several years cultivating an organic fruit tree orchard that features cacao trees inter-planted with over sixty different species of other tropical fruit trees. Secluded in the middle of the forest, he began making chocolate by hand in a thatched bamboo house without electricity.After years of honing his passion, Jerry linked up with co-founder Carl Schweizer and fourth-generation Ecuadorian cacao grower Servio Pachard. They formed a partnership with fourteen cacao growers in the remote valley of Piedra de Plata, where some of the last-known pure Nacional trees still survive. Sourced from cacao trees in this valley, To’ak produced an extremely limited edition of terroir-driven dark chocolate that has since been featured in Forbes, L.A. Times, Wine Spectator, Huffington Post, Fortune Magazine,  Daily Mail, Süddeutsche Zeitung, TV channels such as BBC, CNN, and FOX, and dozens of other publications across five continents. To’ak was awarded Heirloom designation for its cacao by the Heirloom Cacao Preservation Initiative (HCP) in January of 2016. Now To’ak is working with local farmers to protect this historically-cherished variety of cacao and nurse it back from the brink of extinction. To’ak pays the highest price per pound in the entire country and shares 10% of profits with the fourteen cacao growers that we work with. Organic and Fair Trade certified. [Photo left>right] Jerry Toth (Co-Founder), Servio Pachard (Harvest Master), Carl Schweizer (Co-Founder), Dennise Valencia (General Manager)[Photo] To'ak's Vintage 2014 edition includes two variations: Cognac Cask
 Matured and Spanish Elm Matured, both aged for 18 months 
What are the main varieties of cacao and why is Nacional so special?
How rare is Nacional, really?
Is anyone else doing this?
Why can’t you just plant seeds?
How does grafting work?
Where will the new trees be located?
How do the farmers benefit?
Is it Organic and Fair Trade?
Where do funds go if we don’t reach our entire goal?
What risks are associated with the Project?
What qualifications do we have to do this?
How else can I help?
What are the main varieties of cacao and why is Nacional so special?DNA testing distinguishes between ten varieties of cacao: Marañon, Curaray, Criollo, Iquitos, Nanay, Contamana, Amelonado, Purús, Guiana, and Nacional, in addition to thirty-seven secondary cultivars.  Each variety has it's own signature flavor profile. It is estimated that 99.945% of cacao that is labeled "Nacional" is actually from trees that are hybrids--i.e., a blend of Nacional with several other genetic varieties (see below for details). Chocolate writer Mark Xian, in the C-Spot, describes the general Nacional flavor profile as: "naturally sweet/low fat but raw cocoa bean-taste with heavy body (paradoxically light in the upper palate) gilded in florid violet, lilac, jasmine, orange blossom… a unique bouquet (combination herbal/forest green/ fresh meadow); reds & blackberries, black mission figs (depending on region); occasional spices (especially cinnamon); lower bitterness though astringent tannins."How rare is Nacional, really?To give you an idea of how rare this variety is, the Ecuadorian government genetically tested 11,000 different cacao trees throughout the entire country and only 6 of these trees proved to be pure Nacional. That means that only 0.055% of "Nacional" cacao in Ecuador is actually pure Nacional. In a limited sampling of 16 old-growth cacao trees that we tested in Piedra de Plata, 9 of them proved to be pure Nacional. So of the estimated 25 million cacao trees in Ecuador, only a meager 15 are known to be pure Nacional!  This project would increase the number of pure Nacional trees to over 1,000, which would reestablish a viable population of this historic cacao variety. This is our way of building a time machine. Through this effort, present and future generations will be able to experience an ancient treasure.  Is anyone else doing this? As far as we know, this is the first-ever project of its kind. Previous efforts have been made to promote new plantings of hybridized Nacional, which is a far cry from the famous Nacional cacao of the nineteenth century, in terms of flavor profile and complexity. The reason nobody is planting pure Nacional is because they are notoriously finicky trees and are much less productive than hybrids. In the age of mass production, with the world’s appetite for chocolate ever on the rise, countries like Ecuador are replacing less productive heirloom cacao varieties like Nacional with high-yield hybrids that have less flavor. Pure Nacional cacao, along with its unique flavor profile, is on the doorstep of extinction. The last surviving pure Nacional trees are at the end of their lives. This project needs to be executed yesterday. Why can’t you just plant seeds?For
one, the pure Nacional cacao trees in Piedra de Plata are so old that their
cacao production is almost finished. Some of them now only produce two or three
pods per year. Also, the existing pure Nacional trees are in close proximity to
other cacao trees that are not genetically pure. Due to cross-pollination between these other trees, seeds from pure Nacional trees will include foreign genetic material. Grafting avoids this problem. Genetic material from the pure Nacional trees is directly grafted onto the young seedlings. The seeds eventually produced by these grafted seedlings will be genetically pure Nacional, provided sufficient distance allowed between them and all other hybrids. It’s the seeds (commonly referred to as "beans") that are used to make chocolate.  How does grafting work?Grafting can be done a few different ways. With cacao, a young branch is removed from the desired tree—in this case, from a pure Nacional tree. This branch (called the scion) is then attached to a young seedling (called the root stock). The scion is literally stuck into a cleft that has been cut into the root stock, and a special kind of tape is wrapped around the scion so that it remains attached. Slowly but surely, the wood of the two different trees fuse together, and the scion becomes a living part of the root stock. It’s actually an amazing process. Grafting can also be
utilized to reproduce grape vines, citrus trees, and all sorts of other fruit
trees.Where will the new trees be planted?The new trees will be planted in each of the farms of the fourteen cacao growers in Piedra de Plata with whom To’ak works, in addition to Harvest Master Servio Pachard's farm. New trees will also be planted in an experimental agroforestry plot in the nearby Jama-Coaque Reserve, managed by the rainforest conservation foundation Third Millennium Alliance. How do the farmers benefit?
We pay the cacao growers of Piedra de Plata the highest price per pound in the country. 
We sponsor the Organic and Fair Trade certification process not only for their cacao, but for all of the other crops they produce on their farms, which increases the price they receive by 20%.  
We sponsor ongoing sustainable agroforestry workshops for all participating farmers
The fourteen cacao growers of Piedra de Plata share 10% of To’ak’s profits. 
Is it Organic and Fair Trade?Yes and yes. All cacao sourced by To’ak and all chocolate made by To’ak is certified Organic and Fair Trade. Where do funds go if we don’t reach our entire goal?Our goal is to graft and plant as many pure Nacional cacao trees as we can. For every $50 that we raise, we’re able to propogate, graft, and manage a pure Nacional tree until it safely reaches maturity, which is a five-year process. That said, the success of this project depends on planting enough trees in enough different farms to ensure the survival of this genetic variety. What is the magic number of trees required to achieve that goal? 500? 1,000? 2,000? It’s impossible to put an exact number on it. Our belief is that 1,000 trees would provide a strong foundation from which to rebuild this genetic variety, although our long-term goal is much higher. We will plant as many trees as we can with the funds we raise.What are the Risks Associated with the Project?The greatest risk to this project is time—especially time wasted. The first risk is that one or several of these trees will die before we’re able to propagate them. This
is mitigated by moving on this project quickly. Once the young seedlings have been grafted with scion material from the pure old-growth trees, the next issue is the health of the graft itself. Tree grafts in the tropics require skillful execution and proper care for the first few years of growth, to ensure the health of the graft and its primacy over other branches. This requires close personal attention and on-going management for the life of the tree, with particular emphasis on its first five years. Timely pruning and organic soil fertilization greatly improve the odds that each tree not only survives, but thrives. Spreading
these golden seedlings around to many different farms also hedges against
unforeseen tree deaths at any one given farm. What qualifications do we have to do this?To’ak co-founder Jerry Toth has eight years of conservation and sustainable agroforestry field experience in coastal Ecuador. As co-founder of the nonprofit rainforest conservation foundation Third Millennium Alliance, Jerry has managed the reforestation of over 10,000 trees in the region, including several thousand cacao trees. Project coordinator Servio Pachard is a fourth generation cacao farmer who has been planting and managing cacao trees his entire life. Servio was a field technician for the Ecuadorian government’s agricultural investigation institute (INIAP) and is an agroforestry instructor at the University of Calceta. To’ak was awarded Heirloom designation for its cacao by the Heirloom Cacao Preservation Initiative, which assisted To’ak with DNA analysis of cacao trees at Piedra de Plata.How else can I help?
Think of a few people you know who appreciate chocolate and please send them a link to this webpage. Invite them to learn about our project and help us with our goal. You can use Indiegogo’s share tools for this.
As with all food, take the time to learn about where the cacao comes from in the chocolate you eat. The more you know about where the cacao was grown, who grows it, how it was grown, and how it was produced into chocolate, the more this forces producers—including us—to grow our cacao and produce our chocolate with integrity.

story:
All about bugs!

We’re not sure if we love them or hate them, but this campaign is all about edible bugs!

By 2050 we’ll be 9 billion people on this planet. We need to rapidly come up with new ways to produce food in a sustainable way. Edible insects have the potential to become a very important food source for all of us. They are high in nutrients and can be produced efficiently and with much less environmental impacts when compared to almost any other protein source!

Great potential, but...

However, right now the business of edible insects is almost non-existing in the developed countries. Despite huge potential, it is facing big hurdles connected to both slow moving legislation, as well as mental obstacles to eating insects among consumers.

We're on a mission!

Very much driven by a mission to create and support better and more conscious businesses, we at Invenire wanted to do something to change the situation and help the edible insects industry to become successful. By coincidence we met 4Ento (a Swiss-based communication and awareness platform promoting edible insects as a sustainable food and protein alternative) and we knew we had found the right company!


Via this campaign, we want to do 2 important things:

In order to really matter and make a difference, the edible insects industry needs to reach much bigger consumer groups than today. We think that for it to achieve a wide sustainability impact, it needs a roadmap. 

That is why we’ve started this campaign – we want to do two important things:

  1. Produce and publish a business opportunity report. The aim of the work is to present a clear view of where the edible insects market is right now, but most importantly, show the roadmap of how it can develop forward into a more mainstream market with greater positive impact. 
  2. Support the little team of 4Ento in their important educational work to increase awareness and familiarise people with edible insects so that more and more people become aware of the opportunities edible insects provide, and also dare to try insects themselves! If we in some way can help change makers like 4Ento in their quest for more sustainable – responsible business – we’ll do our best!


NEWS UPDATE: The report is published on July 21st!

Good news! Our initial plan was to launch the report in August. However we have worked fast and after two months of intensive work, the report is ready! 

Order the report today and receive a downloadable PDF report within a few days!

Here's what the report contains: 

Snapshot of the current embryonic market

  • Characteristics and issues
  • Current consumer products
  • Current key players
  • Current consumers

Identifying commercial possibilities

  • Nutritional profile
  • Potential markets

Getting the market going

  • Challenges to be solved
  • Marketing mindset – a shift may be needed to achieve goals
  • Gaps in the market
  • Potential consumers for edible insect products
  • How will the market for edible insects grow?
  • What next? Practical tips for insect-based food companies

Whom is it for?

  • Companies in the food industry who are interested in the topic and committed to solving issues related to global health and well-being, as well from 
  • Start-ups and entrepreneurs already involved in the edible insect business, who see our report as a valuable input and asset to them. 


The funding will cover the following:

Our objective is to turn market research into a valuable input in the format of a report, for anyone working or intending to work within the business of edible insects. 

We hope you will recognize the potential of this report and back our project by buying the useful downloadable PDF report!

Budget calculation:

  • Writing hours: $10,000
  • Materials $3,000
  • Visuals and graphical layout: $7,000
  • Support for 4ento to keep arranging insects pavilions: $30,000


Help us make some noise!

Maybe the report in itself is not relevant for you but you like the work Invenire or 4Ento is doing? 

Please support us with a small sum or just help us spread the message and make some noise about this campaign! We'd be so grateful! 

Every person we reach can make a difference and help the edible insects industry grow!

Thank you!

//Invenire team

story:
Help reverse the ongoing destruction of butterfly habitats in our local communities.  We need to design a new, portable butterfly house and promote entrepreneurs to start their own Butterfly Dreamland businesses in their local communities.

We bring awareness to the ongoing destruction of butterfly habitats in our neighborhoods and communities.  We do this by offering an interactive wildlife experience like no-other where children and adults learn first hand about  butterflies in our portable butterfly house. 

What We Do

We have been promoting the re-population of butterflies in the Gold Coast of Australia for several years.  Our passion quickly became a businesses when we discovered that physical interaction with children and parents provide the best education and re-population results, and it is also a great way to make money.

We have created a step-by-step program where anyone can start their own butterfly or invertebrate business and earn a generous and rewarding income while working at their own leisure.  It's time to take it to the next level. 

What We Need

1.  A new, custom designed fly-house, specific for Butterfly Dreamland entrepreneurs that can be set up in 20-30 minutes.
2. A new, professional Global website with login and support for BD business owners showing times and locations where people can find a Butterfly Dreamland fly house and book a fly house for their party or event.
3. New, professional photo and marketing materials for BD business owners.

Be Your Own Boss!

A Butterfly Dreamland entrepreneur attends art & crafts markets, birthday parties, county fairs, school events, rodeos and special events of all kinds.  What an experience to be surrounded by butterflies and to feed them on the tips of your fingers!

We typically work three days a week at the markets. We charge a fee for entry, photos, souvenirs and we provide free literature.  No traveling is required and revenues can be as high as $5,000+ daily at large events and as low as $200 on a bad market day with only 30-40 entries. 

This business is ideal for people that are good with kids, like the outdoors and want flexible work hours.  It's about living an outdoor, healthier lifestyle.

The global Butterfly Dreamland business will promote the planting of butterfly gardens in our backyards and communities, teach parents and children when and where to spray for insects, the types of plants needed to attract each species of butterflies, and the basic fundamentals about butterflies and their life cycles.  And because you will be releasing butterflies on a regular basis, your community will benefit from a butterfly re-population.

Risks & Challenges

Depending on your location, this business may be classified as seasonal. You may not be able to operate, or want to operate, full-time during the Winter months.  However we offer a unique system that we developed from several years of trial and error, allowing Butterfly Dreamland business owners to operate at night events and during the mild Winter months when butterflies are supposed to be sleeping.

Apart from the mobile fly house, you will need to build a stationary butterfly house to grow and raise your butterflies.   Drawings are supplied with your business kit and it takes about 5-6 hours to build the octagon modular fly house at a cost of approximately $600 in materials from your local hardware store.  Some skills with a saw and drill are required. 

To run this business successfully, you will need to be able set up your mobile butterfly house, which is a custom made 3m x 6m marquee.  Elderly and physically challenged people may not be able to do this on their own.

This business is also not for the bug squeamish. If you have issues with butterflies or caterpillars than please click the "back" button now.  

Also, if you are an introvert, you will need to learn to become an extravert, as you will meet dozens, if not hundreds of new people weekly, wanting to learn more about your butterflies and your business.  

What you get

The Butterfly Dreamland start-up kit includes the following:

  • Protected Territory - You pick your territory - 1st come, 1st serve - Territories   are restricted to populations of 1m people. 
  • As an early bird - No Franchise Fees for Life!
  • Newly designed portable fly-house
  • Butterfly Dreamland Start-Up Manual
  • Web support and Lead generation  
  • Marketing tools for print and promotion
  • Home website
