story:
Childcare Revolution!

"Parents in the arts need to stage a childcare revolution." - Lyn Gardner, The Guardian, 13th March 2015

I'm raising money for something I've already started, largely self-funded: the gunpowder to start a childcare revolution - research (which sounds horribly dry, but gunpowder must be until it's needed...).  I have a little boy, which is wonderful; I now have no career, which is not.  I took this conundrum to a meeting about women in performing arts at my old drama college, and this little initiative came out of it.  At the risk of mentioning another yawn worthy word, I put together a survey with one of the organisers of the meeting, and let it fly around for a while.  We were helped tremendously by Lyn Gardner, RADA and many faceless names across social media and by word of mouth, up and down the country, as well as overseas, and after a little while we felt we had enough juice to get going on the report.


"For an industry that expects you to drop everything late notice, looking after another human being, be it a child or even another adult, is just not compatible."

I was upset.  This quote from the research is just one of hundreds highlighting a major shortfall in the collective creative industries' conscience.  How can any industry so neglect its caring culture, let alone one that's meant to "Hold as 'twere a mirror up to nature"? There is a massive and constant haemorrhage in talented, professional artists across the spectrum of creative industries going on, and here's why: low, or even no pay, long hours that often extend outside normal nursery or school times, high childcare fees that are rarely relative to wages and a rigid childcare system where advance booking for extended periods is essential, means being a parent in the arts is nigh on impossible, and there is little support for anyone who dares to try.  But it doesn't have to be that way.  It needs not to be that way for creative professions to be anything other than a playground for the wealthy, or those that are totally free of dependants, be it children or an adult in need of care.  A place where those representing domestic culture have become invisible.


"I've never felt more passionate about women...their stories, emotions, pay, power, control and ability to be fluid between being a mother AND an artist.  It's diabolic that childcare restricts our contribution to the industry."

Now I'm frustrated.  I have all this gunpowder, but no spark.  Well, I have my own fire of indignation, but that doesn't pay the bills.  Not wishing to get vulgar about this, my own savings are currently providing the spark, and there's not much of them.  I'm supposed to be presenting this report at a campaign launch to improve this situation, for parents in the UK and, hopefully, beyond.  The money raised would help in four ways: firstly, with focus; at the moment I have to balance other paid work alongside this project, all in the hours my baby sleeps, which isn't sustainable... Secondly, to be able to keep the survey software going until the report is done.  Thirdly, to set up a website for this research and its aims, and finally, and most importantly, to have the resources to make the presentation of the report itself a really good, hard hitting, memorable one. For example, I want to use actors to speak the quotes, and I'd like to be able to pay them! And I want change to explode into life from this report, not fizzle out in an inert splutter.  I want there to be subsidies for childcare in arts industries; ad hoc crèches where people can go for meetings, auditions or master classes; on site crèches in theatres, at the larger arts organisations and at filming studios; access to affordable childcare outside of office hours and an online resource for parents where they can get advice and network.  Eventually, I'll need to raise funds to set up a community centre for parents in the arts. A place to gather, meet new people, retrain, refresh, refocus and create, with free crèche facilities on site. But that'll be another campaign altogether, and it won't happen if this first stage fails.  


An Apology: 

I do wish I could make you a little video; it would just be very poor quality.  Probably me with my little boy sticking his fingers in my ear, shouting in what seems to be Russian.
story_txt: Childcare Revolution!"Parents in the arts need to stage a childcare revolution." - Lyn Gardner, The Guardian, 13th March 2015I'm raising money for something I've already started, largely self-funded: the gunpowder to start a childcare revolution - research (which sounds horribly dry, but gunpowder must be until it's needed...).  I have a little boy, which is wonderful; I now have no career, which is not.  I took this conundrum to a meeting about women in performing arts at my old drama college, and this little initiative came out of it.  At the risk of mentioning another yawn worthy word, I put together a survey with one of the organisers of the meeting, and let it fly around for a while.  We were helped tremendously by Lyn Gardner, RADA and many faceless names across social media and by word of mouth, up and down the country, as well as overseas, and after a little while we felt we had enough juice to get going on the report."For an industry that expects you to drop everything late notice, looking after another human being, be it a child or even another adult, is just not compatible."I was upset.  This quote from the research is just one of hundreds highlighting a major shortfall in the collective creative industries' conscience.  How can any industry so neglect its caring culture, let alone one that's meant to "Hold as 'twere a mirror up to nature"? There is a massive and constant haemorrhage in talented, professional artists across the spectrum of creative industries going on, and here's why: low, or even no pay, long hours that often extend outside normal nursery or school times, high childcare fees that are rarely relative to wages and a rigid childcare system where advance booking for extended periods is essential, means being a parent in the arts is nigh on impossible, and there is little support for anyone who dares to try.  But it doesn't have to be that way.  It needs not to be that way for creative professions to be anything other than a playground for the wealthy, or those that are totally free of dependants, be it children or an adult in need of care.  A place where those representing domestic culture have become invisible."I've never felt more passionate about women...their stories, emotions, pay, power, control and ability to be fluid between being a mother AND an artist.  It's diabolic that childcare restricts our contribution to the industry."Now I'm frustrated.  I have all this gunpowder, but no spark.  Well, I have my own fire of indignation, but that doesn't pay the bills.  Not wishing to get vulgar about this, my own savings are currently providing the spark, and there's not much of them.  I'm supposed to be presenting this report at a campaign launch to improve this situation, for parents in the UK and, hopefully, beyond.  The money raised would help in four ways: firstly, with focus; at the moment I have to balance other paid work alongside this project, all in the hours my baby sleeps, which isn't sustainable... Secondly, to be able to keep the survey software going until the report is done.  Thirdly, to set up a website for this research and its aims, and finally, and most importantly, to have the resources to make the presentation of the report itself a really good, hard hitting, memorable one. And I want change to explode into life from this report, not fizzle out in an inert splutter.  I want there to be subsidies for childcare in arts industries; ad hoc crèches where people can go for meetings, auditions or master classes; on site crèches in theatres, at the larger arts organisations and at filming studios; access to affordable childcare outside of office hours and an online resource for parents where they can get advice and network.  Eventually, I'll need to raise funds to set up a community centre for parents in the arts. A place to gather, meet new people, retrain, refresh, refocus and create, with free crèche facilities on site. But that'll be another campaign altogether, and it won't happen if this first stage fails.  An Apology: I do wish I could make you a little video; it would just be very poor quality.  Probably me with my little boy sticking his fingers in my ear, shouting in what seems to be Russian.

story:
About Scott

As a former steelworker struggling to make ends meet and raise three children, I know what it was like to face challenges in my youth. When I became elected as Councillor for Ward 7 in Hamilton, I fought to improve the lives of students by working to make transit more accessible. I also worked with the Federation of Canadian Municipalities to make housing more affordable so that owning a home can finally be within reach amidst rising tuition costs.

If elected, I hope to continue improving the lives of students and youth at the Federal level. I want to restore the Federal government's role in making education more accessible and affordable. By implementing the Innovation Tax Credit for Entrepreneurs and ensuring that interns receive the same protection as other workers, students and youth will have the opportunities, as well as the tools and experience necessary, to break into the workforce.

I will also work to deliver a $15 per day national child care plan, which will help make living more affordable for students and youth with children. Hamilton needs someone to represent them, and ensure that transit and housing are accessible while tackling the rising debt students are facing. Make your voice heard by contributing to the Scott Duvall campaign!

Why Donate?

It doesn't matter if it is $1 or the maximum donation of $1500, every donation to a candidate's campaign is a show of support and greatly appreciated. 

With Harper's extension of the election period, it is more important than ever that we all show our support financially and come together as a community to support our candidate. Please note, however, that only Canadian residents can donate.

Did you know that all Canadians with taxable income receive generous tax credits when they donate to Canada’s NDP? When donating any amount to this campaign, please ensure you have claimed the "Tax Receipt" perk so that you are mailed a receipt!

You get back:

  • 75% for the first $400 you donate.
  • 50% for the next $350 you donate.
  • 33 1/3% of the rest.

What Do Students & Youth Have To Say?

    

Danielle - Student - University of Ottawa

"This upcoming election I will be voting for Scott Duvall because as my Ward Councillor, Scott was excellent at his job and at serving the community. I know Scott's many years of experience make him well equipped to represent me and my fellow Hamiltonians in Ottawa. Scott comes from a team of candidates that I believe will improve the quality of life for all Canadians especially youth."

Dana - Graduate - McMaster University

"As a McMaster graduate I came to Hamilton almost 10 years ago not expecting that this would become my permanent home. Yet, I found myself continuously drawn to Hamilton, with its combination of big town convenience and small town charm. 

Hamilton gave me opportunities that I could not find elsewhere and those opportunities came from the help of mentors like Scott Duvall. When searching for employment, like many other young graduates I called upon each of the political parties to find out if they could help me. Unlike the Liberal and Conservative parties, Scott went above and beyond to meet me for coffee, invite me to networking events, and nominate me for positions within the Hamilton Mountain NDP riding. 

I believe that Scott will be a wonderful MP for the Hamilton Mountain and that he will work hard for our voices and concerns to be heard in Ottawa. He is the type of man who will make time to meet with you personally and help mediate negotiations to encourage win-win results.  Please join me in supporting Scott's campaign and show him that students can make a difference this election."

Lily - Graduate - University of Waterloo

"As a recent graduate who knows Scott Duvall and his work as a Councillor I know he listens, responds, and acts. That's the type of person we need fighting for us in Ottawa. We need a government that will fight for jobs for youth. As a recent graduate struggling to find employment, I know Scott will act as a voice for me in Ottawa."

Daniela - Graduate - McMaster University

"As a volunteer with team Scott Duvall, I am supporting his campaign because Scott is an experienced leader in the labour movement and at the municipal level. His expertise will translate well to federal politics and he is such a pleasure to work with!"

Tyler - Student - McMaster University

"I'm supporting Scott Duvall for Hamilton Mountain MP in the upcoming election. As someone who supports improving public transit, protecting the environment, and weeding out corruption in government, it's good to know that there's a candidate out there who's standing up for what I believe in. Scott has done a great job fighting for the people of Hamilton at City Hall and I'm confident that he'll do a great job fighting for us in Parliament as well!"

Other Ways To Help...

If you can't donate but would like to help the campaign in other ways, then I would love to hear from you! The links below will direct you to my Twitter, Facebook, and Webpage so that you can stay in touch. I am always looking for volunteers as well, so please reach out through those methods if you are willing to help!

[Facebook]     [Twitter]     [Webpage]

Authorized by the Official Agent for the Scott Duvall campaign.

story:
Active Heroes is a 501c3 charity

Active Heroes is a top rated charity and has helped over 8000 veterans at the first Community Center located in Louisville Kentucky. The community center serves these veterans with amazing activities, treatments and events designed to reduce post traumatic stress in an effort to reduce veteran suicide. Below are some of the great programs: 

  • Acupuncture treatments and massage
  • Music lessons
  • Seminars 
  • Family events 
  • Job Listings
  • Resources supporting all needs

 

To open a new Community Center, we need to raise $125,000

Our goal is to raise $125,000 that will go into securing a location, purchasing equipment and starting programs to serve veterans in the winning state location. We need to fund these items:

  • Fund location - Need at least 3000 square feet of space
  • Pay for the massage/acupuncture beds and fund these programs
  • Purchase signs and material wall mounts
  • Fund computer and security systems
  • Hire event coordinator

 

The Impact

Your donation makes a huge difference! We have averaged 4000 veterans receiving services a year at our current community center location. These veterans love the programs and keep coming back to build camaraderie and help them reintegrate after service. 

"I was in pain constantly and was using medication all day," said US Army Veteran Travis Prather. "After getting acupuncture and massage treatments at the Active Heroes Community center, I was released of my neck pain. I loved the team of military families that I could talk to at the center and signed my family up for the Christmas party." 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people can't contribute, but you can still volunteer to host smaller events in your local community by signing up to become a team leader or volunteer at our current locations. Learn more about volunteer opportunities here: https://activeheroes.org/volunteer/

 

 

GET THE LIMITED EDITON SHIRT FOR A $75 DONATION:

story:
The Vision

What began as a peek into the window of this beautiful iconic building has turned into a vision for Ventura that has founders Jim Rice and Linda Jordan, along with their team, working day and night to bring Peiranos Market back to life.

When you walk into the market all your senses are going to be awakened.  You will be drawn in by the vast array of colors of locally sourced fruits, vegetables, and fresh flowers.  The aromas of freshly brewed coffee and just baked Italian pastries will sweep over you.  Mouthwatering and inventive flavor profiles from the delicatessen will challenge and rouse your tastebuds like never before.  You will be able to  enjoy your favorite deli sandwich or your own specialty salad on the expansive patio next to the sights and sounds of the bubbling fountain with the soft caress of the ocean breeze.  Immerse  yourself in bustling conversation and  laughter in a marketplace that is alive with energy.

The Video that Started it All!

- Over 106,000 views to date, over 2,000 shares, over 500 comments from you in support!

 

“Our vision is for Peirano’s Market to be a place for all Venturans to come and feel welcome.  A town center.  A place where people meet, families gather, and food experiences are shared.”  

- Jim Rice & Linda Jordan, Founders

The Concept

The Peirano's Market is rich with history. It takes us back to a simpler less hectic time where you had a moment to chat with the owner, run into your neighbors and catch up, share stories. It was a place and time where you experienced a true sense of community.  Our goal is to honor that proud history while implementing the best of today's technology, service, and features.

The delicatessen will be something to behold featuring in-house cured meats, prepared foods, and family meals to go. There will be a combination of deli staples and favorites, sandwiches beyond your wildest dreams, plus culinary adventures made from local harvest.  There will be fresh brewed coffee, homemade pastries and desserts, a world class salad bar, and a selection of healthy, organic juices.  

The butcher shop portion of the market will feature an impressive variety of locally sourced meats.  Our fish section will feature the best of our local sustainable catches.  

All of this can be enjoyed at your home, office, or on the beautiful, state-of-the-art patio (architect rendering pictured below) facing out to Figueroa Plaza and Mission Park.

Jim and Linda’s first order of business was to seek out a classically trained chef who aligned with their vision.  Their first call was to Executive Chef Tim Kilcoyne (SideCar Restaurant, Scratch Food Truck) who immediately agreed to bring his culinary skills to deliver one of the most delectable menus this town has ever seen.

Chef Tim's relationship with local ranchers and farmers is unparalleled. The market will feature the best and brightest in local produce, meat, and fish from Ventura County’s bountiful community.

"I moved here to be in the center of the best agriculture in the Country.  I’m so excited to bring this bounty to every dish I create." 

-Tim Kilcoyne, Executive Chef

The “Why”

This endeavor is about more than bringing back a historic market. It is about the revitalization of one of the most beautiful and significant areas of Ventura. It is where our town was born. It is a magical location where you can see the surf break at C Street from the Mission steps. It is a place of historical significance, with China Alley, Figueroa Plaza, and the 150 year old fig tree in Mission Park.

This area is not the the thriving community center it once was, however it's potential is undeniable and Peirano's Market & Delicatessen can be the catalyst of its revitalization.

The market is strategically located to bring change to this area and the founders have a plan in place that is currently underway and need your help to bring it fully to fruition.  Here's the plan:

Activate Mission Park/Figueroa Plaza

Jim and Linda, like so many others, believe that Mission Park is one of the most beautiful and under utilized gems in Ventura.  Their  goal is to fill this park with activities that celebrate community and families, to make and keep this park safe and clean. Peirano’s is in position A to have a positive impact on this historical and beautiful  part of town.  They are already working in collaboration with the City of Ventura, Parks Department, the DVP (Downtown Ventura Partners), Turning Point Foundation, and our neighbors to activate Mission Park. 

Peirano’s Market will be the cornerstone and driving force for a series of events that will feature the plaza’s original purpose as a community gathering spot.

  • Farmer’s Market
  • Car Shows
  • Peirano’s Picnics and Music in the Park
  • Movies in the Park
  • Shakespeare in the Park
  • Yoga Classes

If you’ve ever stood at the fountain in Figueroa Plaza and looked back to the ocean you can agree it is one of the most beautiful places in Ventura.  It’s the city’s birthplace.  Jim & Linda want to have more Venturans enjoy its historic beauty.

First step, our state of the art patio. Our comfortable and accommodating outdoor seating will be bustling morning, noon, and early evening with friends and family enjoying the best food and drink that Ventura has to offer. Those that choose to stay as opposed to taking their food “to go” will get to relax and enjoy our comfortable outdoor seating, the charm of the Mission Bells, and revel in the sights of sounds of a bustling Mission Park. 

We Brought Recess Back to Mission Park

The first goal was to increase the use of the park during  the week.  An idea took shape.  Jim & Linda reached out to Father Tom, and Edie Lanphar, the principal of Holy Cross School.  The idea was to bring the students of Holy Cross across to Mission Park for their recess.  

This was something that hadn’t been done in over a decade because parents and administrators didn’t see it as safe.  In collaboration with the Downtown Ventura Partners Park Ambassadors program the park is cleared and the children now are able to have their recess on grass, rather than asphalt.

Let's 'Perk' It Up

Your contribution will have both an intrinsic and experiential reward.  Pretty sweet right?  Helping the greater good of the community you live in paired with some awesome, exclusive culinary adventures is as 'Win-Win' as it gets.

Perks for this campaign include a Peirano's branded picnic basket.  The classically styled baskets will be ready to be packed to the brim with Peirano's goodies and taken along on any outdoor happenings including the upcoming Peirano's Picnics in the Park.

Be "A Cut Above" and forever immortalized on the Peirano's Wall of Gratitude. There's a perk for that.  Your family's name will be placed on a cutting board arranged with the others to create an amazing work of art greeting each customer as they enter the store.  Make sure you choose a perk at $500 and above to secure your place in history.

If you are one for experiences there is no shortage of those.  Whether it be cooking classes, an intimate dinner with the founders, an exclusive menu preview, or being one of the first to book the private Brewster Room for your event you culinary thrill seekers will have your needs covered.

The pièce de résistance?  Included with the top tier perk is the Peirano's Patron Card which is good for 10% off all purchases for an entire year (up to $500/month, alcohol excluded).

Don't have a perk in mind?  Not a problem at all.  Any dollar amount that you choose to give is appreciated and paramount to the progress of this project.  Simply click the 'Back It' button and enter your contribution amount there.

We're In This Together

Peirano's has already received incredible support from the residents and nearby businesses who appreciate the vision and see what an incredible catalyst it will be be for the rebirth of the West side of Main Street.

John Silva of the DuPuis Group, a nationally renown advertising agency headquartered in Downtown Ventura had graciously offered to head an advisory council for Peirano's Market & Delicatessen.  Hear what he had to say about this project:

"For more than twenty years I've had the honor of working on some of the world's most recognized brands and I can tell you that beyond commerce and sales they all need and want one thing--- TO MATTER. That's the hard part because you can't back into having authentic purpose. From the moment we all heard about the push by Jim and Linda to re-imagine and reopen our town's iconic Peirano's Market and Deli, didn't we all feel a little rush of pride and inspiration? I did, because that market is a fond piece of our shared history here in this city and will be an authentic, addition to it's prosperous future-- even catalytic to revitalization. That's why I am supporting Jim and Linda and will be doing what I can to help this dream become a reality. Ventura's soul and authentic community will get a bump the moment the doors open! Let's do this."

It Comes Down to You

Jim & Linda want this to be your market. They have embraced this endeavor and responsibility.  They have built a team of people overflowing with talent and grounded with integrity.  They have a business plan that will only feature the best of everything.  The best bread.  The best pastries.  The best sandwiches.  The best menu.  The best...well, you get the picture.

The best will be achieved without compromise.  The word "compromise" is not in the DNA of Peirano's Market & Delicatessen nor in its founders.  They are “All In” and now they need your help.  

Your contribution will go to:

  • Providing cutting edge equipment and technology so Peirano's can serve you better
  • Helping speed up the construction and development process so Peirano's can open sooner
  • Supporting the activation of Mission Park & Figueroa Plaza featuring a full calendar of family and cultural events

Remember that when you contribute, every time you walk in the door from opening day forward you’ll know you played a fundamental role in the revitalization of Ventura’s most historic gathering place.  Be the change!

We couldn’t have been more humbled by the outpouring of support we have received thus far.  So many views of our video, so many shares, so many messages saying you can’t wait for us to open.  Please contribute what you can and continue on this journey with us.  Thank you very, very much.

- Jim Rice & Linda Jordan, Founders

 

Real people...Real food

The Video that Started it All!


- Over 106,000 views to date, over 2,000 shares, over 500 comments from you in support!

 
“Our vision is for Peirano’s Market to be a place for all Venturans to come and feel welcome.  A town center.  A place where people meet, families gather, and food experiences are shared.”  
- Jim Rice & Linda Jordan, Founders
The Concept
The Peirano's Market is rich with history. It takes us back to a simpler less hectic time where you had a moment to chat with the owner, run into your neighbors and catch up, share stories. It was a place and time where you experienced a true sense of community.  Our goal is to honor that proud history while implementing the best of today's technology, service, and features.
The delicatessen will be something to behold featuring in-house cured meats, prepared foods, and family meals to go. There will be a combination of deli staples and favorites, sandwiches beyond your wildest dreams, plus culinary adventures made from local harvest.  There will be fresh brewed coffee, homemade pastries and desserts, a world class salad bar, and a selection of healthy, organic juices.  
The butcher shop portion of the market will feature an impressive variety of locally sourced meats.  Our fish section will feature the best of our local sustainable catches.  
All of this can be enjoyed at your home, office, or on the beautiful, state-of-the-art patio (architect rendering pictured below) facing out to Figueroa Plaza and Mission Park.

Jim and Linda’s first order of business was to seek out a classically trained chef who aligned with their vision.  Their first call was to Executive Chef Tim Kilcoyne (SideCar Restaurant, Scratch Food Truck) who immediately agreed to bring his culinary skills to deliver one of the most delectable menus this town has ever seen.

Chef Tim's relationship with local ranchers and farmers is unparalleled. The market will feature the best and brightest in local produce, meat, and fish from Ventura County’s bountiful community.
"I moved here to be in the center of the best agriculture in the Country.  I’m so excited to bring this bounty to every dish I create." 
-Tim Kilcoyne, Executive Chef
The “Why”
This endeavor is about more than bringing back a historic market. It is about the revitalization of one of the most beautiful and significant areas of Ventura. It is where our town was born. It is a magical location where you can see the surf break at C Street from the Mission steps. It is a place of historical significance, with China Alley, Figueroa Plaza, and the 150 year old fig tree in Mission Park.
This area is not the the thriving community center it once was, however it's potential is undeniable and Peirano's Market & Delicatessen can be the catalyst of its revitalization.
The market is strategically located to bring change to this area and the founders have a plan in place that is currently underway and need your help to bring it fully to fruition.  Here's the plan:
Activate Mission Park/Figueroa Plaza
Jim and Linda, like so many others, believe that Mission Park is one of the most beautiful and under utilized gems in Ventura.  Their  goal is to fill this park with activities that celebrate community and families, to make and keep this park safe and clean. Peirano’s is in position A to have a positive impact on this historical and beautiful  part of town.  They are already working in collaboration with the City of Ventura, Parks Department, the DVP (Downtown Ventura Partners), Turning Point Foundation, and our neighbors to activate Mission Park. 

Peirano’s Market will be the cornerstone and driving force for a series of events that will feature the plaza’s original purpose as a community gathering spot.

Farmer’s Market
Car Shows
Peirano’s Picnics and Music in the Park
Movies in the Park
Shakespeare in the Park
Yoga Classes

If you’ve ever stood at the fountain in Figueroa Plaza and looked back to the ocean you can agree it is one of the most beautiful places in Ventura.  It’s the city’s birthplace.  Jim & Linda want to have more Venturans enjoy its historic beauty.
First step, our state of the art patio. Our comfortable and accommodating outdoor seating will be bustling morning, noon, and early evening with friends and family enjoying the best food and drink that Ventura has to offer. Those that choose to stay as opposed to taking their food “to go” will get to relax and enjoy our comfortable outdoor seating, the charm of the Mission Bells, and revel in the sights of sounds of a bustling Mission Park. 
We Brought Recess Back to Mission Park
The first goal was to increase the use of the park during  the week.  An idea took shape.  Jim & Linda reached out to Father Tom, and Edie Lanphar, the principal of Holy Cross School.  The idea was to bring the students of Holy Cross across to Mission Park for their recess.  

This was something that hadn’t been done in over a decade because parents and administrators didn’t see it as safe.  In collaboration with the Downtown Ventura Partners Park Ambassadors program the park is cleared and the children now are able to have their recess on grass, rather than asphalt.
Let's 'Perk' It Up
Your contribution will have both an intrinsic and experiential reward.  Pretty sweet right?  Helping the greater good of the community you live in paired with some awesome, exclusive culinary adventures is as 'Win-Win' as it gets.

Perks for this campaign include a Peirano's branded picnic basket.  The classically styled baskets will be ready to be packed to the brim with Peirano's goodies and taken along on any outdoor happenings including the upcoming Peirano's Picnics in the Park.
Be "A Cut Above" and forever immortalized on the Peirano's Wall of Gratitude. There's a perk for that.  Your family's name will be placed on a cutting board arranged with the others to create an amazing work of art greeting each customer as they enter the store.  Make sure you choose a perk at $500 and above to secure your place in history.

If you are one for experiences there is no shortage of those.  Whether it be cooking classes, an intimate dinner with the founders, an exclusive menu preview, or being one of the first to book the private Brewster Room for your event you culinary thrill seekers will have your needs covered.

The pièce de résistance?  Included with the top tier perk is the Peirano's Patron Card which is good for 10% off all purchases for an entire year (up to $500/month, alcohol excluded).
Don't have a perk in mind?  Not a problem at all.  Any dollar amount that you choose to give is appreciated and paramount to the progress of this project.  Simply click the 'Back It' button and enter your contribution amount there.
We're In This Together
Peirano's has already received incredible support from the residents and nearby businesses who appreciate the vision and see what an incredible catalyst it will be be for the rebirth of the West side of Main Street.

John Silva of the DuPuis Group, a nationally renown advertising agency headquartered in Downtown Ventura had graciously offered to head an advisory council for Peirano's Market & Delicatessen.  Hear what he had to say about this project:
"For more than twenty years I've had the honor of working on some of the world's most recognized brands and I can tell you that beyond commerce and sales they all need and want one thing--- TO MATTER. That's the hard part because you can't back into having authentic purpose. From the moment we all heard about the push by Jim and Linda to re-imagine and reopen our town's iconic Peirano's Market and Deli, didn't we all feel a little rush of pride and inspiration? I did, because that market is a fond piece of our shared history here in this city and will be an authentic, addition to it's prosperous future-- even catalytic to revitalization. That's why I am supporting Jim and Linda and will be doing what I can to help this dream become a reality. Ventura's soul and authentic community will get a bump the moment the doors open! Let's do this."
It Comes Down to You
Jim & Linda want this to be your market. They have embraced this endeavor and responsibility.  They have built a team of people overflowing with talent and grounded with integrity.  They have a business plan that will only feature the best of everything.  The best bread.  The best pastries.  The best sandwiches.  The best menu.  The best...well, you get the picture.
The best will be achieved without compromise.  The word "compromise" is not in the DNA of Peirano's Market & Delicatessen nor in its founders.  They are “All In” and now they need your help.  
Your contribution will go to:

Providing cutting edge equipment and technology so Peirano's can serve you better
Helping speed up the construction and development process so Peirano's can open sooner
Supporting the activation of Mission Park & Figueroa Plaza featuring a full calendar of family and cultural events

Remember that when you contribute, every time you walk in the door from opening day forward you’ll know you played a fundamental role in the revitalization of Ventura’s most historic gathering place.  Be the change!

We couldn’t have been more humbled by the outpouring of support we have received thus far.  So many views of our video, so many shares, so many messages saying you can’t wait for us to open.  Please contribute what you can and continue on this journey with us.  Thank you very, very much. 
- Jim Rice & Linda Jordan, Founders

 

Real people...Real food

story:
JumpStart Auto Repair

Join Our Mission to Spark Change

Our Story

Three years ago, two domestic violence agencies came together to discuss a recurring problem. Too many domestic abuse victims were unable to leave an abusive relationship because they didn’t have the safe, reliable transportation they needed to get employment or education and become self-sufficient.

With that problem came an opportunity. The organizations learned 65% of auto repair decisions are made by women.

The idea for Jumpstart, LLC – a garage for good – was born.

JumpStart Auto Repair is an auto repair facility offering a purple carpet experience designed especially for female customers. Profits from each appointment are used to fund auto repairs for domestic violence survivors.

  • Step 1: You bring your vehicle to JumpStart for auto repairs or maintenance.
  • Step 2: A certified technician performs the service. You pay the bill.
  • Step 3: We use profits to perform auto repairs and maintenance for domestic abuse survivors.

How JumpStart is Different

As a garage for good, JumpStart is different in three ways:

  • Giving the Purple Carpet Treatment – Purple is a color of courage and creativity, and is the symbol of support for survivors of domestic violence. With our Purple Carpet Treatment, you can expect a warm personal experience, honest answers about your vehicle and the knowledge you are making a difference.
  • Sparking Change – Profits from our work help keep domestic abuse survivors on the road to self-sufficiency. Our educational workshops will help women feel more comfortable and confident about vehicle ownership. 
  • Bringing More Women into Auto Repair Careers – Fewer than 10% of all auto repair technicians are women. JumpStart will help change that by introducing more women to these well-paying, family-supporting careers.

Why Crowdfunding?

JumpStart Auto Repair is launching as a pop-up shop and needs $18,750 for start-up expenses. We’ve been fortunate to receive use of temporary garage space at the state-of-the-art JJ Keller Transportation Center at Fox Valley Technical College.  So, that means 100% of the funds you give to JumpStart will go to marketing the business, buying supplies, obtaining proper permits and insurance, and expenses associated with building the right team of employees.   

If our Indiegogo campaign is fully funded, we can open our doors to paying customers needing auto maintenance and repairs. As we welcome paying customers, we can likewise begin repairs on domestic abuse survivors’ vehicles and help remove transportation as a barrier to their self-sufficiency.

Our long-term vision is to open our own garage. We cannot take this first step without your support!

Please consider contributing to this campaign. We’ve put some perks in place for your generosity. If you cannot donate money at this time, please consider creating some noise by sharing this campaign via your social channels. This dream becomes a reality with monetary support and willingness to spread the word. Simply use the sharing links via Indiegogo in the upper right hand corner.

Check Out Our Perks

JumpStart Window Cling

JumpStart Mug

JumpStart Oil Change

JumpStart Tote

Want to know more about JumpStart Auto Repair?

Follow us on Facebook at facebook.com/jumpstartautorepair

story:
Who are we?

Hi! We're Unique Waxing & Laser Studio, a small, local hair removal studio in Amsterdam East, on the Middenweg. We are known for the original Brazilian wax and offer high quality treatments with personal service and beautiful results. 

 

What We Need & What You Get

We have been closed for over a month and are now facing a very uncertain timeline as to when we can open and operate as we did before.  We did not think that the closure would go on this long.  The only timeline for sure is the monthly expenses we have already, they do not go away. 

We know that some people feel better about giving if they get a little something in return, so we have created rewards.  We have created some treatment packages and experiences to get you excited for the doors to open again.  Our GOAL is to raise € 5,000 which will go towards fixed expenses, such as rental costs. If we raise more than our goal, we plan on continuing to use those funds to pay for expenses and salary support for our employees. 

 

Want to Pay with iDeal? 

Whatsapp us on +31 626628800 and let us know which perk you would like to buy or how much you would like to contribute. Also do send us your name and email address. We will send you a Tikki by which you can pay with iDeal. 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you cannot contribute, please consider sharing our Indiegogo campaign link on your socials. Your help spreading the word means the world to us.

Tag us on Instagram and Facebook @Uniquewaxingstudio

Thank you,

Lily & Team

story:
Rediscovered Books is a vibrant independent bookstore in Boise, Idaho. Since Bruce and Laura Delaney opened the store in 2006, it has been a cultural hub in the city of Boise as a place “where books and people meet”. 

We are adding a Rediscovered Books location to Caldwell, Idaho and we are asking people to purchase Book Bonds (gift certificates) to help us stock the shelves of the new space with even more great books. 

More people reading more books will make our world a better place, and a successful Indiegogo Campaign will allow us to have the inventory we want at our fingertips on opening day.  

We want to help "books and people meet" in Caldwell, and your contribution to the campaign will make that happen from Day 1.

  • Our goal is $12,000. This will help us fill the shelves of our new store with even more GREAT reads for everyone!
  • Check out our awesome incentives! Whether you donate $5 - $5,000, every little bit helps.  Our amazing booksellers have created stickers, pins, and totes for unique incentives and we have some bookstore adventures available to help us welcome you all to our Caldwell store.
  • There are even some surprises available!
Other Ways You Can Help:

Share this with your friends and help us fill the shelves! Use social media or simply use the Indiegogo share tool and pass the word!

story:
Summary

We, at Tetratos, have built a prototype small business Intrusion Detection/Intrusion Protection and Security Information and Event management device prototype that we are looking for funding to take from prototype to production. This device will be a 24/7 cloud-managed device protecting the internal networks of small business that cannot typically afford the cybersecurity framework that is currently available and is one of the main causes that small businesses are the primary target of hackers worldwide. It is designed to provide:

Security Analytics, Intrusion Detection, Log Data Analysis, File Integrity Monitoring, Vulnerability Detection, Configuration Assessment, Incident Response, Regulatory Compliance, Cloud Security Monitoring, Containers Security and malware analysis. 

It will be a cost-effective solution for internal security, network audits, Intrusion detection, and prevention, early warning of malicious traffic and event log alerting to a security operations center, providing small business with a way to prevent and recover from malicious activity effectively and maintain regulatory compliance like HIPAA, PCI, SOX, ect. 

It is the only thing like it that will be offered at a price range that a small business can afford that is backed by a managed security operations center. There are devices like this, but with an entry point and annual cost that make them cost prohibitive to operate and are outside of what small businesses can even consider.

Help us help Small Business and be a part of the solution!

About Tetratos Managed Technology and Security

We are not your typical Managed Service Provider (MSP). We are also not your typical Managed Security Service Provider (MSSP).  We have taken leadership from both models and formed Tetratos, a Managed Technology and Security Services Provider.

The partnership team at Tetratos have worked in the enterprise and MSP worlds for many years. We have seen the ownership at other companies bait and switch their clients. We have watched MSPs make promises of delivery and then underdeliver.

We have witnessed them overprice their hardware and software sales multiple times over MSRP, just because the client wouldn't be able to identify that they were paying two to three times what you could get just off Amazon alone.

We have seen ownership at MSPs monitor individual email boxes of their client's decision-makers without permission, thereby violating privacy laws without recourse. 

We have actually been told by an owner that "Client's are just a commodity to be traded between MSPs annually. You lose one to a competitor and you gain one of theirs."

Tetratos has decided enough is enough!

We have built our practice on three pillars. Honor, Loyalty, and Commitment!

We are a veteran-owned technology firm that wants to be a partner with our clients, not just a vendor that they do business with! That means when you have a technical issue that is affecting your ability to produce, it affects us too, we take it personally.

We put our heart in our work and that shows in the outcome of our product. 

While most MSPs claim that they offer security services, they define these as putting in a firewall and managed anti-virus. Tetratos offers all the advantages of an MSP plus the full MSSP stack from 24x7 Security Operations Center, real-time traffic analysis, Vulnerability and Penetration testing with remediation and much more. 

Most importantly we have been developing and have reached a proven prototype stage of a network security device that is plug and play for the customer but provides real-time traffic analysis for viruses, malware, ransomware, shadow IT, illegal activity, unapproved software or hardware, internal vulnerability testing, and reporting, SecureDNS, and regulatory compliance assessments all in one device. This device is cost-effective for the small business market which statistically is the most targeted industry by hackers.  

While a proper Unified Threat Management/Next-Generation Firewall is great for what we refer to as "North/South" traffic, our device is designed to monitor and reports on the "East/West" traffic a.ka. the noise inside your network. 

Again, the key here is being able to protect the Small and Medium-sized business market. The Fortune 500 have the funding to afford large robust cybersecurity frameworks, toolsets, and staff. Our key market does not. 

Our next step is to take our proven prototype and make it manageable from a secure cloud infrastructure allowing a 360 view by our security teams. 

There are three key partners in the vision that is Tetratos:

Stephen Turner:

Stephen Turner is a 25-year veteran of the Information Technology world. His career began as a crypto technician in the United States Marine Corps.  He has worked all facets of the Information Technology world including administration, security, consulting, project management, Director and as a Chief Information Officer for a nationwide organization where he was responsible for architecting the security infrastructure during the migration of the organization’s entire data center to the “cloud”.  

He also served as the Director of Cyber Security – Cybersecurity and Research for the Florida Center for Cyber Security, a Florida organization established by legislation to position Florida as a national leader in cybersecurity through education and workforce development; innovative, interdisciplinary research; and community engagement

Stephen has trained as a Certified Ethical Hacker, Certified Information Systems Security Professional and as a Red Hat Certified Architect with a focus on Linux security and is a Microsoft Certified Systems Engineer.

He has also been a speaker at conferences and for organizations like the National Homeland Security Association and for the City of Columbus, OH. He has also had his cybersecurity papers published including his article, "The Art of Google-Fu or Using Search Engines to Plan A Cyber Attack"

Roger Maharg:

Roger Maharg has been in the IT industry for over 21 years.  He has worked in the small business arena and in enterprises sized environments and understands the needs of both.  Roger has worked in many different areas of IT including administration, management, consulting, project management, network design, implementation, professional services, vCIO, plus support for multiple network types & systems. 

He has significant management experience including overseeing service desks, system, and network administrators as well as field operations and dispatch. He has had significant experience in the development of policy and procedures and ensuring quality assurance of both policy and procedures but also in the quality control of the work his staff is involved in. 

Roger thrives in a team environment, mentoring, sharing knowledge and exchanging ideas with other team members. He is customer-focused, and consistently watching out for the best interest of the customers that he and his team support. 

Michal Weiss:

He started his career from the bottom and worked his way up quickly through the years due to his brilliant mind and quick learning skills.

Michal started his career as a Management Information Systems Technician with supporting over 700 users in a medical corporation. From there he has moved on to be a Systems Engineer for a Managed Systems Provider where he was responsible for several large accounts. After that, he went to work for a global Cyber Security Company as a Network Engineer.

From there he went to work as a Sr. Network Engineer for one of the largest Credit Card processing companies in the world with over 10k employees. 

Michal also holds several Information Technology industry certifications including A+, Network+, Security+, CCNA, PCNSA, and MCP. Michal is a network architect and firewall expert with a vision of total security. 

 

What We Need & What You Get

 

  • We need funding to continue operations for and during the development of our Network Security Device beyond the prototype stage.
  • But we believe that what we are developing will help change the security landscape of the small to medium-sized business sector and once developed past prototype stages and cloud-managed, we will be offering it as a service to other MSPs that need to better protect their client base beyond a "firewall and anti-virus software"
  • For those that contribute to this project, you will become a "Founder's Club" member that will be entitled to a quarterly entitlement. Members of the Founders Club, an elite membership, you will be eligible for a quarterly perk based on your contribution level. This perk will be voted on quarterly by the Board of Directors of Tetratos based on the success of the previous quarter. There is no end date for this quarterly perk as your contribution made our vision a reality.

 

The Impact

Small to medium-sized business are statistically reported in the news cycle as the top target for hackers. Their security is lacking and there is no funding for staffing. Outsourced MSSPs, for the most part, are outside of their operations budget.

Everyone that contributes to Tetratos and this project will not only become a Founder's Club member, with some crazy and awesome quarterly entitlements from a company trying to protect the little guy/gal for a price they can actually afford, but also, every small to medium-sized business that is better protected makes it harder for the common hacker to have an effect on businesses in a way that typically, after discovery of a breach, 60% go out of business in 6 months. 

Our success in this endeavor is helping keep these businesses in operation and you can be a part of that. 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you cannot contribute to the project for any reason, we thank you for just taking the time to read through this write up of our vision and we would be most thankful if you could share our vision and this opportunity with your social circles. You know, sharing is caring!!

This device is cost-effective for the small business market which statistically is the most targeted industry by hackers.  
While a proper Unified Threat Management/Next-Generation Firewall is great for what we refer to as "North/South" traffic, our device is designed to monitor and reports on the "East/West" traffic a.ka. the noise inside your network. 
Again, the key here is being able to protect the Small and Medium-sized business market. The Fortune 500 have the funding to afford large robust cybersecurity frameworks, toolsets, and staff. Our key market does not. 
Our next step is to take our proven prototype and make it manageable from a secure cloud infrastructure allowing a 360 view by our security teams. 
There are three key partners in the vision that is Tetratos:
Stephen Turner:
Stephen Turner is a 25-year veteran of the Information Technology world. His career began as a crypto technician in the United States Marine Corps.  He has worked all facets of the Information Technology world including administration, security, consulting, project management, Director and as a Chief Information Officer for a nationwide organization where he was responsible for architecting the security infrastructure during the migration of the organization’s entire data center to the “cloud”.  
He also served as the Director of Cyber Security – Cybersecurity and Research for the Florida Center for Cyber Security, a Florida organization established by legislation to position Florida as a national leader in cybersecurity through education and workforce development; innovative, interdisciplinary research; and community engagement
Stephen has trained as a Certified Ethical Hacker, Certified Information Systems Security Professional and as a Red Hat Certified Architect with a focus on Linux security and is a Microsoft Certified Systems Engineer.
He has also been a speaker at conferences and for organizations like the National Homeland Security Association and for the City of Columbus, OH. He has also had his cybersecurity papers published including his article, "The Art of Google-Fu or Using Search Engines to Plan A Cyber Attack"
Roger Maharg:
Roger Maharg has been in the IT industry for over 21 years.  He has worked in the small business arena and in enterprises sized environments and understands the needs of both.  Roger has worked in many different areas of IT including administration, management, consulting, project management, network design, implementation, professional services, vCIO, plus support for multiple network types & systems. 
He has significant management experience including overseeing service desks, system, and network administrators as well as field operations and dispatch. He has had significant experience in the development of policy and procedures and ensuring quality assurance of both policy and procedures but also in the quality control of the work his staff is involved in. 
Roger thrives in a team environment, mentoring, sharing knowledge and exchanging ideas with other team members. He is customer-focused, and consistently watching out for the best interest of the customers that he and his team support. 
Michal Weiss:
He started his career from the bottom and worked his way up quickly through the years due to his brilliant mind and quick learning skills.
Michal started his career as a Management Information Systems Technician with supporting over 700 users in a medical corporation. From there he has moved on to be a Systems Engineer for a Managed Systems Provider where he was responsible for several large accounts. After that, he went to work for a global Cyber Security Company as a Network Engineer.
From there he went to work as a Sr. Network Engineer for one of the largest Credit Card processing companies in the world with over 10k employees. 
Michal also holds several Information Technology industry certifications including A+, Network+, Security+, CCNA, PCNSA, and MCP. Michal is a network architect and firewall expert with a vision of total security. 
 

What We Need & What You Get
 

We need funding to continue operations for and during the development of our Network Security Device beyond the prototype stage.
But we believe that what we are developing will help change the security landscape of the small to medium-sized business sector and once developed past prototype stages and cloud-managed, we will be offering it as a service to other MSPs that need to better protect their client base beyond a "firewall and anti-virus software"


For those that contribute to this project, you will become a "Founder's Club" member that will be entitled to a quarterly entitlement. Members of the Founders Club, an elite membership, you will be eligible for a quarterly perk based on your contribution level. This perk will be voted on quarterly by the Board of Directors of Tetratos based on the success of the previous quarter. There is no end date for this quarterly perk as your contribution made our vision a reality.


 
The Impact
Small to medium-sized business are statistically reported in the news cycle as the top target for hackers. Their security is lacking and there is no funding for staffing. Outsourced MSSPs, for the most part, are outside of their operations budget.
Everyone that contributes to Tetratos and this project will not only become a Founder's Club member, with some crazy and awesome quarterly entitlements from a company trying to protect the little guy/gal for a price they can actually afford, but also, every small to medium-sized business that is better protected makes it harder for the common hacker to have an effect on businesses in a way that typically, after discovery of a breach, 60% go out of business in 6 months. 
Our success in this endeavor is helping keep these businesses in operation and you can be a part of that. 
 

Other Ways You Can Help
If you cannot contribute to the project for any reason, we thank you for just taking the time to read through this write up of our vision and we would be most thankful if you could share our vision and this opportunity with your social circles. You know, sharing is caring!!

story:
The Kono's Story

Kono's Northshore is a family-owned and operated group of restaurants that has been serving the communities of Hawai'i since 2002! Our humble beginning starts on the world-famous North Shore in the town of Haleiwa. Thanks to the love and support of our communities, we opened our second location in 2016, a third in 2017, a boutique restaurant, The Surfing Pig, in 2018, and most recently our fourth establishment in the heart of Waikiki. We are an award-winning restaurant group most famous for our 12-hour slow roasted pork that accents every dish we have. This is what has given us the following we have today. Our customers continue to keep us busy with their consumption of over 70,000 pounds of our award-winning kalua pork year over year.

 

Our 'Ohana

Those who make up our Kono's Northshore restaurants are more than just team members. We are an 'ohana, or family in the Hawaiian language. This family is filled with energetic individuals with a knack for serving the food of the highest quality and who know how give customers a 5-star experience. We have built a team that thrives on upholding the highest standards and an exceptional record of customer excellence even when our customers aren't looking.

What We Do

Kono's Northshore is a quick-service restaurant chain that stands out against the rest with our award-winning slow-roasted kalua pork. With a modern take on traditional Hawaiian kalua pork, we work to provide the same delicious bite our fans from around the world have grown to love. Along with our main pillar of providing quality food, Kono's Northshore is focused on taking our customer service one step further with our extra aloha service for each and every customer. Our restaurants were created and continue to leave lasting impressions in our communities who love great food and our home as much as we do!

 

Spreading The Kono's Dream

All four of our Kono's locations and The Surfing Pig Hawaii currently reside in the state of Hawai'i. With the following that we have by our fans around the world, we want to take Kono's to the next level! Our next big adventure lies in the mainland U.S., with plans to expand across the Pacific over the next 12 months. We are looking to integrate ourselves in communities near and far, with an emphasis on showing old and new guests what Kono's is all about – uniqueness, quality food and the highest level of good vibes.

In return for helping Kono's make its first move to the mainland you will forever be a part of the Kono's 'ohana. Supporting our dream means you'll be eligible for some sweet Kono's gear, the chance to have your very own Kono's party, to join the Kono's Black Card Club or even have one of our famous burrito bombers named after you!

What Our Fans Are Saying

 

Other Ways You Can Spread The Kono's Dream

We know this year has been a tough one and understand wholeheartedly if a donation isn't feasible at the moment. We trust our loyal fans and all lovers of Kono's to help share our dream with the world to bring the world-famous pig to your communities!

We still need your help in spreading the word about our efforts! Share our campaign with friends, family, and anyone who you know would love the Kono's vibe! Whether you're a Hawaii native or a frequent visitor to the islands, we're asking for your help to make our dream a reality!

Share our Indiegogo campaign with your networks on Facebook, Instagram, email, or even in your conversations! We appreciate every bit and hope to be serving you our extra aloha real soon! Aloha and stay safe!

story:
Let's Protect Our Health Workers ASAP

Our frontline health workers don't have the essential protective equipment they need for the COVID-19 epidemic, medical centers are desperately running out of supplies and funds, and big manufacturing will take weeks (or months) to gear up and meet demand.  This really isn't okay.

To help, the Ovadia family has tooled its 37-year old, NJ-based manufacturing business Ovadia Corporation to produce the protective equipment that we can make best: face shields.  According to the CDC (and dozens of doctors/experts that we consulted), face shields are vital as a first line of defense for healthcare workers working with potential COVID-19 patients.

Our goal for the next two weeks is to get at least 10,000 standard face shields into the hands of medical workers as quickly and cheaply as possible to avoid infection (nearly 10% of cases in Italy are medical workers!) – while simultaneously keeping American workers proudly and safely employed (we would otherwise be forced to shut down and layoff our full staff).  

 

 

 

How You Can Help

We already created the tooling to produce face shields in our New Jersey facility, using our existing workforce that would otherwise be unemployed.  This is a 100% US-made product.

However, company owner Sue Ovadia and her son Moshe (who's volunteering his time) are not in a position to finance this project.  Large sums of money are required upfront to buy the raw materials, and salaries still need to be paid.  We can only do so much.

We are asking for funds to cover the materials + costs/overhead (current salaries, rent, utilities) associated with producing face shields:

  • Our goal is to deliver 10,000+ face shields with $40,000 of funding
  • Every $4 donated will go towards producing at least one shield, so $20 = at least 5 delivered face shields
  • This is a profit-free endeavor.  So if we can bring the costs lower than $4/shield, any money leftover would be used to produce more shields
  • If we fall short of our $40k goal, we'll produce a proportionate number of shields as soon as we raise $10,000 (e.g., $20k=5k shields); if we exceed our goal, we'll produce proportionately more shields.

Shields will be donated and delivered directly to needy medical centers in the NY-NJ-CT area – the epicenter of the US epidemic (literally 2/3 of all US cases), and where our plant is based.  To save transit costs, donations would be delivered by Ovadia staff or volunteers to medical centers with stated needs on this registry.

 

 

The Time is Now

The number of NY-area cases of COVID-19 are increasing exponentially, with the peak forecast to be weeks away.  The more healthcare workers we can arm with the protective gear they need and are asking for, the less likely they are to get sick themselves.

To meet this urgency, we have used our initial funds to get as many shield out as possible, with 2,000 already donated by April 22nd.   We will provide regular updates to let you know how things are going on production and donations. 

Thank you in advance for collaborating on this effort to support our health workers (and keep a few people employed along the way)!

 

About the Ovadia Business & People

Ovadia Corporation was founded in 1982 in Little Falls, NJ, where we still operate today.  The company was founded by Sue and Joe Ovadia to produce innovative packaging for jewelry.  In our 37 years, we’ve earned 34 patents and sell our 100% American designed and manufactured products across six continents.  Though Joe passed away in 2012, Sue continues to run the business on her own at age 72, along with 17 employees.

When the COVID-19 epidemic began this month, Sue’s son Moshe decided to volunteer his time to help retool the family manufacturing business to be part of the solution.  More on Dr. Moshe Michael Ovadia here and here.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Please help spread the word about this effort on social media (and through Indiegogo share tools) to help us meet our goal! 

Backer support is also welcome to:

  • Spend time on the project as a volunteer for a few hours a day to keep our costs down (for example, we could really use help finding material suppliers, since many vendors are closed or out of stock, and others are price gauging)
  • Hand delivering face shields to medical centers (for those local to the NY area)
  • Track down the most needy medical centers for PPE/face shields among the 100+ NY area medical centers in need (our expertise is in making stuff, but we want to be really thoughtful about how we give these away)

story:
The Inside Story

In Minnesota, we're all held hostage by the extreme weather conditions. Snow, rain, heat, humidity, bugs  - it all gets in the way of our ability to get our dogs the exercise and socialization they need. Indoor Zoomies is the answer,

Indoor Zoomies is an indoor dog park that can promise the perfect conditions every day no matter the weather. 

Indoor Zoomies is needed by all dog lovers, including myself.  There are just too many days where the outdoor park isn't comfortable for me or my dog.  Maybe it rained, maybe it's too cold for my Chihuahua mix, maybe it's too hot for me to stand in the sun and for my dog to run until she's out of energy. So we're bringing the fun indoors

Indoor Zoomies will be more than just a dog park. While dogs might not need much more than open space and another pup buddy, we do. We want to forget that it's cruddy outside. We want to get work done and have a cup of coffee while our dogs play; and we want to make sure our dogs are safe under a watchful eye. I hear you!

Trained professionals will be on the play floor at all times making sure all play is positive and that your pup stays safe. We love dogs, too! We don't want anyone getting scared or hurt. 

Lastly, Indoor Zoomies will be partnering local rescues to host adoption events in a comfortable wide-open environment. Foster pups will be able to play, socialize, and show off their natural personalities with perspective families. There will also be special events such as foster dog Yoga and Pilates to help people meet these wonderful dogs.

Indoor Zoomies is so important to me, but it's also important for our dogs. I can't wait to open the doors and meet all your four-legged best friends. 

What We’ll Provide

5,000+ square feet of running room

Large and small dog area

A playground to burn more energy

Self Grooming Station with a vacuum and brush attachments

Solo and Group training classes

A coffee and work station 

Trained professionals on the play floor at all time. 

Canine accident cleanup

 

How do YOU benefit?

Professionals: Your dog can play and socialize while you get work done in our coffee lounge. Dogs will tire out quickly playing with one another and on our playground. We're also cheaper than boarding

Seniors: Your dog will tire himself out instead of tiring out you.  There will be seating in the  play floor area so you can relax.  We'll also have solid, sturdy flooring. No hills, mud, or bumps to worry about.     

People with mobility issues: Indoor Zoomies will be accessible to all. We'll have gate openings  wide enough for wheelchairs and flat, sturdy flooring for stability. 

Owners of dogs who never get tired: We'll have a playground that will burn energy faster than  flat ground. We offer monthly and annual passes that are UNLIMITED, meaning you can come in as often as you'd like. 

Join us for any of our Special Events

Painting with your dog

Foster dog Yoga and Pilates

Canine CPR & First Aid

Holiday gatherings

 

Indoor Zoomies is for everyone

 

 

 

Our Need

Indoor Zoomies is looking for $20,000 to secure a space, hire and train employees and to create a park you and your dog will love to visit.  Our goal is to keep your dog active, build a community of dog lovers, help dogs socialize, and assist in local canine adoptions. 

Think of all the days when you've wished there was a place to take your dog where he could release some of that energy. With all our snow, rain, mud, and bugs, getting your dog the exercise he needs can become stressful and messy. Indoor Zoomies will alleviate the frustration of the weather telling you when your dog can play. 

And we cannot wait to meet your dogs!!

The Cost Breakdown

With $5000, we can secure a location

With an extra $2000, we can get the fencing needed to create the play floors 

 $4000 allow us to purchase the play place seen above

$3000 will help us create the cafe area where you can relax and work while your dog tires himself out

All other funding will be used for training, tech, employees, aesthetics, and anything unforeseen that isn't good enough for you and your dog that we need to fix

story:
For 3 and a half years I have been the bread maker at Foodstory cafe in Aberdeen. Now I'm ready to open the world's greatest artisan bread bakery, right here in the heart of Aberdeen city!

"The best thing since sliced bread turns out not to be sliced bread”

  “Our supermarket loaf, which accounts for 80% of all the bread bought in the UK, is sweetish, soft and pappy. The ingredients listed on the plastic sleeve include added E-numbers, enzyme “improvers”, extra gluten, protein powders, fats, emulsifiers and preservatives. It is baked according to a process developed in the 1960s for speed, from grain that has been milled between steel rollers, removing the germ where the oils and nutrients reside, and the bran husk where the fibre is, leaving only the endosperm, a pure starch so nutritionally void that by UK law vitamins must be added back into white flour."

(The Guardian 10.10.2019)

Bandit Bakery will be an artisan bread bakery opening in Aberdeen's city centre in March 2021.  Bandit Bakery will produce superior bread that is baked using traditional sourdough methods and a focus on high quality ingredients. Sourdough bread has unique health properties that allow its nutrition to surpass that of regular bread. Bandit Bakery will also create bespoke, tailored bread for restaurants, bars and cafes in Aberdeen which is specifically made to pair with those businesses styles, menus and needs.

 

This is real bread made by real people.

 

Bandit Bakery will have a totally unique style and identity that will be reflected in every part of the business from the packaging to the premises. With this approach we hope to challenge people’s preconceived notions of a Scottish bakery and bring a traditional old-fashioned business into the modern era. 

At the same time there will be a real focus on communicating to customers that the methods used to create the bread are the same methods used for thousands of years- there is real history, tradition and a rich past in what we do. This strong history is something we want to respect and champion.

The food writer Julia Child once said British white bread tasted “like Kleenex”. Maybe that is why we load our white sliced toast with so much jam and chocolate spread and peanut butter. Sourdough bread is a very different beast; crunchy, crusty, chewy, with a complex taste that is rich, nutty and tangy.

We need your help to finalise the plans for the bakery!

We already have the funding to cover the basic costs of starting up but we need your help to bring the business to life. With your contributions we can purchase the best equipment available to help us make the best bread available as well as ensure the decor is as fantastic as we dream of it being.

We also want to be able to build a safe and easy to use website to allow customers to click and collect their orders as well as work with local bike couriers to deliver items purchased online straight to your door.

We have a long wish-list of items we want to add to the bakery, from big machinery like a Mockmill that will freshly grind grains into flour on site to a simple coat of paint for the walls and plants to liven up the place. Your contributions, no matter how big or small, will help us achieve this. And for those that contribute there are perks!
story_txt: For 3 and a half years I have been the bread maker at Foodstory cafe in Aberdeen. Now I'm ready to open the world's greatest artisan bread bakery, right here in the heart of Aberdeen city!"The best thing since sliced bread turns out not to be sliced bread”  “Our supermarket loaf, which accounts for 80% of all the bread bought in the UK, is sweetish, soft and pappy. The ingredients listed on the plastic sleeve include added E-numbers, enzyme “improvers”, extra gluten, protein powders, fats, emulsifiers and preservatives. It is baked according to a process developed in the 1960s for speed, from grain that has been milled between steel rollers, removing the germ where the oils and nutrients reside, and the bran husk where the fibre is, leaving only the endosperm, a pure starch so nutritionally void that by UK law vitamins must be added back into white flour."(The Guardian 10.10.2019)Bandit Bakery will be an artisan bread bakery opening in Aberdeen's city centre in March 2021.  Bandit Bakery will produce superior bread that is baked using traditional sourdough methods and a focus on high quality ingredients. Sourdough bread has unique health properties that allow its nutrition to surpass that of regular bread. Bandit Bakery will also create bespoke, tailored bread for restaurants, bars and cafes in Aberdeen which is specifically made to pair with those businesses styles, menus and needs. This is real bread made by real people. Bandit Bakery will have a totally unique style and identity that will be reflected in every part of the business from the packaging to the premises. With this approach we hope to challenge people’s preconceived notions of a Scottish bakery and bring a traditional old-fashioned business into the modern era. At the same time there will be a real focus on communicating to customers that the methods used to create the bread are the same methods used for thousands of years- there is real history, tradition and a rich past in what we do. This strong history is something we want to respect and champion.The food writer Julia Child once said British white bread tasted “like Kleenex”. Maybe that is why we load our white sliced toast with so much jam and chocolate spread and peanut butter. Sourdough bread is a very different beast; crunchy, crusty, chewy, with a complex taste that is rich, nutty and tangy.We need your help to finalise the plans for the bakery!We already have the funding to cover the basic costs of starting up but we need your help to bring the business to life. With your contributions we can purchase the best equipment available to help us make the best bread available as well as ensure the decor is as fantastic as we dream of it being.We also want to be able to build a safe and easy to use website to allow customers to click and collect their orders as well as work with local bike couriers to deliver items purchased online straight to your door.We have a long wish-list of items we want to add to the bakery, from big machinery like a Mockmill that will freshly grind grains into flour on site to a simple coat of paint for the walls and plants to liven up the place. Your contributions, no matter how big or small, will help us achieve this. And for those that contribute there are perks!

story:
The GROW gardens

Transition Guelph's newest urban food project! WE have been given a parcel of land to use at Grace Community Church just on the outskirts of Guelph. Our plan for this space is to create a volunteer run garden that will produce enough food for the volunteers and their families with the excess going to local food shelves and other people in the community in need! But we need a little help getting started!

What We Need & What You Get

 What we need is the money to buy soil and trees. We tried to dig only to find out the soil is actually gravel. The space given to us use to be a baseball diamond so our plan has changed. We need to build raised beds and that costs money!
We can only offer our gratitude at the moment. We would love for you to garden with us and to support your community by funding us if you cant offer your time :) There is a good parcel of this land that has decent soil where we plan to plant an orchard and would love your help with that as well!  

The Impact

 The money you donate will be focused on helping families learn to garden and grow food for themselves. Giving them a chance to help their children understand the importance of a balanced diet while also helping relieve some of the strain on their monthly food budget. The excess food will be donated to a few emergency food shelves in Guelph which also feed those in need during times of need.
The GROW garden is a stepping stone for learning and self sustainability with an emphasis on community building. Our hope is to bring people together through gardening and to better our community through sharing and positive experience.  
If you can't support us financially please volunteer or come and garden with us! Transition Guelph has so many projects that could use new energy! We all want to make our city the best possible place to live and raise a family.
Bring your kids, your grandparents, your life partners or your friends and help build a better Guelph!
