story:
#english version below

_ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _

Cosa è un crowdfunding?

Il crowdfunding o finanziamento collettivo in italiano, è un processo collaborativo di un gruppo di persone che utilizza il proprio denaro in comune per sostenere gli sforzi di persone e organizzazioni. È una pratica di microfinanziamento dal basso che mobilita persone e risorse.

_ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _


    Il progetto Campidarte

La storia.

Campidarte è il nome del progetto, è nato nel maggio 2012, come un progetto di tre 3 interior designer, Giampiero Bernazzani, Alberto Brancaleon e Giorgio Deplano, che hanno iniziato a riqualificare quattro capannoni siti nella campagna Sarda. Questi spazi in disuso da 10 anni, erano prima utilizzati come allevamento avicolo e sono parte dell'azienda di Mario Deplano, padre di Giorgio. Nel tempo il team è cambiato e ora a seguire Campidarte ci sono Paolo Carcangiu, Gianluca Zaccariotto, Rita Deplano, Stefano Melis e Giorgio Deplano.

Il progetto nella sua più ampia evoluzione comprende un'area eventi e agriturismo, una zona dedicata al progetto di residenze d'artista, e un laboratorio per la produzione di prodotti per la casa e allestimenti. Tutto questo in stretto contatto con la natura e dando modo alle diverse attività di mescolarsi tra loro. Campidarte è un progetto in corso, ambizioso, che mira a creare collaborazioni e scambi con le realtà artistiche più vitali dell'isola, e non solo. Inoltre vuole diventare nel tempo un vero punto di riferimento per la musica, il cibo e l'arte, portando in Sardegna un luogo di respiro più ampio collegato ai classici ambienti della piccola isola.

Argomenti del progetto.

Campidarte vuole unire cinque diversi aspetti: natura, arte, design, eventi e cibo.

Natura, perché si trova in 16 ettari nel pieno della campagna Sarda.

Arte perché Campidarte si caratterizza per il progetto "Artists in residence". Gli artisti vengono qui in due modi: breve o lungo periodo. Nel breve periodo di solito gli artisti lasciano delle opere sulle pareti dei capannoni. Nel lungo periodo, che può raggiungere due mesi, lavorano nel terreno creando installazioni permanenti, perché l'idea è quella di creare un parco culturale, creando così una passeggiata tra la natura e le installazioni artistiche.

Design. Campidarte vuole creare un nuovo concetto di design, che sia un mix tra il design urbano, riprendendone forme e colori, e quello artigianale o laboratoriale, in cui si sperimenta e realizzano prodotti. 

Eventi. Durante i primi tre anni abbiamo organizzato una serie di eventi che sono diventati parte importante del progetto, perché, grazie ad essi, i visitatori hanno iniziato a conoscere Campidarte e hanno avuto l'opportunità di vedere in prima persona una nuova modalità di esposizione dell'arte contemporanea, così come un nuovo approccio alla progettazione e al design. Inoltre gli eventi hanno permesso di finanziare la parte relativa agli artisti (l'acquisto di tinte e pennelli, biglietti aerei, l'ospitalità), e per i materiali del laboratorio.

Cibo e ospitalità. Apriremo presto anche come agriturismo, per dare una nuova offerta ai nostri clienti. Così da essere in grado di dare servizi e contenuti a persone di età e stili di vita diversi, e fare in modo che Campidarte venga visitato e viva tutto il nostro contesto, puntando su un aumento del confort e dell'atmosfera.

È per questo che chiediamo il vostro sostegno per rendere possibile questo progetto!!

A cosa servirà il Crowdfunding

Il crowdfunding è fondamentale per portare a termine la ristrutturazione del capannone e garantire così a Campidarte una serena programmazione e promozione delle attività. I lavori da effettuare ammontano ad un investimento di circa 287 mila euro, di cui, grazie alla stipula di due mutui siamo riusciti a garantircene circa 260 mila euro. Con il crowfunding puntiamo a coprirne almeno i 20 mila rimanenti.

Nello specifico i 20 mila euro chiesti andranno a coprire le spese per l'acquisto della cucina attrezzata che sarà il cuore del nascente agriturismo.

Ecco i regali pensati per voi!

Finanziare un progetto che ci piace può fare sicuramente piacere! ma se ci sono dei premi in scambio allora può essere anche divertente ed essere visto quasi come un regalo. In questi anni Campidarte ha sviluppato tutta una serie di prodotti per la casa che possono essere un perfetto scambio tra noi!

Le consegne dei prodotti in Sardegna saranno fatte a mano, quindi senza spese di spedizione ;)

_ _ _ _ _ _

1. L'unione fa la forza! 5€
Tati piccoli aiuti possono diventare un enorme sostegno. Grazie :)
_ _ _ _ _ _

2. Prendi un ricordo 20€
Per voi una maglietta col logo Campidarte. La stampa è in serigrafia e la maglietta viene da mercati ecofriendly!


_ _ _ _ _ _

3. EGGBAG 30€ è un pouf per la casa, pratico da spostare e da impilare. Ricavato dal riutilizzando delle cartelle per le uova. I colori sono personalizzabili!

_ _ _ _ _ _

4. ABATJOUR - EYE 40€ è uno dei nostri prodotti per la casa, si tratta di una abatjour la cui forma e il lungo cavo di alimentazione la rende quasi un piccolo faretto. Il corpo dell'apparecchio deriva dal riutilizzo di componenti industriali di un vecchio allevamento di pollame. Colori dei cavi e la corona in metallo possono essere personalizzati. Il cavo in tessuto è lungo 180 cm.

_ _ _ _ _ _

5. EVENTS MEMBER CARD 45€ Campidarte grazie al supporto di tutte le organizzazioni con cui abbiamo lavorato in questi anni mette a disposizione tre ingressi a qualsiasi evento che verrà svolto  qui nei nostri spazi. Una grande opportunità per vedere, scoprire, crescere.

_ _ _ _ _ _

6. CHICK HOUSE 50€ è il nome della linea di comodini e armadi fatti dal riutilizzo delle casette per le galline, queste sono in metallo zincato e nella forma completa sono divise in 8 nicchie disposte su due piani 4 e 4. Su queste noi effettuiamo dei tagli dai quali ricaviamo una o più nicchie. In questo caso il modulo ricavato è quello singolo, ideale come comodino o da appendere alla parete.

_ _ _ _ _ _

7. ORNELLA 90€ è un lampadario per la casa. Si basa sul riutilizzo di vecchi componenti industriali, originariamente erano mangiatoie per galline. Sono in metallo che dopo esser stato riportato al nuovo viene colorato, o per mantenere in evidenza i segni della ruggine viene solo protetto con un plastificante | Il prodotto vi arriverà con un cavo in stoffa di circa 90 cm e il rosone in metallo.

_ _ _ _ _ _ 

8. Una domenica in campagna 100€ Un grande chef, una degustazione vini locali e tre band dal vivo sarà lo sfondo di un pranzo domenicale nella campagna. Un evento speciale per coppie o gruppi per godersi il sole, la musica e il buon cibo.

Il buono è per due persone.

_ _ _ _ _ _

9. ELLE 120€  è un comodino per il letto, anche questo prodotto fa parte della linea chik house di componenti d'arredo. In questo caso il taglio sul modulo unitario della casetta genera un comodino pratico e spazioso, utilizzabile anche come piccola libreria.

_ _ _ _ _ _

10. HARIBO 150€ è una panca per esterni sviluppata e prodotta all'interno del laboratorio di Campidarte. I colori sono personalizzabili come le dimensioni. In questo caso la panca è larga 1 metro.

_ _ _ _ _ _

11. BINARY 500€  è un concetto nuovo mobili per la casa, costituito da una struttura reticolare metallica tale da creare le rotaie orizzontali sui quali possono poi essere eseguito piani e scatole, in legno. Sempre mutevole nella sua composizione è un guardaroba confortevole ed elegante.


_ _ _ _ _ _

12. PRIVATE PARTY CARD 800€ Con questa card potrai affittare Campidarte per una festa privata per un massimo di 100 persone! Sono inclusi caterin e dj.set. Rendi speciale un tuo momento!

_ _ _ _ _ _
#english version below
_ _ _ _ _ _

The Campidarte project

History .Campidarte is the name of the project, was born in May 2012, as a project between 3 interior designer, Giampiero Bernazzani, Alberto Brancaleon and Giorgio Deplano, who have begun to redevelop four sheds sites in the Sardinian countryside. These were first used as breeding poultry and the company of Mario Deplano, father of Giorgio. Over time the team has changed and there are now a new team that follow Campidarte, made by Paul Carcangiu, Gianluca Zaccariotto, Rita Deplano, Stefano Melis and Giorgio Deplano.

Topics of the project. Campidarte wants to combine five different aspects: nature, art, design, events and food.

Nature, because is located in 16 hectares of countryside in Sardinia.

Art because Campidarte is characterized by the project "artists in residence". The artists come here in two ways: short or long period. In the short term usually artists paint the walls. Over the longer term, which it can reach two months, they work in the outside creating installations, because the idea is to create a cultural path distributed within the area, which offers the opportunity to walk among nature and artist installations.

Campidarte wants to create a new concept of design, that is a mix between the urban design, to which we are commonly used and one more craft that we produce in the laboratory.

During the first four years we have organized a number of events that have become a very important part of the project because, thanks to them, people have started to know Campidarte and have had the opportunity to see first hand contemporary art, as well as a way new approach the design. Combined with Campidarte events it has the interest to support the artists, purchase the materials they need, and for the lab materials.

This is the reason why we have now decided to renew this shed, which is the event area, to open again also like a farmhouse to bi able to unite people of different ages and lifestyles, and make sure that Campidarte will be able to offer a great and more confortable atmosphere.

That's why we are asking your support to make this project possible!

What use the Crowdfunding

The crowdfunding is essential to complete the restructuring of the shed and thus ensure Campidarte to programming and promotion of activities. The works to be performed amounts to an investment of around 287 000 euro, of which, thanks to the signing of two loans we managed to garantircene approximately 260 000 euro. With crowfunding we aim to cover the last 20 000 euro..

Specifically, the 20 000 euro will be asked to cover the cost of purchasing the fully equipped kitchen that will be the heart of the nascent restaurant.

Here are the gifts meant for you!

Fund a project that we like can definitely be pleased! but if there are prizes in exchange then it can also be fun and be seen like a gift. In these years Campidarte has developed a whole series of products for the house which can be a perfect exchange between us!

For international or national shiping ask to: info@campidarte.com

_ _ _ _ _ _

1. Lunity is strenght! 5€ Many small aid can become a great support . Thanks for your help!
_ _ _ _ _ _

2. Bring a memory 20€ A shirt with the logo of Campidarte. It's a screen printed t-shirt and is bought by an eco fiendly market.


_ _ _ _ _ _

3. EGGBAG 30€ Pouf for home, convenient to move and stack. Powered by reusing egg folders. The colors are customizable. #ecofriendly #handmade #noconentionaldesign

_ _ _ _ _ _

4. ABATJOUR - EYE 40€ EYE is one of our products , household | it is a lamp shade , the form and deliberately make almost a spotlight along the power cable , is made from the reuse of industrial components of a poultry farm | Cable colors and can be customized | fabric cable of 180 cm in length

_ _ _ _ _ _

5. EVENTS MEMBER CARD Campidarte as explained in the video promotes music and art events in the territory. The Events Member Card allows to secure 3 inputs to all the events that will be organized . Partner : Here I Stay , Basstation , Night Sounds , Underground Area

_ _ _ _ _ _

6. CHICK HOUSE 50€ CHICK HOUSE is the name of the line of bedside tables and cabinets made ​​from the reuse of the hens houses. In this case the module is single, ideal as a bedside table in the version cut, or to hang on the wall in the original one.

_ _ _ _ _ _

7. ORNELLA 90€ This product is a chandelier for your home. Is based on the reuse of old industrial components, they were originally feeders hens. Are in metal that after having been reported to the new is colored , or to keep in evidence the signs of rust, is protected with a plasticizer. The product is sold with a fabric cord of about 90 cm and the metal rosette.

_ _ _ _ _ _

8. A sunday meal 100€ A great chef, a tasting local wines and three live bands will be the backdrop to a Sunday in the Country. A special event for couples or groups to enjoy the sun, music and the good food. The perk is for two persons.

_ _ _ _ _ _ 

9. ELLE 120€ ELLE is a bedside table, also this product is part of the chik house line of furniture components. In this case the cut on the unitary form of the house creates a practical and spacious bedside, also used as a small library .

_ _ _ _ _ _

10. HARIBO 150€ HARIBO is an outdoor bench developed and produced within the Campidarte laboratory. The colors are customizable as the size . In this case the bench is large 1 meter 

_ _ _ _ _ _

11. BINARY 500€  Binary is a new mobile concept for the house, consists of a metal reticular structure such as to create as the horizontal rails on which can then be backed plans and boxes , made ​​of wood . Always changeable in its composition is a comfortable and stylish wardrobe.

_ _ _ _ _ _

12. PRIVATE PARTY CARD 800€ With this perk you'll have the opportunity to take the Campidarte space event for rent for a private party for up to 100 people. To expect there will be a great catering, cooked in the new kitchen of Campidarte, and a DJ set or group to accompany the party!
story_txt:
#english version below
_ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ 
Cosa è un crowdfunding? 


Il crowdfunding o finanziamento collettivo in italiano, è un processo collaborativo di un gruppo di persone che utilizza il proprio denaro in comune per sostenere gli sforzi di persone e organizzazioni. È una pratica di microfinanziamento dal basso che mobilita persone e risorse.
_ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ 


    Il progetto Campidarte 
La storia. 
Campidarte è il nome del progetto, è nato nel maggio 2012, come un progetto di tre 3 interior designer, Giampiero Bernazzani, Alberto Brancaleon e Giorgio Deplano, che hanno iniziato a riqualificare quattro capannoni siti nella campagna Sarda. Questi spazi in disuso da 10 anni, erano prima utilizzati come allevamento avicolo e sono parte dell'azienda di Mario Deplano, padre di Giorgio. Nel tempo il team è cambiato e ora a seguire Campidarte ci sono Paolo Carcangiu, Gianluca Zaccariotto, Rita Deplano, Stefano Melis e Giorgio Deplano.Il progetto nella sua più ampia evoluzione comprende un'area eventi e agriturismo, una zona dedicata al progetto di residenze d'artista, e un laboratorio per la produzione di prodotti per la casa e allestimenti. Tutto questo in stretto contatto con la natura e dando modo alle diverse attività di mescolarsi tra loro. Campidarte è un progetto in corso, ambizioso, che mira a creare collaborazioni e scambi con le realtà artistiche più vitali dell'isola, e non solo. Inoltre vuole diventare nel tempo un vero punto di riferimento per la musica, il cibo e l'arte, portando in Sardegna un luogo di respiro più ampio collegato ai classici ambienti della piccola isola.

Argomenti del progetto. 

Campidarte vuole unire cinque diversi aspetti: natura, arte, design, eventi e cibo. 
Natura, perché si trova in 16 ettari nel pieno della campagna Sarda. 
Arte perché Campidarte si caratterizza per il progetto "Artists in residence". Gli artisti vengono qui in due modi: breve o lungo periodo. Nel breve periodo di solito gli artisti lasciano delle opere sulle pareti dei capannoni. Nel lungo periodo, che può raggiungere due mesi, lavorano nel terreno creando installazioni permanenti, perché l'idea è quella di creare un parco culturale, creando così una passeggiata tra la natura e le installazioni artistiche. 
Design. Campidarte vuole creare un nuovo concetto di design, che sia un mix tra il design urbano, riprendendone forme e colori, e quello artigianale o laboratoriale, in cui si sperimenta e realizzano prodotti.  

Eventi. Durante i primi tre anni abbiamo organizzato una serie di eventi che sono diventati parte importante del progetto, perché, grazie ad essi, i visitatori hanno iniziato a conoscere Campidarte e hanno avuto l'opportunità di vedere in prima persona una nuova modalità di esposizione dell'arte contemporanea, così come un nuovo approccio alla progettazione e al design. Inoltre gli eventi hanno permesso di finanziare la parte relativa agli artisti (l'acquisto di tinte e pennelli, biglietti aerei, l'ospitalità), e per i materiali del laboratorio.
Cibo e ospitalità. Apriremo presto anche come agriturismo, per dare una nuova offerta ai nostri clienti. Così da essere in grado di dare servizi e contenuti a persone di età e stili di vita diversi, e fare in modo che Campidarte venga visitato e viva tutto il nostro contesto, puntando su un aumento del confort e dell'atmosfera. 
È per questo che chiediamo il vostro sostegno per rendere possibile questo progetto!!
A cosa servirà il Crowdfunding

Il crowdfunding è fondamentale per portare a termine la ristrutturazione del capannone e garantire così a Campidarte una serena programmazione e promozione delle attività. I lavori da effettuare ammontano ad un investimento di circa 287 mila euro, di cui, grazie alla stipula di due mutui siamo riusciti a garantircene circa 260 mila euro. Con il crowfunding puntiamo a coprirne almeno i 20 mila rimanenti.
Nello specifico i 20 mila euro chiesti andranno a coprire le spese per l'acquisto della cucina attrezzata che sarà il cuore del nascente agriturismo.
Ecco i regali pensati per voi!
 Finanziare un progetto che ci piace può fare sicuramente piacere! ma se ci sono dei premi in scambio allora può essere anche divertente ed essere visto quasi come un regalo. In questi anni Campidarte ha sviluppato tutta una serie di prodotti per la casa che possono essere un perfetto scambio tra noi!
Le consegne dei prodotti in Sardegna saranno fatte a mano, quindi senza spese di spedizione ;)
_ _ _ _ _ _
1. L'unione fa la forza! 5€Tati piccoli aiuti possono diventare un enorme sostegno. Grazie :)_ _ _ _ _ _ 2. Prendi un ricordo 20€ Per voi una maglietta col logo Campidarte. La stampa è in serigrafia e la maglietta viene da mercati ecofriendly!
_ _ _ _ _ _ 3. EGGBAG 30€ è un pouf per la casa, pratico da spostare e da impilare. Ricavato dal riutilizzando delle cartelle per le uova. I colori sono personalizzabili! 
_ _ _ _ _ _
4. ABATJOUR - EYE 40€ è uno dei nostri prodotti per la casa, si tratta di una abatjour la cui forma e il lungo cavo di alimentazione la rende quasi un piccolo faretto. Il corpo dell'apparecchio deriva dal riutilizzo di componenti industriali di un vecchio allevamento di pollame. Colori dei cavi e la corona in metallo possono essere personalizzati. Il cavo in tessuto è lungo 180 cm.


_ _ _ _ _ _

5. EVENTS MEMBER CARD 45€ Campidarte grazie al supporto di tutte le organizzazioni con cui abbiamo lavorato in questi anni mette a disposizione tre ingressi a qualsiasi evento che verrà svolto  qui nei nostri spazi. Una grande opportunità per vedere, scoprire, crescere.

_ _ _ _ _ _ 
6. CHICK HOUSE 50€ è il nome della linea di comodini e armadi fatti dal riutilizzo delle casette per le galline, queste sono in metallo zincato e nella forma completa sono divise in 8 nicchie disposte su due piani 4 e 4. Su queste noi effettuiamo dei tagli dai quali ricaviamo una o più nicchie. In questo caso il modulo ricavato è quello singolo, ideale come comodino o da appendere alla parete.



_ _ _ _ _ _ 
7. ORNELLA 90€ è un lampadario per la casa. Si basa 
sul riutilizzo di vecchi componenti industriali, originariamente erano 
mangiatoie per galline. Sono in metallo che dopo esser stato riportato 
al nuovo viene colorato, o per mantenere in evidenza i segni della 
ruggine viene solo protetto con un plastificante | Il prodotto vi 
arriverà con un cavo in stoffa di circa 90 cm e il rosone in metallo. 
_ _ _ _ _ _ 
8. Una domenica in campagna 100€ Un grande chef, una degustazione vini locali e tre band dal vivo sarà lo sfondo di un pranzo domenicale nella campagna. Un evento speciale per coppie o gruppi per godersi il sole, la musica e il buon cibo. 
Il buono è per due persone. 


_ _ _ _ _ _ 

9. ELLE 120€  è un comodino per il letto, anche questo 
prodotto fa parte della linea chik house di componenti d'arredo. In 
questo caso il taglio sul modulo unitario della casetta genera un 
comodino pratico e spazioso, utilizzabile anche come piccola libreria. 

_ _ _ _ _ _ 
10. HARIBO 150€ è una panca per esterni sviluppata e prodotta 
all'interno del laboratorio di Campidarte. I colori sono 
personalizzabili come le dimensioni. In questo caso la panca è larga 1 
metro.


_ _ _ _ _ _ 
11. BINARY 500€  è un concetto nuovo mobili per la casa, 
costituito da una struttura reticolare metallica tale da creare le 
rotaie orizzontali sui quali possono poi essere eseguito piani e scatole, in legno. Sempre mutevole nella sua composizione è un guardaroba 
confortevole ed elegante.
_ _ _ _ _ _ 
12. PRIVATE PARTY CARD 800€ Con questa card potrai affittare Campidarte per una festa privata per un massimo di 100 persone! Sono inclusi caterin e dj.set. Rendi speciale un tuo momento!

story:
Edible Routes was founded by Kapil Mandawewala. After returning from a consulting job in the USA, Kapil began organic farming on his family farm in 2007. This work made him realize how deeply urban Indians are disconnected from their food. As a result he moved to India’s capital city New Delhi and
founded Edible Routes, an organization that conducts kitchen gardening workshops for adults and school children. We also set up kitchen gardens to help people grow their own vegetables and reconnect with nature.

Now we are at a crucial turning point: we want to create a model farm and permaculture learning center in New Delhi. This space will enable us to conduct more workshops, longer farming courses and provide Delhiites a space to work the land. This space will also enable us to experiment and develop better methods of growing food in confined urban spaces like balconies, rooftops, backyards and parks. And lastly, and most importantly, we want this farm to become a place where kids re-learn to love and live with nature, so they avoid repeating the mistakes of the last few generations. We need your help to develop this land into a full-fledged learning center. For this we need your help. We have taken a farm on lease, but a lot needs to be done in terms of setting up the place.

We are attempting to collect 12,500 USD – and with this money, we will create a seminar room and build volunteer quarters. And the rooftop will become a fully edible garden, of course! We will make vermicomposting pits, compost toilets, rainwater and wastewater harvesting systems, and we'll install drip irrigation systems. We will set up a nursery to multiply organic seeds and share local varieties of vegetables. We will keep bees to pollinate our plants, and build up the land's soil health and biodiversity. We will buy solar cookers and torches and install a few solar panels; and lastly, we will invest whatever funding we will receive over and above the base amount in solar panels to produce electricity.

You find our budget below.

Become our partner and sponsor us on this extraordinary journey – and we will help you become an urban farmer in return! All our perks will spread knowledge about organic kitchen gardening, and will ensure you are a step closer to that basket of fresh salad, spinach or zucchini that you'll savour like nothing before.

Become our partner on this journey – and help Delhi becoming greener, healthier, cooler, and less congested. Every vegetable grown organically at people's door-steps brings shade and oxygen to the most polluted city in the world that reels under 49 degrees Celsius in summer. homegrown food also helps reduce the truckloads of food driven into the city each day to feed the metropolis. Every harvested vegetable brings Delhiites a nutritious meal without pesticides, and creates respect for farmers' hard work.

Become our partner on this journey – and make sure you come visit us at the farm some day. If you cannot currently contribute financially, please do send the link of our campaign to your network via the Indigogo tool. Help us spread the word about Delhi's first permaculture hub and learning centre. And if you want to volunteer with us, drop us a line!

TEAM:
Kapil Mandawewala
Founder of Edible Routes. A consultant at Deloitte in the USA, he returned to India to farm in 2008 and founded ER two years later.
Karan Chopra
Karan worked for different NGOs on literacy and agriculture before joining Edible Routes in 2014.
Nabanita Sharma
Nabanita grew up on a farm. Working as a webdesigner she decided to come back to her roots, joining us in 2015.
Fazal Rashid
Fazal worked as an editor before turning to urban gardening with Edible Routes in 2015.
Anna Zimmer
Anna worked as a researcher in urban geography until 2016, when she decided to join Edible Routes to work on solutions for urban sustainability.
Shipra Uppal
Shipra is our accountant, admin and HR all rolled into one and much more!


Budget (in USD):
Learning centre - 6500
- seminar room
- compost toilets
- solar panels

Model farm and roof top - 5000
- nursery
- rooftop garden
- vermicomposting pits
- beekeeping equipment
- drip irrigation
- landscaping for rainwater harvesting

Volunteer rooms - 1000

TOTAL: 12,500

story:
Short Summary

San Diego needs a craft hard cider brewery!  Help Serpentine Cider become the first in what will hopefully be a long line of craft cideries.  We are trying to raise $15,000 to help us open a hard cider brewery, tasting room, and kitchen.  We have a 3,500sf warehouse in Miramar close to 2Kids Brewing Company, Thunderhawk Alements, and Setting Sun Sake Brewing Company on Miralani Drive and would like to be open by the end of 2016.

Serpentine Cider is made up of Sean, Kelly, Lish and Matthew.  We are three conservation biologists (focusing on desert reptiles, hence the name 'Serpentine" Cider) and a Navy helicopter pilot. 

We focus on breaking the rules of traditional hard cider making.  Sweet, syrupy, highly carbonated alcoholic sugar water has no place here at Serpentine Cider!  Taking from the amazing craft beer culture of San Diego, we also break tradition by using beer yeast in order to obtain our complex flavors. 

Do you think you aren't a cider lover?  Think again!  We have heard from many people that they don't like sweet drinks.  Serpentine Cider has a wide variety of ciders from semi-sweet to dry to some that will rival the sourest of the sour beers.  We will even have a wonderful hopped cider that will make the biggest IPA lover come running.  And yes, all of our ciders are naturally gluten free!

Remember, judging San Diego craft cider based on the apple-flavored alcoholic sugar water on the grocery store shelf is like judging San Diego craft beer based on Budweiser. Taste the real thing for yourself. 

 

What We Need & What You Get

Our goal for this campaign is $15,000 and we need your help in order to obtain that goal.  Our tasting room is an empty shell at the moment.  We are trying to raise money for three large fermenters, aging barrels and tanks, a patio, a bar and even a small kitchen.  Cider is the fastest growing craft beverage in the country.  We are here to show San Diego why it is gaining in such popularity.

 

Risks & Challenges

It is always risky to open a business, but the risk is compounded when that business has not yet been done in your city.  San Diegans have always had a love for craft beverages.  Hard cider is the next branch on San Diego's craft beverage evolutionary tree. 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

We understand that not all of you can monetarily contribute.  That does not mean you can't help!  You can help by spreading the word to your friends and family by sharing a link to this page.  The power of numbers is the only way we can break the hold the sugary syrupy non-craft ciders have on this business.

story:
My Story

   Hello everyone! My name is Jessica Frank and i live in beautiful Kimberley,  British Columbia, Canada

   When i was 26 years of age I attended college and became a ticketed Welder. After years of going from job to job, moving my daughter around with me, i decided i needed to figure out a way to utilize my skills and stay close to home. Kimberley b.c. is a small town with a population of 6,000, and there aren't many jobs here. 

   A few years ago, while working in a fabrication shop, I welded my daughter a piggy bank that she can't get into. A couple of my friends saw the piggy bank and asked if i could make some for their children. I of course said yes and My Savings Vault was born. 

   Opening your vault is not like opening your average piggy bank, but still fairly easy. On the back of your vault you will find a dotted line around a bottom corner indicating where to cut. My savings vaults are made out of very thin material making it easy for an adult to open, and not a child. 

   I'm hoping that with your help I am able to purchase the equipment i need to weld, paint, and engrave in my own shop. I have adequate space and the right knowledge, just need the right tools.

   I am fully confident that if i had the right tools i could build anything. I have experience welding and fabricating and have an excellent eye for detail. I strive for perfection and love building things by hand. There are always going to be risks and challenges starting any new venture, and i know I am strong and talented enough to overcome whatever obstacles come my way.

   For all those backers that ordered a vault please send details to mysavingsvault@gmail.com and I will get back to you soon as possible.

   Thanks so much for your support!

story:
Who Are We and Why Do We Need Your Help?

I'm James Suh, owner of CAR CARE AUTO SPA, a hand car wash and detail center in Portage Park, since 2013.

I've always dreamed of owning a small business, and this has been my first venture in addition to my full time job.  At any given time, CAR CARE AUTO SPA employs a team of between 7 - 10 people. 

CAR CARE AUTO SPA was originally owned by the building's current Landlord location who sold the business to a person -- Let's call him Bob.  Due to ever rising, sky-high rent and unethical, illegal tactics (unbeknownst to us at the time), Bob sold the business to us.  

Well, we experienced more of the same, and we'd had enough!!!   We've bought the building across the street and are in the process of renovating and relocating.

Now, the Landlord and Bob have opened up another car wash at the old location, in violation of the business sales agreement, which has a non compete clause.

Landlord, Bob, and their cousins and friends are doing everything they can to stop us from opening our doors.  They call the City inspectors and police on a daily basis, sometimes impersonating other local businesses, wasting the City's resources on frivolous calls that still have to be investigated by law. 

They've gone onto neighborhood Internet forums pretending to be "concerned residents".

They've complained to the Alderman, and then when they didn't get what they wanted, they went so far as to call WGN news, alleging the Alderman is corrupt!

What We Need

CAR CARE AUTO SPA needs funds badly!  We are asking for $50K or more, while to date we will be spending somewhere north of $500K for the building purchase and construction cost.

During construction, we are currently still doing details for the local dealerships for two reasons: 1) We want to maintain these valuable relationships and 2) I am trying to preserve the livelihood of my employees!

Since we are unable to do car washes during the build out, my employees  have dramtically reduced hours, and they do not have any tipping customers.  Under these circumstances, the weekly pay is not enough to provide a living wage, and so I am supplementing their pay out of my own pocket.  Thankfully, I have another source of income and some savings in order to be able to do that!!!

We are one team, loyal to each other.  As long as my guys are willing to stick with me, I will provide a livable wage for them, even if we are running in the red.  Your contribution will go towards that.

In general, the car wash industry is rife with inequities:

http://progressillinois.com/quick-hits/content/2012/09/24/study-shows-deplorable-conditions-wage-theft-chicago-car-wash-industry

While CAR CARE AUTO SPA is nowhere close to the bleak conditions described in the article, I would like to run a gold standard business for others to emulate, and for customers to proudly support.  As is, my team knows they come first before profits -- I am uniquely able to take that position since I am fortunate enough not to depend solely on this business myself.

Near long term (i.e. 5 years), I would like to eliminate the largest overhead, which is the debt from building purchase and renovation.  This means more latitude for higher pay, more employees, reasonable hours etc. without needing to raise prices and pass that cost onto the customer.

Your contribution would go towards reduction of that overhead and accelerating the timeline.

Finally, as mentioned, the shady people across the street are in breach of contract.  Lowest of the priorities is taking legal action against them, with the end goal of achieving a financial award to go back towards the other priorities.  And getting justice!  =)

If there is enough funding, we will put that towards attorney fees.

What You Get

We're not all take and no give!!!  By helping CAR CARE AUTO SPA, you can get significant discounts or even free services.

  • A $50 contribution will get 4 free washes*  - (a 30% savings)
  • A $100 contribution will get 10 free washes or one free detail**
  • A $500 contribution will get 50 free washes or five free details and lifetime discount card***
  • A $1,000 contribution will get free washes for a year for one vehicle  and lifetime discount card
  • A $5,000 contribution will get free washes AND details for two years for two vehicles  and lifetime discount card
  • A $10,000 contribution will get free washes AND details for life!

* Free wash includes in and out wash and tire dressing

** Free detail consists of exterior buff/wax, interior shampoo/condition, engine steam cleaning

*** Lifetime discount card will entitle the holder for $3 off any wash, any time, and $20 off detail services.

The Impact

Your contributions will change my life personally, change the lives and livelihood of our team, and create a model for the rest of the car wash industry to aspire to. 

The business will be unique in both the service it provides to the community as one of the top tier car washes in the City, and hopefully this serves as a first step towards transforming the car wash industry as whole by providing fair and equitable opportunities for all of its workers.

And finally, this business will stand for karma and justice, an example against those who seek to do harm to others, and a demonstration that integrity, ethics and kindness are stronger and more valuable than greed.

Risks & Challenges

Well, there is not a lot of risk here.  We own the building and construction is past the 50% mark.

The challenge is just the time it's going to take to get the business in a place financially to realize the big dreams.

I've been doing this for 3 years, staying in the black despite astronomical rent prices with a facility that left much to be desired.  With a mortgage that is 1/3 of the former rent, and a newly built, better designed, larger facility, in virtually the same locale, we're not anticipating big problems.

The sky could always fall and we could go out of business somehow, but the expectation is to be here sucessfully for a long time to come.

Other Ways You Can Help

Please, whether you choose to contribute or not, share and spread the word!  The more people who know about our situation and hardships, the better!

And don't forget to use Indiegogo share tools!

I am happy to answer any questions.

Thank you for reading and contributing!!

-James

story:
Summary

Thank you for your interest in furthering sustainable rural responsible travel!

Our tourism development project aims at promoting the purest, truest and deepest way of connecting with people in rural Uganda.

We get visitors to look into the day-to-day life of Uganda with rural tourism, which focuses on the preservation of local culture while encouraging environmental and community sustainability.

Give back to the people and places that make your trip unforgettable as you learn about local traditions and cultures. Enjoy the most authentic Ugandan experience possible – sit down for a typical family dinner, stretch your local language skills, or help collect farm-fresh eggs for your breakfast.

A comprehensive online platform will be put in place, offering a one stop shop booking process for the rural experiences and showcasing the local artisans crafts. Also users can enjoy and suggest new responsible tourism and lifestyle entries, review existing suggestions based on their sustainability attributes, read and comment on our responsible travel posts. Furthermore, We would like to enact concrete on-the-ground awareness and support for sustainable local ventures through sustainability-themed village tours.

If we can support many Eco-conscious and Social-conscious rural ventures, we can push many businesses to improve their social and environmental performance causing the change required to achieve some of the sustainable development goals.

What We Need & What You Get

  • We are asking for a total of 25,000 USD to help us further improve the Authentic Rural Experiences for everyone involved.
  • Your donations will help us reach more people in the world by paying for translation services, improving the website and associated mobile application, launching on ground  awareness campaigns about the platform, creating information centers at the sub-county level, training local youth groups and women cooperatives.
  • As a small token of our appreciation, the team at Authentic Ugandan Experience is offering personalized  perks to its donors.

We shall also use the donations to launch the 1st sustainable rural tourism magazine in Uganda called the "AUTHENTIC UGANDAN EXPERIENCE."

IMPACT

The rural visits will bolster the local economy and directly benefit the communities visited. Rural tourism will help protect private reserves and develop environmental education programs aimed at educating visitors about culture and nature. It will help the youth collectively by pioneering the local guides services and local resource centers while also promoting the women’s crafts cooperatives.

This shall also curb on the host of environmental and social issues caused by tourism:

Carbon emissions (5% of global emissions; 17 kg of carbon emitted per room day for hotel stays), Wildlife destruction (80% decrease in free-roaming African lions over a decade; at least 1,000 rhinos killed by poachers annually),  Increased waste (3.5 kg of waste generated daily per cruise ship passenger compared to 0.8 kg normally),Water overuse (tourists consume double the amount of water when on vacation), Social disruption (child sex tourism; loss of culture and heritage)

Support us!  80% of the youth population in Uganda is unemployed. Authentic Ugandan Experience(AUE) wants to change this.

Will you help us?

Other Ways You Can Help

Help us spread the word about our Indiegogo crowdfunding Campaign! Please share the link to your friends and network on all social media platforms.

By supporting Authentic Ugandan Experience, you will help to create a community of  people who seek to save the earth, one experience at a time.

Thank you!

Contact us: authenticugxperience@gmail.com     https://web.facebook.com/authenticugandanexperi...       https://www.instagram.com/authenticugandanexper...

story:
Salmon Coast is an independent research station located in the beautiful Broughton Archipelago of the southern Great Bear Rainforest in traditional Kwikwasut’inuxw Haxwa’mis territory.

This is a place where scientists, artists, and activists come together to contribute to ground-breaking scientific research, conservation efforts, public education and community connections. To date, research hosted here has been published in over 50 peer-reviewed articles, received widespread media coverage, and contributed to improved public policy and industry practices. 

We’re the scrappy science station that could, and we need your help.

This April, on the eve of the field season, the motor on our station research boat Big Yin, broke. With important, multi-year projects scheduled and a crew of committed conservation scientists raring to go, we had no choice but to immediately replace the motor.

The good news is that the new motor is reliable and efficient. That’s important when your boat is your only link to hospitals, groceries, and home.

The bad news is that it left us $16,000 in the red. That’s devastating for a small organization like us.

We've already raised $850 through the support of our wonderful friends and neighbours the Rose family and Doug Aberley. Now, we're looking to the wider community for support. 

We need to raise $15,150 so we can continue the groundbreaking independent research needed to protect BC's wild salmon and support the Broughton. 

What makes Salmon Coast special has always been its incredibly generous and committed community. Indeed, this place would not exist without people like you.

The new motor is already making a big difference. Because of it, we've moved forward with some exciting projects, including:

  • Partnering with local First Nations on some inspiring collaborations, including environmental monitoring and supporting traditional management practices;
  • Continuing the long term study on the survival of juvenile sockeye salmon in partnership with the University of Toronto, Hakai Institute, and the Department of Fisheries & Oceans; and
  • Finding new ways to contribute to open data and citizen-led conservation. 

Salmon Coast is an amazing community effort. With your help, we can continue to carry out vital research and conservation education, all in service of the magical Broughton. 

Learn more about our impactful work on our website.

story:
Why Are We Seeking Your Financial Help?

We are seeking funding to establish an Urban Aquaponics Facility in a 6,000 square foot facility in a neighborhood called Three Points in the Historic Peacock Tract Community in Montgomery, Alabama. The Peacock Tract encompassed parts of Downtown Montgomery, Cottage Hill, the Rosa Parks neighborhood, and Three Points.

Due to the safety/image perception of the community, along with decades of lost roof tops within the first half-mile demographic circle, a traditional redevelopment and financing model was not feasible. To overcome this challenge, 5 Star Consortium began to take an out-of-the-box approach to spark community revitalization by bringing additional experience and expertise in project management, construction, mixed-use development, and Aquaponics by adding PLC Development and Consulting, Perez Architecture, and Con10u2farmL3C (A Social Impact Low Profit Company) to the project team. This team, together with representatives of the City’s Community Development Division, developed a concept called “The Circle of Life Initiative”.  This approach focuses on developing the Peacock Place Community one component at a time while simultaneously providing job training, employment, business creation, and promoting healthy lifestyles.

These funds will also advance a Community-based program called the “Circle of Life Initiative” which is a collaborative partnership effort consisting of local, state, and national organizations and agencies. It seeks to support local efforts to help low to moderate income communities become vibrant, healthy, and self-sustaining through education and economic empowerment.


Location of the Peacock Tract Community in Montgomery, Alabama

The Historic Peacock Tract Community is located approximately ½ Mile southwest from the core of downtown Montgomery, Alabama and the Alabama River, 1 mile from the Capitol Complex, and 2 Miles from Maxwell Air Force Base. The community is bound by Interstate 85 to the South, and Interstate 65 to the West.



The Historic Significance of the Peacock Tract Community

1. Transportation Technology Advancement

The Capitol City Street Railway, also known as the Lightning Route, which had established routes in April 1866 in the Peacock Tract Community, was the first city-wide system of electric streetcars in Montgomery and the first in the United States.

2. A Community with Strong Institutions

Religion and education played a significant role in the social development of the Peacock Tract Community. Mount Zion AME Church was where Dr. Martin Luther King, Jr. was elected by the Montgomery Improvement Association as leader of the Montgomery Bus Boycott Movement in 1955. Holt Street Baptist Church played host to many of the mass public meetings for the Montgomery Bus Boycott Movement.  Loveless School was the academic center of the Peacock Tract Community serving as the foundation for success for many of its graduates.  As of 2014, Loveless Academic Magnet Program ranked as the top public magnet high school in the United States.

 3. Two Major U.S. Social Movements
Led by Dr. Martin Luther King, Jr., the Peacock Tract Community played host to two of our nation’s greatest social and human rights movements.


The 1955 Montgomery Bus Boycott Movement

The fight to end segregated public transportation

The 1965 Selma to Montgomery National Voting Rights March led to the passage of the 1965 Voting Rights Act, a landmark achievement of the 1960sAmerican Civil Rights Movement.

4. Community with a Strong Economic Base

From the 1950s to the 1970s, the Peacock Tract Community had many types of businesses owned by various ethnic groups, including dry cleaners, funeral homes, grocery and furniture stores, drug stores, sweet shops, night clubs, radio stations, insurance companies, gas stations, barber shops and beauty parlors.


5. Famous African American Residents

Tuskegee Airman Lt. Sherman H. White Jr. was one the first black pilots killed in combat over North Africa in 1941 during WWII.


Born in Montgomery, Alabama, Percy Lavon Julian (April 11, 1899 – April 19, 1975) was a research chemist and a pioneer in the chemical synthesis of medicinal drugs from plants, earning more than 130 chemical patents.


Moses Ernest Tolliver was a disabled folk artist known as "Mose T," because of the unique signature on his paintings. After a severe injury at the Carlton McClendon Furniture Factory in the Peacock Tract Community in the late 1960s, he turned to painting to combat long hours of idle time.


6. Hollywood and the Historic Peacock Tract Community

Former Peacock Tract resident John Sawyer starred in the movie Shadrach about a former Alabama slave who, at the age of 99, walked 600 miles from his home to Virginia to find his family. His last request was to be buried in the soil of the farm where he was born into slavery. 


The Long Walk Home was filmed in part in a home in the heart of the Peacock Tract Community. The 1990 film starred Sissy Spacek and Whoopi Goldberg and was based on a screenplay about the Montgomery Bus Boycott Movement of 1955.


The Rosa Parks Story is a movie which tells the story of civil rights activist Rosa Parks (played by Angela Bassett) from her days as a private-school student to her public battle against racism and segregation.




What Is Aquaponics?

Aquaponics is a combination of aquaculture and hydroponics forming a synergistic system that conserves water, allows for cleaner harvests, and eliminates soil contamination while increasing plant nutrient intake and accelerating plant growth.


How Does Aquaponics Work?

In an aquaponics system, water enriched with nitrates from a fish ecosystem flows through troughs that have vegetables and plants placed in either vertical or horizontal floating raft systems.  The nutrients are absorbed through the roots of the plants. The water is then filtered and re-circulated into the fish tanks starting the process over.

Types of Fish and Vegetables to be grown and sold at the Aquaponics Center

Jobs to Be Created By the Aquaponics Center

This project will create at least 15 jobs in a 3-5 year period. Many of the jobs will be filled by residents of the Peacock Tract Community. Employees of the Aquaponics Center will earn living wages, not minimum wage rates.

Project Impact on the Peacock Tract Community

According to U.S. Census Bureau 2008-2012, the Peacock Tract Community has the following characteristics:

·  Unemployment rate for this tract is 36% compared to 6.4% for the rest of the City.

·  43% of the people living in this tract, age 18 to 24, have less than a high school diploma.

Additionally, many residents of the Peacock Tract Community lack affordable insurance and healthcare, healthy food, or a grocery store within a 1-mile radius. This has led to many health disparities and high rates of heart disease, obesity, and diabetes.

Your generous contribution to establish the Aquaponics Center at Peacock Place in the Historic Peacock Tract Community will have the following social impact:

The Location of the Aquaponics Center

The Aquaponics Center at Peacock Place will be built in the 6,000 square foot building shown below in the heart of the Peacock Tract Community.  This facility is located on the National Historic Selma to Montgomery Voter Rights Trail, and is less than 5 minutes from downtown Montgomery, Alabama.

The plan is to incorporate a vertical plant grow tower system rather than a horizontal plant grow system, thus taking advantage of the building’s tall ceilings and limited square footage.


Not only do we have ownership of the building, but we own adjacent lots next to the proposed project site, allowing us to develop an additional 30,000 square feet of space for future expansion.

Project Impact on the Community’s Environment

The Aquaponics Center at Peacock Place will strive to operate at a “Zero -Waste Level” which promotes re-use of all potential waste products. We will strive to operate the center as energy efficiently as possible.

Operating the Aquaponics Center at Peacock Place in this manner means that we are committed to the following:


Significance of the Aquaponics Center to the Community

With over 80 percent of the American population living in metropolitan centers, urban farming has the ability to dramatically enhance economic growth, increase food quality, and build healthier communities.

Urban farming allows individuals or groups to establish gardens or mini-farms meeting local needs using rooftops, abandoned buildings, and on deteriorating plots of land. We currently have over 15acres of land and 25,000square feet in existing building space.

In addition to creating jobs and instilling community pride, the Aquaponics Center at Peacock Place can be duplicated across America in hundreds of urban communities with blighted properties, vacant lots, and abandoned buildings.

Other 5 Star Consortium Projects  in the Peacock Tract Community

The Market at Peacock Place (currently under construction and located 2 blocks from the Aquaponics Center) is a 60,000 square foot open-air business incubator.  Operating on a former Victorian furniture site, the Market can host some 150 community-based businesses at low-cost rental. A local university business school will offer business planning and technical assistance.


Other Projects in the Peacock Tract Community

With the 50th anniversary of the National Historic Selma to Montgomery Voter Rights March Trail (March 2015), and the 60th anniversary of the Montgomery Bus Boycott (December 2015), the City of Montgomery has invested over a $1 million in infrastructure improvements to commemorate the events. The improvements include establishing a  Green Wall on the fences underneath Interstates 65 and 85 to mitigate the impact of the interstates on this community.  Additionally, streets were re-paved, trees planted, and sidewalks were restored throughout the community.


The City has invested approximately $1.5 million in the restoration of the Historic Mt. Zion A.M.E Zion Church which will become a museum and public meeting place.


Challenges Overcome

Numerous challenges were overcome in acquiring property for the Aquaponics Center, the Market Place and other future projects in this community. These include:

•  Environmental Review

•  Historical and Architectural Review

•  Archeological Study

•  Noise Study

•  Acquisition of 70 small parcels

•  Absentee ownership

•  Disputed property ownership

•  Inflated prices

Funds needed to build the Aquaponics Center

Our campaign goal is to raise $500,000 for the purpose of renovating this 6.000 square foot facility and purchasing equipment and supplies to establish an urban indoor vertical aquaponics grow center. The center will operate 24 hours a day, 365 days a year, producing organic vegetables and fresh fish for sale and distribution to local residents and various markets. Your contribution to this campaign will aid in the cause to eliminate the plight of a USDA-designated Food Desert Community and provide living-wage jobs to local residents while contributing to the revitalization of the Peacock Tract Community.

story:
I joined Indiegogo to raise funds to start up and become a Distributor for Royale products not only locally but as well as internationally.

What is Royale Business Club?

Royale Business Club International,Inc. is a Filipino owned corporation that was established in 2006 in Quezon City,Philippines.

Royale is engaged in Marketing of food supplements, powdered beverages, beauty, skin & personal care products. Royale is a local manufacturer of its own and a international distributor of globally award winning Royale Health & Beauty Products.

Why I need funding?

Im hoping that if I reach the goal amount I will be able to start up. Finish the website, and purchase sample products to start with.

Im very excited for this venture and as what I have known there is no one in my area doing business distribution of these products yet.

Later on if this becomes big, Id be able to lease a space to cater more products and clients and team distributors. Knowing this you could be part and become a major distributor in Canada for Royale products.

Below are the perks and incintives you can choose with your contribution and support. You will automatically become a distributor once you choose the Distributor perk and can choose 1 package from the choices below. 

Hope you'll take a moment to join in helping this campaign reach its funding goal.

Please Help me Get The Word Out!!! Whether it's $1 or $500, your donation is SUPER appreciated and will help me make this project successful - we thank you in advance for giving. But remember - a financial contribution isn't the only way to show support.

You can also TELL YOUR FRIENDS about this campaign. Share, post, email, update, and tweet along with me to as many people as you're willing to tag. You never know who in your network will fall in love and wanted to start a home-based business and become a boss of their own.

Indiegogo has some sweet tools for sharing and you can use these social media sites to connect with BECOME A ROYALE CANADA Distributor and spread the word. Thank you!

story:
Short Summary

We are a danish/moroccan family  living in Tiznit in SW Morocco. Our dream is to make an ecological selfsustainable place, where people can come on holiday, relax - clean their body and mind. The aim is to give an exceptionel experience in the countryside of Morocco.  We can arrange a whole holiday package, with food, excursions and  accommadation close to nature. We have allways been interested in green living, and we think, it is the way to go. Our goal is to make a place, where people can sleep in moroccon tents,  pick fresh vegetables in the garden, go on fishing trips, learn to cook moroccan food and enjoy the peace and beauty of the moroccan nature. Everybody is welcome.

 We started building our house with surrounding materials (earth, sand, chalk and stones), but still need to finish and rebuild some parts, that had been destroyed under the big floods in november 2014. 

Our plan is to build a fence around the ground, moroccan tents, compost toilets, outdoors showers, a simpel filtration system, hammam, solar powered panels, natural swimming pool and a big kitchen, where the guests can learn to make moroccan food.  


What We Need & What You Get

  • Here is an overview of what we need and how much it cost:
  • 2 moroccan tents (family tents with solid floor and interior): 2x1100$: 2200$
  • 2 Compost toilet: 2 x 450$: 900$
  • Kitchen house: 4000$
  • Filtration system:1000$
  • Solar power: 4000$
  • Hammam: 2000$
  • 2 outdoor shower: 2 x 450$: 900$
  • Wall around the ground : 3000$ 
  • Natural swimming pool: 3000$
  • Well: 4000$


We will also bee gratefull if you come here and help us in the building process.

When you  support our campaign, you help us to create a sustainable place, where you can come and spend an unforgettable holiday, and get close to moroccan culture and nature.

story:
-Be a part of our story


We believe that food has the power to bring more happiness to the world. We’re talking about food that is natural, organic, healthy and delicious. Food that is ethically sourced and environmentally friendly. Food that gives back. We introduce to you one of the most powerful super food on the planet, Roots Food Moringa! 

Picture: Demo of our product and design

ATTENTION: You don't need PAYPAL to make a contribution - please view the bottom of this page for how to use credit/debit card, if you have challenges! Click here for instructions

Our Moringa is not just good for you, it’s good for the people who make it and it’s good for our planet! Now that's a super food!


       



Moringa is a green leafy tree that grows in the backyard of every Filipino where the benefits of a diet rich in Moringa are well known. It is traditionally used as a herbal medicine and for healing purposes.

The leaves of the tree are packed with nutrients and can provide a healthy energy boost because the leaves contain more than 96 nutrients including vitamins A, B and C, calcium, potassium, protein and many antioxidants and amino acids. Now that's just astonishing!

Graph based on source: ”The Powerful Vitamin Factory” by Dr. MarcuNational Cancer Institute Centre for Bioinformatics/Kevric Co. 

The world is picking it up. Help us get started and get it to you! 
"Moringa Sales of this powder have soared in the past year. Lily Cole and Livia Firth are fans, partly because it contains skin-boosting vitamins such as A, C, E, riboflavin, niacin and zinc. Derived from the string-bean like pods of the moringa tree, it’s known as the “miracle tree” in its native Philippines, where women traditionally take it daily from the age of 12 upwards" - The Times, Feb.28th 2015

READ MORE: http://www.thetimes.co.uk/tto/health/article4366546.ece

When the leaves are dried they can be processed into powder or flakes, which increases the concentration of nutrients and makes it easy to store so you always have a healthy boost to your meal at hand. Its delicious leafy green flavour is subtle enough to work with practically any dish or beverage.

 Picture: Breakfast table, muffin, yoghurt and a moringa kiwi smoothie. Find more recipes on www.rootsfood.dk

Choose a perk on the right side and try our Roots Food MORINGA in your kitchen, from breakfast, lunch to a gourmet dinner!

Picture: Cod with Moringa powder. Find more recipes on www.rootsfood.dk

When you eat Roots Food Moringa, you’re not only eating healthy, you’re also eating consciously because you’re contributing to sustainable livelihoods for Filipino Moringa farmers in typhoon affected areas. So when you boost your meal with Roots Food Moringa, you’re also boosting all that goodness into communities that need it the most!

In the Danish Magazine Iværksætteren (Entrepreneur) Read it (Danish)

Poverty and climate change are some of the biggest challenges in the Philippines, particularly for the vulnerable in rural areas. In November 2013 the super typhoon, Haiyan, hit the Philippines and affected 11 million people and destroyed 75% of the coconut trees in the Visayas region, depriving millions of their main source of livelihood. The coconut sector will take up to 10 years to restore, and that is simply too long a wait. We have started collaborations with 2 established local NGOs, Moringaling Foundation Inc. and Ecoweb, to introduce Moringa as a real, immediate, and sustainable alternative. Together we will work to educate farmers in the cultivation of moringa, provide drying facilities, ensure the quality of the product, and assist in community development. With a successful launch, we expect during November 2015 to roll out projects for 9 communities and a total of 9,052 beneficiaries in the worst hit typhoon-affected areas.

The Moringa Tree is incredibly resilient and is well suited for the hot, tropical climate of the Philippines. The leaves are so nutritious that World Health Organization (WHO) has used it for decades to fight malnutrition. Its seeds can be pressed into oil for beauty products and the peel from the seeds can even be used for water purification. It’s no wonder that this remarkable tree often goes by the name “The Miracle Tree”.

For us, this is just the beginning. Fighting malnutrition, poverty and ensuring climate justice, are big challenges, but we truly believe that we can make the right choices that make a lasting, positive impact. 

Be a part of our vision.

The past year we have been working on building our business, testing the Moringa with chefs and at home, understanding all food safety requirements and building networks in The Philippines, Denmark and around Europe. In June 2014, we became the first winner of the 'Social Enterprise' category at the Venture Cup Denmark start-up competition, which has given us mentorship and a network. Moreover, in the fall of 2014, we were accepted at the incubator Copenhagen School of Entrepreneurship (CSE), providing us an office amongst a number of passionate entrepreneurs.

We are ready to go to market!

The Moringa leaves in the Philippines are a beautiful deep green and are packed with taste and potent nutrients. And that’s how we intend to keep it!  Bringing a new food product to the market is expensive, especially when you care for preserving its natural strength and ensuring it is responsible and safe along the way. 

A successful campaign guarantees the first production run of our beautifully crafted Roots Food Moringa ready for spring 2015. It also ensures that we kick-off our first livelihood projects for the typhoon affected communities. We are almost there! Claim yours early and support our ‘Eat Happy Be Happy’ mission. 

 

                                   

We’ve brought together our different backgrounds and common passion to start Roots Food as a social enterprise. Jackie is the power Social Entrepreneur of the team. Half-Filipina, born and raised in Denmark, she recently completed her Masters’ degree in Social Entrepreneurship from Copenhagen Business School and an internship with the Institute of Social Entrepreneurship in Asia in Manila. Daniel is a true global nomad, an experienced businessman with over 10 years in the financial services and with 4 years of business experience in the Philippines. Lisa, also half-Filipina and half-Danish, has several years of experience in the NGO sector in developing countries.


We decided to create a business that is a driving force for innovation, working with the principles of fair trade and sustainability.  Our goal is to run a business that empowers people – that strengthens communities in vulnerable parts of the Philippines and gives consumers in the West the choice of a healthy product that gives back.

Ultimately, we want to spread more happiness in this world. We call this our ‘Eat Happy, Be Happy!’ philosophy.


                    

We want to offer the very best of all super foods for you to add on all kinds of food and drinks! We present Moringa in flakes and powder – perfect for pasta, stews, smoothies and even as a tea! The culinary and nutritional possibilities are endless!

However, to make this happen and to provide you with this simple and awesome solution, we need YOUR support.

Help us make it easy for you to be healthy and make and impact! To your right you can check out our range of options and offers, including our pre-order Roots Food Moringa Flakes and Powder and fabulous perks from collaborating artists. Scroll down to see our fun and unique offers from our artists.  


We have the pleasure of introducing to you to talented artists that support Roots Food!   

Music and chocolate – could you think of a more uplifting combination? Add a sprinkle of Roots Food Moringa and you have a whole lot of goodness going on! Get the Love is Love Moringa Chocolate bar by Musical Chocolate, a social enterprise that supports musicians. This delicious treat has been named after the original song "Love is Love" by Danish-Filipino, ultra talented Eurovision sensation, Andy Roda. This set comes with a downloadable version of one of Andy's songs.

        


An outfit isn’t complete without the perfect accessory! And, in our opinion, the most striking accessories also have a story to tell. Why not treat yourself, or a loved one, to a pretty pair of Moringa Leaf earrings from jewelry designer Trine Wagner. The earrings are handmade with a sterling silver-plated lock and the best part about them is that when you’re asked where you got them you’ll have a great story to tell!                                    

                                  

                         

Here’s an instant facelift for your wall!  The carabao (or water buffalo) is a highly recognizable domestic animal found all over the Philippine countryside. It is an icon of Philippine nature and a natural starting point for Patrick Chan’s new series of posters. His Carabao design reflects Patrick’s Filipino cultural heritage and background combined with his European design aesthetics.

                            

Want some daily inspiration from two seriously cool women? Then this photograph is for you! Fang-Od is the last remaining Kalinga tribe tattoo artist and was 92 when this photograph was taken! And from what we’ve heard, she’s still going strong! The photographer who shot this is one of the Philippine’s most talented young photographers, Hannah Reyes, who is just 24 and represented by National Geographic Creative.

                           

Andy Roda is a multitalented Filipino-Danish singer, songwriter, producer, and co-founding member of the P-NOiSE Festival. Andy is an internationally recognized artist who has toured and released music in both Europe, USA and the Philippines. 

Musical Chocolate is a profit-with-purpose company, that makes delicious high quality hand-made chocolate while giving a portion of the proceeds to build sustainable living for artist-musicians. 

Trine Wagner is a Danish illustrator and designer, whose inspiration can be found both in nature and in the diversity of cultures around the world. Her designs are hand-drawn and hand-made, making each piece unique.

Patrick Chan is a multi-disciplinary artist working across many fields of creativity, from corporate branding to directing music videos and creating murals and wall art. A proud half-Filipino and half-Dane, Patrick incorporates his international background into all his work. 

Hannah Reyes is a documentary and travel photographer who grew up in the Philippines and is currently based in Phnom Penh. Through photography she has found herself in the unlikeliest of places - following a sex worker in Manila, photographing children of the Cambodian circus, caught in the crossfire of shanty demolitions.

We appreciate your donation more than you could ever imagine. If you can't contribute, don't worry, we understand and we still love you.

But feel free to share spread the word!

Use the Indiegogo share tools to post on all forms of your social media! Tell everyone you know.

From the bottom of our hearts, thank you!

                                               
                                               www.rootsfood.dk

                          


You don't need to have Paypal in order to contribute!!

Choose your perk or "Contribute Now" for no perk:

Here is a 3 step description for how to contribute through our crowdfunding campaign with credit/debit card and avoid opening a paypal account

1. Press "GO TO PAYPAL" then under the login it says ->
2. "CHOOSE A WAY TO PAY" and at the bottom is: "PAY WITH CREDIT CARD OR DEBIT CARD" 
3. Untick "SAVE THE DETAILS TO PAYPAL" if you DON'T wish to create an Papypal account!

If you still have challenges with contributing through this, feel free to contact us on Facebook/rootsfood, email: jh@rootsfood.dk tel. 0045 28282212

THANKS to all the backers who have supported us and our mission so far <3

-Be a part of our story


We believe that food has the power to bring more happiness to the world. We’re talking about food that is natural, organic, healthy and delicious. Food that is ethically sourced and environmentally friendly. Food that gives back. We introduce to you one of the most powerful super food on the planet, Roots Food Moringa! 
Picture: Demo of our product and design

ATTENTION: You don't need PAYPAL to make a contribution - please view the bottom of this page for how to use credit/debit card, if you have challenges! Click here for instructions
Our Moringa is not just good for you, it’s good for the people who make it and it’s good for our planet! Now that's a super food!


       






Moringa is a green leafy tree that
grows in the backyard of every Filipino where the benefits of a diet rich in
Moringa are well known. It is traditionally used as a herbal medicine and for healing purposes.
The leaves of the tree are packed with nutrients and can provide a healthy energy boost because the leaves contain more than 96 nutrients including vitamins A, B and C, calcium, potassium, protein and many antioxidants and amino acids. Now that's just astonishing!




Graph based on source: ”The Powerful
Vitamin Factory” by Dr. MarcuNational Cancer Institute Centre for Bioinformatics/Kevric Co. 
The world is picking it up. Help us get started and get it to you! "Moringa Sales of this powder have soared in the past year. Lily Cole and Livia Firth are fans, partly because it contains skin-boosting vitamins such as A, C, E, riboflavin, niacin and zinc. Derived from the string-bean like pods of the moringa tree, it’s known as the “miracle tree” in its native Philippines, where women traditionally take it daily from the age of 12 upwards" - The Times, Feb.28th 2015
READ MORE: http://www.thetimes.co.uk/tto/health/article4366546.ece


When the leaves
are dried they can be processed into powder or flakes, which increases the
concentration of nutrients and makes it easy to store so you always have a healthy
boost to your meal at hand. Its delicious leafy green flavour is subtle enough to
work with practically any dish or beverage.

 Picture: Breakfast table, muffin, yoghurt and a moringa kiwi smoothie. Find more recipes on www.rootsfood.dk


Choose a perk on the right side and try our Roots Food MORINGA in your kitchen, from breakfast, lunch to a gourmet dinner!

Picture: Cod with Moringa powder. Find more recipes on www.rootsfood.dk When you eat Roots Food Moringa,
you’re not only eating healthy, you’re also eating consciously because you’re
contributing to sustainable livelihoods for Filipino Moringa farmers in typhoon affected areas. So when you boost your meal with Roots Food Moringa, you’re also
boosting all that goodness into communities that need it the most!


In the Danish Magazine Iværksætteren (Entrepreneur) Read it (Danish)




Poverty and climate change are some
of the biggest challenges in the Philippines, particularly for the vulnerable
in rural areas. In November 2013 the super typhoon, Haiyan, hit the Philippines and affected
11 million people and destroyed 75% of the coconut trees in the Visayas region,
depriving millions of their main source of livelihood. The coconut sector
will take up to 10 years to restore, and that is simply too long a wait. We have started collaborations with 2 established local NGOs, Moringaling Foundation Inc. and Ecoweb, to introduce Moringa as a real, immediate, and sustainable alternative. Together we will work to educate farmers in the cultivation of moringa, provide drying facilities, ensure the quality of the product, and assist in community development. With a successful launch, we expect during November 2015 to roll out projects for 9 communities and a total of 9,052 beneficiaries in the worst hit typhoon-affected areas.

The Moringa Tree is incredibly
resilient and is well suited for the hot, tropical climate of the Philippines.
The leaves are so nutritious that World Health Organization (WHO) has used
it for decades to fight malnutrition. Its seeds can be pressed into
oil for beauty products and the peel from the seeds can even be used for water
purification. It’s no wonder that this remarkable tree often goes by the name

impact.

story:
//FOLLOW US l CONTACT US

Gmail: AllWomenNetCafe@gmail.com 

Twitter: @AllWomenNetCafe

Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/AllWomenNetCafe


//THE CAMPAIGN

In an international survey, 85% of women with Internet access stated that it provides “more freedom.” That is what we hope to achieve for women in our hometown of Gilgit, Pakistan by offering free Internet access at the All Women Net Cafe.  

//ABOUT US

We are a team of women, currently living and studying in the United States, working towards enhancing the daily lives of women in our hometown of Gilgit, Pakistan. We have experienced being cut off from Internet access in the area, and the frustration of being unable to fill out a college application, find out information for an assignment, or send an important email due to a lack of Internet access. We firmly believe that access to the Internet is an important right for women to have. 

//THE PROBLEM

In Pakistan, only about 1/10 of the population uses the Internet. Though this is a relatively high number with respect to other South Asian countries, there is a clear rift between access in urban versus rural areas – 17.4% of urban homes have access to internet as compared to a mere 1.3% of rural homes. This disparity is compounded further by socio-economic inequality and gender disparity that is clearly translated into the digital arena, leaving rural women the most isolated from internet access in the country. This unequal online representation is a reflection of the great gender disparity prominent in Pakistan, where social barriers restrict women from mobility in the public space, limiting opportunities for education, employment or general autonomy of movement.  


//OUR MISSION

Our mission is to provide the women of Gilgit with a safe and productive environment where they have free access to the Internet. We want to create a space where women are able to be productive and feel comfortable while utilizing the Internet for their education, career or networking. This Internet Cafe will not only motivate women and girls to learn technical skills, but also help them to apply it to their personal goals and endeavors. The All Women Net Cafe is a new concept in Gilgit, Pakistan, but it is important for this café to be exclusively for women as existing Internet cafes are typically dominated by men and are deemed unsafe or improper places for girls and women. At our net cafe, every woman will be welcome despite her class, age or familiarity with technology. The cafe will be entirely operated by women, contributing to the local economy and providing opportunities for employment and job experience for local women. 






//INTERNET IN THE 21ST CENTURY

The disparity of being disconnected from the Internet is most stark in the developing world, where only 32% of the population has access. The link between Internet access and individual and community development is most starkly proven by the fact that “the offline population is disproportionately rural, low income, illiterate, elderly and female”. Internet access is becoming crucial in a more connected world due to its unique ability to break down barriers of distance, and allow people to instantly exchange information and ideas that can transform their ways of life. In this way, it empowers individuals to be aware of, and exercise, their civil liberties and participate in the social, economic and political development of their countries, and the world at large.




//THE BUDGET

Our total budget is $10,000 for the startup costs of the Internet Cafe: 

($1 = 101.83 Pakistani Rupees)

** Absolutely 100% of the funds raised will go towards the Internet café itself. No funding will go towards our personal expenses associated with travel or stay in Pakistan. Any additional funds raised will go towards the development and expansion of the Cafe through the purchase of additional laptops, training and tutorials, building upgrades, etc. **


//TIMELINE

Summer 2015: A team representative will be going to Gilgit, Pakistan in order to finalize the budget, and locate a site for the net cafe. 

Winter 2015: The team will be going to Gilgit to furnish the cafe, get the computers and networks setup and working, and have all operations running! 

Summer Break 2016: The project will be expanded to include training and classes at the net cafe, increase the number of computers available, and implement relevant building upgrades.

              

//OTHER WAYS TO HELP

It is understandable if you are unable to donate to our cause! Please show support to the campaign by SHARING this link and spreading our cause! 

THANK YOU FOR THE SUPPORT!


For more Infographics and Statistics:

https://infogr.am/_/Ql2lNiOczeS4UE4uMNvH
