story:
Violence against vulnerable males and boys is a topic that remains taboo and often neglected. It tends to get very little attention from NGO's, the media and the general public. The scale of male child prostitution in Dhaka, the capital of Bangladesh, is much larger than generally assumed and boys are sexually exploited from very young ages. There is little support offered to these particularly vulnerable children and youth. Many of these boys and young men are living or working on the streets. They are vulnerable to sexually transmitted diseases, drug abuse, violence from their exploiters, physical injuries, psychological trauma, and low self-esteem.

We are currently supporting a project in Thailand that works with boys and youth who are sexually exploited and trafficked and young  men that are engaged in sex work in Chiang Mai, in Northern Thailand. Our local partner organization offers of a drop-in center for these boys where they can have a shower or a hot meal, hang out, and interact positively in a safe space with a team of youth workers. They also offer full individualized support that includes facilitating access to medical care, help in finding and alternative job opportunity or training as well as offering alternative housing. Our partner does night outreach  three times a week in bars and clubs to create a link with these boys and identify newcomers that need support, during which the social workers distribute kits that contain condoms, hygiene material and inform them of the services they may access if they need further help. They are also supporting the many drug users we meet through providing information on how to reduce drug-related harm as well as providing access to counseling, medical services and additional individualized help.

We want to create a similar project in Dhaka in Bangladesh with a local organization, because the needs of these children and youth are immense. Developing a good project that leads to sustainable change and reaches the most vulnerable requires understanding of local culture, context and practices.

We need 4,500 USD to make this happen!

This money will go directly to cover expenses to visit the country and meet partners working with vulnerable populations and to design future activities with them. We want to kick-start our program in Bangladesh in 2015. We have planned to go to Dhaka mid-January 2015, so we need your help right now! We will update you on the project development on our website www.up-international.org.

Vulnerable males and boys who are survivors of violence need your help to get a second chance in life.

What if we go over our goal?

We'll use the additional money to fund the project that will be developed in Bangladesh to help boys and and young men who are victims of violence.

With our warm thanks for your support,

Mark and Judith

Other ways you can help

Spread the word about up! international and share this project with your friends.

Visit up! international directly on www.up-international.org for more information or to contact us.

Like and share us on Facebook and Twitter

We greatly appreciate your support!

Developing a good project that leads to sustainable change and reaches the most vulnerable requires understanding of local culture, context and practices. We need 4,500 USD to make this happen! This money will go directly to cover expenses to visit the country and meet partners working with vulnerable populations and to design future activities with them. We want to kick-start our program in Bangladesh in 2015. We have planned to go to Dhaka mid-January 2015, so we need your help right now! We will update you on the project development  on our website www.up-international.org.Vulnerable males and boys who are survivors of violence need your help to get a second chance in life.What if we go over our goal?

We'll use the additional money to fund the project that will
be developed in Bangladesh to help boys and and young men who are victims of
violence.With our warm thanks for your support,Mark and Judith
Other ways you can help
Spread the word about up! international and share this
project with your friends.
Visit up! international directly on www.up-international.org
for more information or to contact us.
Like and share us on Facebook and Twitter
We greatly appreciate your support!

story:
Short Summary

This business is not anything new. It has been tested and proven successful throughout the centuries. We, my wife and I, want to buy distressed properties, fix them up, and then hold on to them as rental units for passive income. That's it, but that has very little to do with the real project. Money after all is just a means to an end.

I am a professional, PMP certified, project manager. Unfortunately almost all of my projects have either had such a long commute as to leave me utterly exhausted at the end of the day or, like now,have  been out of town meaning I only see my family on the weekends. I find that I am not home enough to have the strong relationships and provide the consistency my family needs. Someday my situation will change, and some day I will have time, but someday it will be too late and my boys will be men. The real project is to grow my wonderful boys (ages 6, 4 and 0 in June) into superb men.

Background and Method

As I mention above, I am a professional project manager. In other words, I am a Project Management Hammer and I tend to see things a Project Nails. On a daily bases I acquire a solid, but some what general understanding of my project components and then leverage professions with deeper and more specific knowledge than I to complete the the individual tasks. In general I usually have the best overall understanding of the project, but for any specific component, there is a professional on my team more knowledgeable than I on that one thing. I plan to do the same with this project. The basic steps are as follows:

  1. Use a hard money loan to purchase a distressed property at 70% after repair value minus repairs.
  2. Fix the home up to good, rentable condition.
  3. Rent out the property.
  4. Refinance with a bank for 80% of its new value. This should recuperate most of the closing, carrying, financing, and refinancing costs.
  5. Rinse and repeat.  All rental income and an additional 20% of my income will be put into building more equity.  To goal being to eventually cut out the hard money lenders and then the banks.
  6. Once net rental income is sufficient to replace my wages, become a full time Supper Dad, instead of just a weekend one as I am now.
Once I am able to replace my income, my full time plan for my boys will be as follows:
  1. Fall through spring
  • Drop my sons off at school every morning and pick them up every afternoon
  • Help them with their studies after school
  • Play and spend time with them while they are young and still want to play with their dad.
  • Agree as a family on a large project that will take about 9 months to complete working together in the evenings and on Saturdays. The purpose is to give us a common goal to work towards where everyone can play a role and have a responsibility. This could be anything from building a boat to doing the work ourselves on one of the investment properties.
  • Learn a language together as a family that we will use in the summer.
  • Summer
    • Travel and explore. Spend the summer in Thailand visiting grandparents, in Japan visiting cousins, or in Scotland seeing where our family is from. The idea is to stay in one place long enough to gain an appreciation for the people, culture, values, and beliefs. Then again we might drive across the country in an RV we fixed up the previous year.

    Impact

    We are committed to this plan. For over the past two year we have been saving 20% of my income and we will succeed, but this campaign and associated project will have huge impacts in two areas.

    First, entirely funding the project through our own savings and a combination of hard money and bank loans will take about 11 years 11 months.  Just in time for our first son to leave.

    • $30,000 raised: Start immediately and Finish 7 months faster.
    • $100,000 raised: Avoid the Hard money lenders, work only with the banks, and finish  in 10 years 2 months, 1 year and 9 months faster.
    • $500,000 Raised: Almost completely avoid the banks. Finish as fast as we can find, renovate, and rent properties that meet our criteria.
    • $1,000,000 Raised: We can completely avoid the hard money lenders and the banks and I can immediately focus full time on being a Real Estate Super Dad!
    Second, I, and therefore my family, gets to escape the rat race and spend time with each other while the children are small.  I will do my best to be a good role model as husband who loves his wife and a father who loves his children.

    Risks Challenges

    While there are always risks, we will be using several strategies to mitigate, or lessen both the probability and potential harm including the following.

    • Because we are buying and holding we will be making income off of rent.  If therefore we end up over paying a little on the property or the repairs turn out to be more than expected, our rate of return will be decreased, but we will still have the income stream.  
      • Elements of appreciation or depreciation (whether forced or over time) are not as impactfull. 
      • Slight cost overruns are not as damaging.
    • Adequate property and mortgage insurance will help to cover against suit and desaster.
    • Structuring properties in LLCs will protect against outside and inside legal attacks.
    • Use of qualified professionals will help to avoid any missteps.  These professionals include but are not limited to:
      • Licensed and bonded contractors (carpenters, plumbers, and electricians).
      • Real Estate agents experienced in our type of income property.
      • Property managers knowledgeable in our chosen area.
      • Tax accountants and book keeper specializing in real estate.
      • Property inspectors.
      • Landscaping professionals.
    • Multiple smaller properties instead of fewer larger ones to spread risk.
    Finally, this is an instance where a sharp knife is safer than a dull one.  So the more capital we are able to acquire, the more protected we will be from a single bad deal early on.

    Other Ways You Can Help

    Any amount will help us get closer to our goals, but whether or not you feel you can contribute financially please help us gain exposure:

    • Vote for us above.
    • Help us share our story using the tools on the left!

story:
What is KiwiTree?

KiwiTree is the passion project of brothers Cameron and Christian Rogowski.  From a very young age we were taught by our father the importance of service and helping others who are in need.  While growing up we assisted countless neighbors move furniture, laid sod for several new lawns in the hot Utah sun, and tutored struggling peers in school.  As we began to get older we became heavily involved in fundraising and philanthropy (and even broke a few world records along the way!  See here and here).  As time went on we realized that, due to concerns raised in communities throughout the country, raising funds as a non-profit had been becoming more and more difficult.  KiwiTree is our solution to that issue.

KiwiTree Co-Founders Christian (left) and Cameron (right) Rogowski

What does it do?

KiwiTree is a new funding platform designed to give users the ability to support charities and non-profits they love without feeling a large hit to their bank account.  KiwiTree uses a unique system which rounds each purchase made with electronic means (including debit or credit card purchases) to the next dollar, and automatically donates that “spare change” to up to 5 causes of your choice.  There are no fees, no hassle, and 100% of all donations go to their designated organization on a monthly basis.  Also, as all our clients are non-profit organizations, many of the donations made are tax deductible for our donors. To help with taxes, all donors will receive an email at the end of each year detailing how much was donated to each supported non-profit.  We are not looking to build an empire, we have simply created a way to get money into the hands of those who can really make an impact in this world.

Throughout the development of KiwiTree we have made an effort to keep everything as simple and user-friendly as possible, that's why users are able to turn on, turn off, and set limits to the service whenever needed from anywhere with internet access.  No contacting customer support to make changes, no waiting to cancel service, no pulling out your hair trying to do anything that should take the simple click of a button.



What are the funds for?

The development of the service itself is nearing completion.  As we are working with donations made to non-profits and charities, our income from the project is minimal.  As development of the system is nearly complete, the money earned through this fundraising campaign will be used for server space to process the user’s micro donations, additional security of our users’ information, improving site's aesthetic appeal, and marketing materials to expand the KiwiTree network of non-profits and charities as wide as possible. 

The Kiwi Kingdom

Here at KiwiTree we like to think of our users and supporters as more than family, that's why we have created the Kiwi Kingdom.  As you may have noticed, many of the donation rewards include a role in the kingdom (from "Knight" to "Royalty") which will show everyone on kiwitree.com how important your contribution is to us.  We have also reserved the position of "Kiwi King" which will be given to the highest contributor during our IndieGoGo campaign.  The top donor will be the only person at this contribution level and cannot be dethroned.  All hail the future king! 


Risks and challenges

Currently, this electronic “round-up” funding method does not exist for charities and non-profits, and, as with many trail blazing ideas, there are potential hang ups. Although we do not foresee any issues with the development of KiwiTree, or with the fulfillment of our donation rewards, we ask for your patience if any hiccups occur.

Unfortunately, due to the difference in laws governing charities throughout the world, KiwiTree will only be able to support charities and non-profits which are based in the United States. We are eager to extend the benefits of KiwiTree’s “round-up” funding world-wide, but for now not all non-profits will be eligible for our services.

Also, as we want to insure that all donations actually end up in the hands of the cause they are intended for, KiwiTree users will only be able to donate to pre-approved organizations that have been verified by KiwiTree. The list of verified organizations will grow with us over time, but we ask for your patience and continued support in the case of your favorite organization not yet being approved.

story:
About this Project/Initiative

Silicon Valley, the nickname given to the home of some many of the world's largest technology corporations, as well as thousands of tech startup companies. A place where students, potential (and experienced) entrepreneurs, and investors all flock to. A place that has become synonymous with innovation, startups and breakthroughs.


Why can’t we have a city like this in Australia? Why isn’t any Australian city known for its technology, innovation or startups? One of the biggest reasons is that university (and Tafe) students are not actively encouraged to pursue ideas, dreams and ambitions. This is what Project AussieVation (Australian Innovation) is all about; encouraging Australians (starting with university students) to innovate, design and advance society.

Let’s take a look at one famous university in Silicon Valley, Stanford University; “During the 1940s and 1950s (when Silicone Valley started becoming known for being a tech hub), Frederick Terman, as Stanford's dean of engineering and provost, encouraged faculty and graduates to start their own companies. He is credited with nurturing Hewlett-Packard, Varian Associates, and other high-tech firms, until what would become Silicon Valley grew up around the Stanford campus. Terman is often called "the father of Silicon Valley"” (taken from Wikipedia.org).


It is often said that children, teenagers, and young adults are tomorrow’s future. But, by not empowering them with the correct skills and equally as important, giving them encouragement, young adults will continue to follow society’s “default” route (ie. Finish high school, go to university or learn a trade, find a partner and perhaps get children, work until retirement, and then retire), not having made society and the world a better place. The goal is not to pick on or insult those that choose to live the non-entrepreneurial lifestyle, but rather, due to a lack of the required skills/tools and encouragement, many would-be entrepreneurs “play it safe” and choose to work a 9-5 job instead of trying out their idea. Imagine if more Australians tried designing new technology, or a renewable source of energy to fuel cars sustainably, who knows where we could have taken the world…


Who are we?

We are a small group of university students from Perth that would like to make Australia a nation like the US, UK, Germany or South Korea(etc), famous for technology, medicine, automobiles, biotechnology, etc.

My course of study is a Bachelor of Engineering (Civil and Structural)/ Bachelor of Commerce double degree.

This initiative is not to make money. However, it is NOT a not-for-profit. Whilst we are considering registering it as a not-for-profit, registering it as one makes it more difficult to obtain funding (from investors). This would seriously limit expansion of the initiative into other states. Ideally, the initiative will be registered as a company. This would be the easiest business structure to deal with, especially if we are to receive funding and sponsorship from the government and other investors.


What do we plan on doing?

Initially, our plan is to target one area, and one market within that area. The proposed area that we’ll be kicking off in is Perth and the target market will be university students. We plan on hosting events and/or stands at university Orientation Days (ie. O-Days), pitching to students at university Career Days (ie. Where various companies go to inform students about their organisations), put up flyers around campus and lastly, hold small workshops within university libraries. After we manage to get our message across to university students, we’ll be rolling out to various TAFEs and high schools.

Thereafter, the plan is to launch on the East Coast (Sydney, Melbourne, and Brisbane) and thereafter other Australian cities (eg. Adelaide, etc).

Ideally, students will have ties to both the US and China: The US can provide a significant headstart in terms of research and development  for students as they are at the forefront of technologicfal innovation, and China, to produce prototypes and harness the manufacturing might of China.


What will we be teaching?

This will be split into 2 major parts; face-to-face contact and website contact.

The face-to-face contact will be used to inform students about the potential and role of entrepreneurship, the opportunities and lastly, the benefits. Face-to-face contact time will primarily be used to stimulate interest in entrepreneurship, innovation, and pursuing good ideas. Thereafter, they will be directed to our website (currently under development).

The website (free to use) will provide them with an easy to understand summary of key areas of knowledge required to form and run a startup. This includes the following areas;

  • The potential and role of entrepreneurs and startups
  • Market opportunities and beneficial fields to go into
  • Business models
  • Business strategies (including competitor and innovation strategies)
  • Types of companies
  • Sales and marketing
  • Intellectual property
  • Expansion and acquisition
  • Financial plan
  • Profit, distribution and internal rate of returns
  • Sources of capital


There are various fields that students will be informed about, including;

  • Internet Of Things (IOT)
  • Ventures for good (homeless shelters, etc)
  • Health and wellness
  • Technology
  • Clean energy
  • Life Sciences (eg. Biotechnology, Pharmaceuticals, etc)
  • Information Technology

Whilst these are fields that students will be informed about (primarily because they benefit society and not just the individual), students will not be discouraged from pursuing ideas within fields such as media, real estate, etc.

Lastly, group work and the benefits of collaborating together will be heavily emphasized.



What do we require?

Our main struggle is funding our activities. Universities, lecturers, etc all seem keen (or at least interested) in the idea, and some are even willing to help. Funding breakdown (in order of importance) as follows;

  1. Website hosting and advanced design (basic design to be completed by us) - $1200
  2. Banners, posters, flyers, brochures and promotional items for kiosks/booths - $1000
  3. Banners, posters, flyers, brochures for placing around campuses - $600
  4. University fees to host booths/kiosks - $1200*                                                            *This is for just one university. We’re hoping to get sponsors on board to sponsor the costs required to get into other universities.


Who’s helping?

We have a few lecturers who have offered to help “man the stands” at our booths on O-day and Career Awareness Days.

We have also spoke to one university (to be increased as universities reopen around February), and they have agreed that encouraging and promoting development and innovation in the above listed fields is crucial, thus they will assist with the promotion. However, we still have to bear all the costs of design, printing, etc.

Lastly, we plan on getting on board a few successful entrepreneurs to serve as an example or as a “success story”, to promote development and innovation in entrepreneurship.

The US is at the forefront of technological innovation, the UK is at the forefront of pharmaceutical drugs (ie. Medication, skin products, etc), Germany is at the forefront of the automobile technologies and innovations, what will Australia be at the forefront of? 

Note to non-Australians:

We are not trying to advance Australia so that it can be "better" than other countries, but rather, we are only trying to stimulate innovation and developement so that Australians as well can make the world a better place. Please support us :)


How can you help?

We appreciate you taking the time to read this. We humbly ask of you to please help us in any way you can. If you can help us financially, please back our campaign. If you cant, please consider other ways to support us. Some other ways in which you can help us include;

  • Sharing this Campaign on Twitter, Facebook or any other platform.
  • Tell others about this initiative. Perhaps they can back this campaign.
  • If you an Australian entrepreneur, get in touch. Perhaps we can use you as a success story.
  • If you are in Perth, get in touch. Perhaps you can come and help us "pitch" to students at universities, tafes and high schools.

and website contact.
The face-to-face contact will be used to inform students
about the potential and role of entrepreneurship, the opportunities and lastly,
the benefits. Face-to-face contact time will primarily be used to stimulate
interest in entrepreneurship, innovation, and pursuing good ideas. Thereafter,
they will be directed to our website (currently under development). 
The website (free to use) will provide them with an easy to
understand summary of key areas of knowledge required to form and run a
startup. This includes the following areas;


The
potential and role of entrepreneurs and startups


Market
opportunities and beneficial fields to go into


Business
models


Business
strategies (including competitor and innovation strategies)


Types of
companies


Sales and
marketing


Intellectual
property


Expansion
and acquisition


Financial
plan


Profit,
distribution and internal rate of returns


Sources of
capital



There are various fields that students will be informed
about, including;


Internet Of Things (IOT)


Ventures for good (homeless shelters, etc)


Health and wellness


Technology


Clean energy


Life Sciences (eg. Biotechnology, Pharmaceuticals, etc)


Information Technology


Whilst these are fields that students will be informed about
(primarily because they benefit society and not just the individual), students
will not be discouraged from pursuing ideas within fields such as media, real
estate, etc.
Lastly, group work and the benefits of collaborating together
will be heavily emphasized.

What do we require?
Our main
struggle is funding our activities. Universities, lecturers, etc all seem keen
(or at least interested) in the idea, and some are even willing to help.
Funding breakdown (in order of importance) as follows;


Website
hosting and advanced design (basic design to be completed by us) - $1200


Banners,
posters, flyers, brochures and promotional items for kiosks/booths - $1000


Banners,
posters, flyers, brochures for placing around campuses - $600


University
fees to host booths/kiosks - $1200*                                                            *This is for
just one university. We’re hoping to get sponsors on board to sponsor the costs
required to get into other universities.


Who’s helping?
We have a
few lecturers who have offered to help “man the stands” at our booths on O-day
and Career Awareness Days.
We have also
spoke to one university (to be increased as universities reopen around
February), and they have agreed that encouraging and promoting development and
innovation in the above listed fields is crucial, thus they will assist with
the promotion. However, we still have to bear all the costs of design,
printing, etc.
Lastly, we
plan on getting on board a few successful entrepreneurs to serve as an example
or as a “success story”, to promote development and innovation in
entrepreneurship.
The US is at the forefront of technological innovation, the
UK is at the forefront of pharmaceutical drugs (ie. Medication, skin products,
etc), Germany is at the forefront of the automobile technologies and
innovations, what will Australia be at the forefront of? Note to non-Australians: We are not trying to advance Australia so that it can be "better" than other countries, but rather, we are only trying to stimulate innovation and developement so that Australians as well can make the world a better place. Please support us :)How can you help?We appreciate you taking the time to read this. We humbly ask of you to please help us in any way you can. If you can help us financially, please back our campaign. If you cant, please consider other ways to support us. Some other ways in which you can help us include;

Sharing this Campaign on Twitter, Facebook or any other platform.


Tell others about this initiative. Perhaps they can back this campaign.


If you an Australian entrepreneur, get in touch. Perhaps we can use you as a success story.


If you are in Perth, get in touch. Perhaps you can come and help us "pitch" to students at universities, tafes and high schools.

story:
Imagine being abused in a relationship and having no money to leave a bad situation. Domestic Violence victims can now take steps to strengthen their finance.

One morning this woman woke up with a cane hitting her face repeatedly by her husband.  Her husband was mad because they had bills.  Her face was beaten beyond recognition.  She left and returned to her husband one week later because she had no money.  That person was my "sister".  My sister did not report it to the police, she was shame and did not want anyone to know about her situation.  She stayed at my mother house for one week, and her husband told her that he would not do it again and that he was sorry. Many people are in this situation.

Did you know, financial factors are the strongest predictors in a survivor's decision to stay, leave, or return to an abusive relationship. The devastation of leaving behind a home, income, benefits and economic security are challenges that all survivors of domestic violence must overcome, regardless of their education, job skills and personal earning potential. Many survivors of domestic violence have limited or no access to money or have had their financial security destroyed by their abuser. In fact we want to try to education the survivor by giving them their own internet business that can pursued with their passion.


What the survivors will expect:                                                                        

 The domestic violence survivors may only have a cell phone and they can build their business via the cell phone and they will not need a computer to build the business.

The domestic violence survivors are not feeling secure financially, but with a website, they can start dreaming again and hoping, having faith and getting secured financially.

No sense of value, feel worthless, but by having their own business, they can add value and start building their self esteem.

      


A Domestic Violence Victim Can Have Less Worry If;

They have a business idea and they have no way of pursuing that idea, Imanij can help.

They can have income that will support them when they leave home.

They are usually afraid of the world because of the finance, Imanij will give them hope regarding finance.

Many domestic violence survivors reported they have lost jobs due to domestic violence and our solution is offering them to start their own business.

Women experiences unemployment and are welfare recipients, now they can become self employed.

  Lack of money and steady income is often challenge faced by a survivor of domestic violence when they leave the abuser. Having an internet business will give them possibility of having income.


Empowerment Makes A Difference!

Your contribution will allow a domestic violence survivors  feel more independent, safer, hopeful and less financially strained. Be part of knowing that your help contributed to someone financial independent.

By your  contribution, you  will help the victims discovered there talent and help them create an internet business based on their talent and passion.

If it is necessary, we can show the victims  how to have a discreet business online. Imanij will help the victims  build their dreams and hopefully this will build their self esteem and empowered them. We work with local foundation and non profit foundation for the domestic violence survivors.

We will work with each person to determine their talent in business.  Staff and volunteers will work closely with the survivors.  staffing will not leave the clients until they feel comfortable enough to be on their own.  We will work with North Carolina, then we will move to the States were it is reported of low income.  Domestic Violence is higher when the income is low.

story:
"Bucegi" is the brand of the old Romanian truck I'm in love with. I drove one for many years while I was younger and it was pure love. Based on a Ford Y-block pattern V8 gasoline engine of 140 HP, the first SR-131 truck was produced in the summer of 1960. In the five years a lot of trucks have been produced, including military vehicle, long vehicle, tip-lorry and crane.

I've been in love with this truck for years, I'm modeled it from resin years ago and I've played with it in Microsoft Train Simulator. Last year a friend of mine introduce me to 3D printing and it's been a new horizon opened in front of my eyes. I have rebuilt the cabin from Microsoft Train Simulator to STL and start printing. For the last year I've managed together with my friends to design for 3D printing three Bucegi trucks (a gasoline tanker, a lorry truck, and a tractor).

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

Who are you ? 

I’m Arin Panait, I’m 52, I leave in a small town in Romania, Fetesti. I could describe myself as “a passionate hobbyist”. I have done a lot of things and there were a lot of domains I was interested into. 

I’ve started tinkering in my childhood with DIY construction machinery toys made of wood and wire, I’ve done lot of fretwork (some photos on my blog - http://arin.panait.net/?s=trasuri), I’ve built a model railroad diorama as large as my living room (http://trenulete.info/orasul-din-sufragerie-prin-lentila-unui-ziarist-la-adevarul), and for the last few years my passion is to build custom model cars. I have built lot of models, both from scratch and by customizing off-the-shelf models (a Romanian Postal Service car http://arin.panait.net/dacia-1304-posta-romana/ or the car of ex-dictator Ceausescu - http://arin.panait.net/aro-306-ma%C8%99ina-decapotabila-a-lui-ceau%C8%99escu).

Last year I’ve first seen a 3D printer, with the help of a friend. It was like a new universe has opened for in front of my eyes. I’ve been fortunate to have friends who helped me use the new technology and helped me with creating 3D models. This way an old dream of mine came true : modelling of the old Bucegi Romanian truck. 


What is “Bucegi”, why and how are you modelling it ?

Bucegi is an old Romanian truck brand that have been produced in Romania 40-50 years ago. I drove one when I was younger and it was love at first sight. Around 25-30 different trucks have been produced in Romania, all on the same Bucegi platform (lorry, tractor truck, gasoline tanker, garbage truck, milk tanker, fire truck, refrigerated truck, timber lorry and others).

Years ago, playing Microsoft Train Simulator, I have modelled the trucks as 3D digital models for the software.  I’ve tried many times to replicate real models with resin and stuff, but nothing satisfactory until I’ve start using the 3D printing technology.

As I said, 3D printing has opened a new universe for me. Converting the cabin from Microsoft Train Simulator to STL for 3D printing was the first step I did (http://arin.panait.net/bucegi-pregatiri/). One year later, with help from my friends, many trucks were ready (see the pages on the blog - http://arin.panait.net/page/4/?s=bucegi). Three of the trucks are completely 3D printable, all the elements have been modelled and printed. For the rest of the trucks you see on the blog, it’s actually a combination between 3D printing and building from scratch from other materials.

 

Why have you started this campaign ?

What I want is to share with people the results of my work. I really think it’s nice for the youth to have the chance to connect with the technology of the past. As soon as I have enough trucks to display, I want to create  a small museum for everyone to learn about the old technology.

This is a goal I see in the future, for now I have to focus on modelling and printing. That’s actually the role of the campaign. To allow me to focus on 3D modelling and printing until I have enough models ready to be displayed. I have three models ready to be printed (the ones I’m offering in the campaign),  and I still have about 20 trucks to modelled and printed. 


I’ve seen all the perks on your campaign are the same, no matter the contribution. Why ?
 

That is correct, all the perks are the same, no matter the contribution. Although the Indiegogo platform is mainly used by startups and businesses, I do not see my Indiegogo campaign as a business. If I wanted to make money, I would have sold the models on Shapeways or similar for a fixed price. However, I only need a way to focus on designing new stuff for 3D printing and later creating my museum, and nothing more. It’s up to you to decide how much value and happiness my models bring to you and contribute accordingly on the campaign.

story:
Coffee Depot is my dream in action as a go-to coffee shop that serves coffee roasted in Wyoming with a local caterer providing quick and easy breakfast and lunch with home-cooked flavor.  Local artists will be also be able to display/sell their art and I will offer local vendors an avenue to sell their locally produced items outside of the Farmer's Market.

I saw an opportunity and need for a coffee shop in the Asher Wyoming Arts Center in downtown Cheyenne and knew this was my opportunity.  New to Cheyenne, my husband and I have realized that the heart of Cheyenne is their local residents and businesses. 

Working in a coffee shop in high school, I fell in love with coffee and it has always been my dream to own a coffee shop.  Now I am looking for your help to piece together funding to get this plan soaring off the ground! 

 

          


With any start-up business, the initial cost can be the largest obstacle aside from the business planning itself.  Since the space I will be leasing is already established and once housed a coffee shop, my initial costs won't be as high in comparison to other start-up coffee shops or restaurants.  My goal amount of $30K includes:

  • Astoria Espresso Machine
  • Grab and Go Refrigerated Food Case
  • Coffee Brewer
  • Brewed Coffee Airpots
  • Coffee Grinders
  • Undercounter Refrigerator
  • Ice machine for frozen coffee drinks and smoothies
  • Inventory
    • Coffee, Syrups, Milk, Cups/Lids, etc.
  • Tables and Chairs
  • Administrative Costs—Rent, Payroll and Utilities

I am seeking and finalizing loans from personal investors; the funds donated here will help offset and fund those upfront costs.  Every penny donated will go towards start-up costs and to assist paying the loans established for the same purpose.  With your help, I can ensure the doors to this coffee shop open and remain open for years to come. 



 

With each donation, there are a lot of neat Coffee Depot perks to be earned.  We have limited-edition coffee mugs and t-shirts as well as a chance at free coffee for a year! Just scroll down through the perks on the right-hand side of the screen.  We will hold our drawings at the end of the campaign.  That is our thanks to you for being supporters!

     


     




It seems like there is a coffee shop on every corner these days—do we need Coffee Depot?  The answer is yes!!  Various market research indicates that well over 60% of American adults purchase prepared coffee/tea drinks.  The demand is there and franchises like Starbucks popping up all over are answering this demand. 

Coffee Depot will take this a step further and as a small business will give back to the local community and help it grow.  We will support a local coffee roaster and serve their coffee both brewed and in specialty drinks.  This allows for premium flavor as the coffee will always be freshly roasted, a quality that most haven’t experienced in a cup of coffee.  We will serve locally made, freshly prepared soups, salads and sandwiches.  While doing this, we are boosting the local community by providing jobs to individuals in Cheyenne and supporting other local businesses.

As a small business, we will be able to recognize and answer to the requests of our customers and pride ourselves on superior customer service.  After all, Coffee Depot and all that are affiliated are here for the people of Cheyenne.


  

     


Any project or business has its risks and challenges as it grows.  A new business runs the risk of failure and a few reasons most businesses fail is underestimating operating expenses, insufficient planning and poor management.  One of the reasons we are running this campaign is to reach out to friends and family for support to offset the startup costs to ensure that the initial hurdle doesn’t set us back and impact our normal day-to-day operations and expenses.  Our first step was reaching out to fellow business owners, friends and family to bounce the idea around and start developing a very thorough business plan.  The business plan is a document that will grow and change as the company grows.  Management has to be flexible and understand this plan and be willing to make necessary adjustments to ensure the success of the company.

I have worked in various industries and most recently spent over 13 years in government finance, received my Bachelor’s degree in Business Administration and have supervised for over five years.  The experience I possess and the passions I have for coffee, owning my own business, the community and the network of amazing family, friends and acquaintances I have established will tremendously help in successfully running this business. 

“There are no secrets to success.  It is the result of preparation, hard work, and learning from failure.” – Colin Powell


          

         


Thank you so much for taking the time to look at our business and please share this campaign with everyone you know and get the word out!  Every donation and each person who can share our page helps tremendously!  We appreciate it!!

story:
All About Zoodles Mobile Cafe

Hi there! I'm Maggi Munat and I am so looking forward  to serving gluten-free , low carb comfort foods at Sonoma County events! The first dishes I'll be serving are all based on "zoodles" (zucchini noodles). I want there to  be an alternative to high carb processed pasta, bread and grain products! You'll be able to have your favorite yummy sauces on top of zoodles instead! Pesto, Phad Thai and Mediterranean Arugula will be some of my featured dishes! Mmmmmm!

To give you a little background about me and my upcoming Zoodles Cafe

  • I have 25 years experience in the restaurant biz, and have been cooking many types of delicious healthy foods for decades.
  • After recently losing 45 pounds in six months of eating low carb and then revamping my diet for good, I realized there are no foods like these available out at Sonoma County events. I want to change this and have healthier menu options for people.
  • With your help, I can make these foods available to you, your family and friends at North Bay events: farmer's markets, winery events, concerts and other local happenings!

On the Zoodles menu, there are tasty options for these and  many other healthy diets:

  • Paleo
  • Low carb
  • Whole 30
  • Atkins
  • South Beach
  • Vegan/vegetarian

This food is amazingly delicious which is why you're going to love it! Your body will love it because it's so wholesome, healthy, and nutritious! 

What Is Needed 

Here is a list of what is needed to get started. At first, I thought it would be simple. After all , I just wanted to sell some hot dishes at a local farmer's market. It turns out , there are all kinds of licenses and permits needed in addition to  extensive cooking equipment. I already have my California Food Safety Manager certification, proving that I know how to safely prepare, store, cook and serve food.

  • Zoodles Mobile Cafe needs $5,000 to get started.
  • Here is a link to the nearly complete $3,000  equipment list 
  • The initial licensing, permits and insurance totals about $1,000
  • $400 goes to Indiegogo (5% of total funds plus credit card processing fees)
  • $600 goes towards perk production  and product promotion (product creation and dish samples)
  • The good thing about Indiegogo is it's not an all-or-nothing crowdfunding platform, meaning Zoodles Cafe gets to keep all the money that is raised. Yes,  the entire amount is needed to be up and running but I can still move forward with whatever amount I reach.  I will definitely be serving my dishes to the public as soon as I am able!!


What You Get

  • Cool perks for contributions! Check 'em out ! Claim them to the right!
  • If you're local, you can get this awesome food at my booth! Woo hoo!
  • DJ and chef services for Sonoma County only
  • Shirts can ship anywhere in the U.S.


Why is Zoodles Mobile Cafe important?

There are simply no eateries like it in the area. I can find no restaurants within 50 miles with a focus on "low carb comfort foods". The low carb concept in not exactly new, but no restaurants seem to feature this type of food. It is time for this type of cuisine to be more readily available!

  • With the start of Zoodles Mobile Cafe, perhaps other restaurants will follow suit and have more dishes like these be offered on their menus.

  •  Let's not forget all of the foods will be gluten-free, in addition to super yummy and healthy! Check out this promo video and you'll see what I mean..



Risks & Challenges

I have to be perfectly honest. Although I am super confident and know my product is amazing, I'm a little scared. Cooking has always been a passion of mine and one I shared with close friends and family. Feeding people is a way I show that I love and care for them. Now I am taking this very personal, intimate and emotional creativity and sharing it with the world. But I am ready to feel the fear and do it anyway! This is me and who I am! And this type of cuisine has changed my life in so many wonderful ways. By using my talent for healthy cooking, I feel I can really make a difference in others' lives in this same positive fashion!

I'm sure I will face many challenges but I'm ready!

  • I have a lifetime of experience of experience in the hospitality and restaurant business
  • I have gained many administrative and business skills over the last several years
  • I will surround myself with strong, capable people as part of my team

Other Ways You Can Help

I realize many of you don't live in Sonoma County so you won't be able to enjoy my cuisine.  And my future food truck will probably stick  to locations in NorCal and the Bay Area. Or perhaps a Zoodles franchise is on the horizon?! I truly feel this is the start of something huge!. It's time for foods like these to hit the culinary scene in a big way!! I am thrilled to be riding the first waves of this  healthy food trend!

If you truly can't contribute monetarily, there are other ways you can help!

  • Share my Zoodles Mobile Cafe campaign via Facebook and other social media!
  • If you have design, marketing, photography skills, these will be helpful in many, many ways!
  • If you have a  product or service hat you would like to offer as a "perk" (what someone gets for their contribution), that would be excellent!

This is all gonna happen, with your help!! Let's do a happy food dance!
story_txt:
All About Zoodles Mobile Cafe Hi there! I'm Maggi Munat and I am so looking forward  to serving gluten-free , low carb comfort foods at Sonoma County events! The first dishes I'll be serving are all based on "zoodles" (zucchini noodles). I want there to  be an alternative to high carb  processed pasta, bread and grain products! You'll be able to have your favorite yummy sauces on top of zoodles instead! Pesto, Phad Thai and Mediterranean Arugula will be some of my featured dishes! Mmmmmm!
To give you a little background about me and my upcoming Zoodles Cafe  I have 25 years experience in the restaurant biz, and have been cooking many types of delicious healthy foods for decades.
 After recently losing 45 pounds in six months of eating low carb and then revamping my diet for good, I realized there are no foods like these available out at Sonoma County events. I want to change this and have healthier menu options for people.
 With your help, I can make these foods available to you, your family and friends at North Bay events: farmer's markets, winery events, concerts and other local happenings! 


On the Zoodles menu, there are tasty options for these and  many other healthy diets:

Paleo
Low carb
Whole 30
Atkins
South Beach
Vegan/vegetarian


  This food is amazingly delicious which is why you're going to love it! Your body will love it because it's so wholesome, healthy, and nutritious!  


What Is Needed  



 Here is a list of what is needed to get started. At first, I thought it would be simple. After all , I just wanted to sell some hot dishes at a local farmer's market. story:
Short Summary

Hello, Everyone.

I raise and release butterflies. Specifically Monarchs, but other winged species too. I was prompted to begin butterfly gardening by the passing of my father (you can read about that piece here). During this time, I experienced 4 years of persistent reoccurring dreams/visions. They began roughly, 6 and a ½ years ago. For 3 out of those 4 years I had no idea what the dreams meant.

What shifted? I began to align myself with my passions, the dream-visions became clearer and as that happened, parts of these dreams began weaving into my waking life. I began to recognize opportunities and steps I could take to make the dream a reality. The most significant clarity of my dreams was revealed when I began feeling and seeing myself engaged in occupations that came naturally to me with ease, grace and most importantly, Joy. Bottom line, the dream-visions were a calling for Nature and environmental stewardship and community. I “answered the call”, so to speak, and ultimately I feel this is not just MY dream, but a collective dream being facilitated and expressed through me. Hubs woven into our communities, cities and towns that place conscious emphasis on supporting natural havens, waystations and ecosystems, are essential to reestablish and maintain our balance with Nature. I see these hubs as gateways to elevate public environmental awareness, connecting us to the value of All living things and consciously reinforcing these standards until it becomes a natural occurrence in our everyday lives. 

This has all brought me face-to-face with my dream of running Monarch Manor Retreats on the business-property you will read about below. In addition, I’ve also had a longstanding daytime-dream of hosting a Tea Room. All the amenities are already in place to facilitate it in the historical home on the property, and local zoning will allow it. If feasible - a tea room will be offered in the near future.


Now, on to this delicious property/business

Present owner’s description:

“An oasis of tranquility in a suburb of urban Tampa. Central to beaches, Disney, Busch Gardens, outlet malls and antique districts. Walk to Starbucks or drive a few minutes to golf, tennis, horse and canoe rentals. It is the perfect place for R&R or to combine business and pleasure. Unlike other strictly tourist-oriented destinations, the Tampa Bay Area is prime for both vacation lodging as well as corporate short-term assignments and house-hunting for relocation. The three homes on the estate offer a great deal of flexibility for use and room for expansion.”

Parcel#1 w/business “2 homes, pool and stables on 3.5 wooded acres, ideal for Bed & Breakfast. If you are looking for room to roam and need to spread your wings then this is the property for you. This unique property consists of a 4br/2ba home along with a detached 2bd/1ba cottage which can easily be converted into a 3bd cottage all situated on 1 acre of pristine land in a prime location. Current owners have this property setup as an income producing business which is consistently booked throughout the year by new and returning customers. This income producing property allows the next buyer to walk into a turnkey operation with solid financials and includes all appliances, furniture, linens, dishes, and cups. Both the home and cottage are serviced by two separate septic systems. Cooks kitchen is exceptionally large and offers lots of storage. Both homes come furnished.” $575,000,000

This will be my (the Innkeeper’s) living Quarters…

Parcel#2 “Fully restored Historic Victorian parsonage, circa 1880s. 3 bedrooms, 1.5 baths, two fireplaces - one in parlor, one in upstairs bedroom - plus cozy den with woodstove, formal living, dining rooms. Woodsy setting with another gazebo on one acre adjoining other properties. Small detached garage, plus 400-square-foot air conditioned workshop with electric, plumbing and its own brand new 3-bedroom septic system.

Additional remarks from the owner regarding the natural environment of the place:

 “We already have a good start on butterflies and pollinators here. We’ve never used chemicals of any kind on our property in the 14 or 15 years we’ve owned it, and have a huge variety of butterflies as a result. Each year we are visited by a huge colony of bees that suddenly arrive and take up temporary residence in a hollowed out oak tree. They arrive in a great cloud; use the tree as a rest stop for a couple of weeks, then go on their way -- to where we just don't know. We're also very protective of our raptors -- many generations of barred owls and hawks that nest in our grandfather oaks every winter. I've been an environmental reporter for more than 20 years and the current global risk to the monarchs and pollinators is profound, so your mission is an important one.

Our concern for what might happen to these lovely parcels is why we haven't tried very hard to sell them. We're very conflicted about it and haven't wanted to let go. I've always felt that the universe would somehow bring the right person to entrust with its stewardship and I feel strongly that person might be you. I can't think of anyone more right for this property -- not only because of your conservation intentions with the monarchs, but because it is the perfect place to indulge your daughter's passion for horses. At the same time, it offers a solid foundation with an established income stream to build on, which is critical to your plans. The vacation rental business provides a steady, stable income that far exceeds any that a B&B (bed and breakfast) could produce, allowing you the space and light to build a tea room business.”

The present owners  have already offered to make a few exceptions and adjustments in reference to me obtaining the compound in its entirety. They are really rooting for me to steward their special property.

Joining me to live in the Parcel#2 home will be my youngest daughter, who just turned 9. A bright, ever-caring and helpful sprite. She is an animal lover with a particular affinity for horses and wolves. She has her heart set on working with animals and being of service as an animal communicator/healer, perhaps by way of an occupation as a Veterinarian.


My relevant experience:

I presently work at a Non-Profit, Spiritual Retreat Center here in SW, FL. I am the Administrative Assistant/Admin (with 6 years experience in this area). I assist the Director and perform task as a Reservationist, Innkeeper and set-up for Programs/Events and Facility Use. I handle all guest and social correspondence, social media, create brochures, flyer designs and the Newsletters and Periodicals. I coordinate our volunteers and handle registrations for programs and events. I’m responsible for collecting and recording incoming funds (including cash donations). I generate end of month statistics/reports from reservations, programs and spiritual direction, as well as maintain and update the website. 

I'm certified and registered with Monarchwatch.org and the National Wildlife Federation, as featured in Gulfshore Life Magazine. I've guest appeared on SW Florida’s Lee Pitts Live show and recognized in the Naples Daily News; both acknowledged for my environmentally-rooted endeavors. (see my official website for more)


Down to business ... Where are the funds going?

The funds will be used as a down payment to purchase the business/properties and all business licenses, fees and such.** The funds will also go to the installing the various butterfly/flower gardens for the pollinators.

**If it is not enough to secure a mortgage on the property sited in this campaign, I will then look to a few other properties/options I have in the wings. There is a property in Oviedo, FL and one just north of Ocala, FL that are of workable interest.

**If the contributions are less than workable to secure said property or the properties mentioned above, I will use the contributions as a base foundation to continue supporting my vision from there. 

Other avenues of support…

I have a close connection with someone who has offered to assist me, with the anticipation of securing some additional financial support through an  ‘Angel investor’.                    

I’ve been in the process of letting go of many of my late dad’s valuables, some furnishings, collectibles and a slew of other unique items that I inherited. They are not my style and it’s time to let these things go to someone seeks them. The funds received from the sale of these items will also go to the endeavors of this campaign.

Note: Indigogo’s share for hosting this Flexible funding campaign is 5% of the requested amount. Federal income tax is also going to be deducted.


Risk and challenges

If I were starting a NEW business, I believe marketing would be my biggest challenge. However, the present business is already known with well established repeat guests. Both homes on parcel#1 are rented 90%+, yearly; with bookings a year and a half out. What I bring will simply be icing on the cake. Our guests and future tea room visitors can see and directly experience the benefit of what their patronage supports. Would anyone really need additional reasons to retreat in such a place, or come in for a spot of tea?     


Michele’s top 12 reasons to support…“Weaving this dream into a reality”

·  You “get” the importance of healthy, Monarch, Bee and Pollinator habitats, Wildlife havens and understand the efficacy of how these habitats and havens will be monetarily supported through the operations of Monarch Manor Retreats.

·  You simply love the idea/vision of Monarch Manor Retreats. You may believe that it takes dedication, work, persistence, trial and error and commitment to ones’ vision/dream for it to come into fruition (cue sappy, dramatic music here). However, you also know that most times it takes support from others and their pieces added to another’s dream to assist in it all coming together. You just so happen to also be the person or persons with some money pieces to share…and you’re sharing it. ;-)

·  You see this vision, feel inspired to support it and be a part of watching it unfold before your very eyes. 

·  You believe the world could use a place such as Monarch Manor Retreats…in it! Yes, I do too! :-D

·  You love Nature and would like to support seeing it 'stick around'.

·  You would like to see this historical home and property continue to be preserved, utilized and declare that, “Monarch Manor Retreats is a beautiful way to do it”.

·  You’re in it for the perks! Nothing wrong with that. ;-)

·  You would Love to visit or stay at a place like this.

·  You may not be in the place to offer monetary support, but…you know somebody, or know somebody who knows somebody who can and would love to support the vision of Monarch Manor Retreats. 

·  Simply because you have some moolah to share and…Well, You Can!

·  You are a family member or friend and you love me! ;-)

·  You are presently a “Liker”-Friend on my Eclectic Butterfly Facebook page or “follower” on my personal page and would simply like to contribute to my endeavors. 


Pics of Perks (see perks page for further details)







Note: For those contributors receiving Gift Certificates for a Monarch Manor Retreat, the present owners may have bookings into next year. Gift Certificates can be redeemed upon availability. You will receive emails notifying you of our availability and/or any cancellations. Gift Certificates must be redeemed within 24 months from the day we are operating in the name of ‘Monarch Manor Retreats’. These perk specials are valid for this campaign and are redeemable during off-peak dates (May 1, 2016- Sep 30, 2016, May 1, 2017- Sep 30, 2017 )

Delivery dates on perks will be announced shortly after campaign goal has been met and has been completed. All perks are applicable in the United States.

Who will help me run things? 

There is a list of dependable people and businesses who have worked with the present owners for years and I will benefit the same. All I literally have to do is move in and do what I do! As synchronicity would have it, the lovely woman who does the after guest housekeeping, is also an “extraordinary gardener (her yard is a showplace) and she's a "top-notch baker”. A perfect fit for Monarch/pollinator gardens and a future Tea Room! Presently, there is no need for additional employees, everything out side of the Admin/Office tasks (which I will be doing), is done on an as needed basis.

Additional Bonus! The present owner is a “horse lover from birth”…her words. She owns 6 horses of her own and is ecstatic about my daughter Naomi’s, mutual love for horses. For a minimal lease she has offered us full use of the additional 1.5 acre land with a barn so that Naomi may have that for her future horse and to preserve the raptors habitats on that land.

Note: Even if you do not contribute monetarily to this campaign for Monarch Manor, do some research and contribute by way of becoming aware of the declining numbers of Monarchs and Bees, why and other ways you can assist. Morgan Freeman and More... 

Other Ways You Can Help

If any of you have further questions or suggestions regarding this campaign, just send me a message and I’ll get back to you as soon as I can.

In advance, I thank every one of you infinitely for simply reading this. You have contributed your time and energy to my dream-vision and simply that, can do wonders to bring this all into form. Obviously, I would love to receive any monetary support any of you (or someone you may know), are willing to offer. However, if you can simply “pay it forward” by passing, posting, sharing and emailing my campaign on; that in itself is a great contribution too.

May all of us Dream Big in alignment with who we are, and anticipate those dreams coming true!

Peace,

Michele

monetary support, but…you know somebody, or know somebody who knows somebody
who can and would love to support the vision of Monarch Manor Retreats. 
· 
Simply because you have some moolah
to share and…Well, You Can! 
· 
You are a family member or friend
and you love me! ;-)
· 
You are presently a “Liker”-Friend
on my Eclectic Butterfly Facebook page or “follower” on my personal page and
would simply like to contribute to my endeavors. 


Pics of Perks (see perks page for further details)















Note: For those
contributors receiving Gift Certificates for a Monarch Manor Retreat, the
present owners may have bookings into next year. Gift Certificates can be
redeemed upon availability. You will receive emails notifying you of our
availability and/or any cancellations. Gift Certificates must be redeemed
within 24 months from the day we are operating in the name of ‘Monarch Manor
Retreats’. These perk specials are valid for this campaign and are redeemable during off-peak dates (May 1, 2016- Sep 30, 2016, May 1, 2017- Sep 30, 2017 )
Delivery dates on perks will be announced shortly after campaign goal has been met and has been completed. All perks are applicable in the United States.






Who will help me run things? 
There is a list of dependable
people and businesses who have worked with the present owners for years and I
will benefit the same. All I literally have to do is move in and do what I do! As
synchronicity would have it, the lovely woman who does the after guest housekeeping, is also an “extraordinary gardener (her
yard is a showplace) and she's a "top-notch baker”. A perfect fit for Monarch/pollinator
gardens and a future Tea Room! Presently, there is no need for additional employees,
everything out side of the Admin/Office tasks (which I will be doing), is done
on an as needed basis. 
Additional
Bonus! The present owner is a “horse lover from birth”…her words.
She owns 6 horses of her own and is ecstatic about my daughter Naomi’s, mutual
love for horses. For a minimal lease she has offered us full use of the
additional 1.5 acre land with a barn so that Naomi may have that for her future
horse and to preserve the raptors habitats on that land.
Note: Even if you do not contribute monetarily to this campaign for Monarch Manor, do some research and contribute by way of becoming aware of the declining numbers of Monarchs and Bees, why and other ways you can assist. Morgan Freeman and More... 
Other Ways You Can Help

 

If any of you have further questions or suggestions
regarding this campaign, just send me a message and I’ll get back to you as
soon as I can.
In advance, I thank every one of you infinitely for
simply reading this. You have contributed your time and energy to my
dream-vision and simply that, can do wonders to bring this all into form.
Obviously, I would love to receive any monetary support any of you (or someone
you may know), are willing to offer. However, if you can simply “pay it
forward” by passing, posting, sharing and emailing my campaign on; that in
itself is a great contribution too. 
May all of us Dream Big in alignment with who we are, and
anticipate those dreams coming true!
Peace,
Michele

story:
Short Summary

When I stayed in Nepal for a month, I used to spend every morning at my friend's shop. I remember walking to the shop, which was right outside Dubar Square, every morning to meet Rohit & his father. He made the best tea, egg sandwich, omelette, flat rice with aloo, and so much more. I was so sad to hear about the news of the earthquake in Nepal, but even more saddened to hear the shop has collapsed where I spent a lot of time. 

Not only did his shop collapse, his house has been mostly damaged, and unsafe to live in. Because of that, his family is living in tents and they don't know where they are going to live in the future, and how long they are going to be in tents. He and his family are going through such a hard time right now, and reached out to me to help him and his family. To make everything worse, Kathmandu is still receiving about two quakes every single day, every day! Which really makes the repair process a bit slower and harder than it should be.
In the campaign card image, there's a picture of his family performing a ritual on me, on my first day in Nepal, officially welcoming me into their family. I started this fundraiser to help my Nepali family.

What We Need & What You Get

His shop was the ground floor of a 3 story building. First they have to clear out all the rubble, and only then, they will start rebuilding the shop, and the building from the ground up. The goal amount set is how much the builders quoted him on how much it would cost to rebuild the shop. $1,500 or 150,000 Nepali Rupees.

Rohit said that he will email all the donors, to personally thank them, for helping him and his family help restart and rebuild his business.

The Impact

A lot of the big name charities only do minimal support. They keep a lot of money for themselves, for administration costs and fundraisers. It was recently reported that the Nepali government is withholding a lot of donations and supplies, and keeping it for themselves without dispersing the supplies. This campaign directly helps one family with 100% of the money going straight to them. 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't donate, all good, but please just share this campaign to help his family out.

story:
Background...

On the morning of Saturday, April 25th, 2015, a 7.8 magnitude earthquake struck an area of central Nepal between the capital, Kathmandu, and the city of Pokhara. The death toll is in the thousands are is rising each day.

The village of Ikudol, situated in Lalitpur District in the Bagmati Zone of central Nepal,  was one of the worst affected. 

One of our team was in Ikudol when the earthquake struck. Most homes are destroyed, there are no sanitation facilities and the village itself has essentially been reduced to rubble with all the village's most important structures (schools, homes, post office, etc.) destroyed or badly damaged. 

There are around 150 families in the village comprising almost 2,000 people. Almost every one of their homes has been reduced to rubble. The school, water pipes, the post office and many more essential buildings and facilities have been destroyed by the earthquake. Road access has also become a major problem for the villagers of Ikudol. 

In the coming weeks and months, the people of Ikudol will need all the help they can get.

What the People of Ikudol Need...

In the coming weeks and months, the people of Ikudol will need all the help they can get to rebuild their village and lives.

Through this campaign we hope to raise funds to help the villagers of Ikudol with the following:

  • Rebuilding the school
  • Rebuilding and repairing essential buildings and services (including water lines etc.)
  • Rebuilding homes (including sanitation facilities)
  • Ongoing medical and rehabilitation costs for the families

How Else Can You Help?

Obviously not everyone can afford to donate. Not to worry, because just by sharing this campaign and spreading the word you can contribute greatly.

story:
Theori Fine Arts Center is coming!!!

Theori Fine Arts Center is a 20,000 sq/ft, two floor creation and performance facility.  The venue will feature (1) Grande Theater, (1) Black Box theater, (4) Dance Studios, (2) Recording Studios, (2) Music Rehearsal Rooms, (2) Video Editing Bays, (1) Photography Studio, (1) Video Production Room, and (1) Conference Room.  

The concept behind TFAC is to give artists who do not have the funds, political connections, and staffing, the opportunity to workshop, market, and produce their work at a polished, professional level. Theori Stages and our sister company Reflective Music would function as mentors for new artists, looking for an outlet for their messages. 

We would provide the venue, experience, and (when necessary) the staffing to materialize their concepts while allowing them to EARN money from their craft as opposed to going further into debt trying to create. This will create opportunities in our neighborhoods. It will give young people a place to be, besides on the streets. Our elders will be able to share our collective history. Most importantly, we will be realizing dreams and hopefully saving lives.

It will be a cultural and social boon to our community. 


What We Need


Our ultimate goal is to raise $2.5 Million in two phases. The timeline for Phase 1 anticipates completion in October of 2015. Phase 2 begins with the opening of Theori Fine Arts Center and has a 3 year outlook.

Our Phase 1 Goals  ($250,000) are:

  • $75, 000 for the down payment and build out of the venue. 
  • $150,000 for equipment (i.e. lights, cameras, audio equipment)
  • $25,000 seed funds for community outreach (After School Programs, Community Enrichment Partnerships, Mentorships)
Our Phase 2 Goals ($2,250,000)

  • Grand Opening and initial season of performances
  • Creating 50 new employment opportunities
  • Purchasing the venue outright 
The Impact

In 2004 I had a vision of creating a venue where young people in Chicago could take their creative inspiration and turn it into something concrete. You and I both know the value of art in shaping young people that are caring, driven, and empathetic to the plights of their fellow man. In Chicago we have so many talented people, who simply cannot afford to produce their art. Those can afford it, are forced to venture out of their own community because there simply is nowhere for them to produce. The few venues near our community either over charge or have their own personal agenda that does not include those outside of their circle. This leaves two options: deferred dreams or going to produce work meant for our community elsewhere, where they will never see it. We will change that. 

  • South Side entertainment companies will be able to perform, and create in their own community. Currently, if you want to produce your own work, you have to go to the North Side of Chicago. There simply aren't enough facilities on the South Side. TFAC is located in the South Loop area, a highly accessible location with close proximity to Bronzeville, the McCormick Place, and major public transportation routes. This gives them the ability to have their work seen not only by traditional downtown/north side audiences, but also tourists and the South Side audiences who cannot travel across the city for entertainment. 
  • Ownership of the venue means that we are able offer opportunities that other venues are either unwilling or unable to offer. Our leadership is composed of individuals who created their respective companies from the ground up. We understand what it takes to create; how hard it is to finance; and how frustrating it is to have excellent work that you cannot afford to produce. TFAC sees the opportunity in untold stories and hungry new talent. Our goal is to help cultivate the next generation of cultural leaders, and give the best chance at creating a solid financial foundation, by allowing them the opportunity to create inexpensively and professionally. 

  • The physical venue would function as a performance venue, training facility, networking hub, and a fine dining establishment. It will be a cultural and social boon to our community.

    Entertainment venues attract businesses to the local surrounding area, which employ more people, who are then able to spend more money; in effect, boosting our local economy. The location we have chosen is close enough to the downtown area to attract patrons who typically do not venture south, while still being able to cater directly to our community. It is accessible and in line with Mayor Emmanuel’s vision to revitalize business on the south side. Our ownership as minorities helps to negate gentrification and protect our cultural history in the South Loop/Bronzeville area. 

Defeating Our Challenges


This is definitely a monumental goal. There are several challenges: Financing, Competition from other venues, Balancing artistic freedom and social empowerment with fiscal responsibility. We are laser focused on meeting these challenges head on: with careful planning, transparency in policy, and tutelage from experienced individuals to help guide us. 

To maintain fiscal stability we will pursue the following revenue streams:

1)  Original Programming from Theori Stages and Reflective Music
2)  Business Hour Dining at our onsite restaurant
3)  Rental of our Dance, Recording, and Video Production Studios, Conference Rooms, and rehearsal spaces
4)  Rental of our Grand Theatre and Black Box Theatre
5)  Arts Grants and Endowments

Our staff is composed of well educated, talented individuals with experience in their respective fields, who have the ability to mentor burgeoning artist, while still being young enough to find innovative ways to redefine what it means to create. Our support system has decades of experience in venue management, talent development, technical direction, and financial management. They will help guide us in making sure that our altruistic goals never subvert our fiscal responsibilities. We are not in this for the short term, Theori Fine Arts Centre is going to be a permanent part of Chicago’s cultural community. 

What's In It For You? 

Our undying gratitude of course! Not enough? Well how about...

  • A Theatre Named After You
  • A Studio Named After You
  • Lifetime Tickets
  • Your Own Chair
  • Official TFAC Apparel
  • Placement On Our Supporter Wall
  • A Personalized 60 Second Play
We've got boatloads of rewards! Just take a look right over there!  -->

Other Ways You Can Help

There's more to support than money! We get this. You can also help by:

Reposting!

Passing the word on to a kind spirit with heavy pockets!

Donating equipment!

Putting us on your blog!

Buying tickets to a Theori Stages or Reflective Music Event!

We also like hugs. (Hey, we're artist too. Hugs are donations for the soul!)

story:
On April 25, 2015 a 7.8 magnitude earthquake struck Nepal, devastating the impoverished Himalayan nation. Over 6,000 people were killed and countless others injured, completely depleting the Nepal Red Cross Society’s relief stock.

Maternal Earth is working with local organizations to bring relief services such as needed food, water, and shelter to 2,300 families in some of the hardest hit areas. Nearly 100% of those in these communities are currently homeless, and unable to reach services.

Hospitals and health centers are overflowing with people needing medical assistance, while food, water, and other supplies are becoming scarce. 

Women are more likely to be killed and injured during a disaster. They are also less likely to receive relief services and are at a higher risk for domestic and sexual assault after a disaster occurs. 

While the need for resources is immediate, the rebuilding of Nepal will be an ongoing campaign. 

You can help ME reach those in need by making a tax-deductible donation.
