Nearly 100% of those in these communities are currently homeless, and unable to reach services.Hospitals and health centers are overflowing with people needing medical assistance, while food, water, and other supplies are becoming scarce. Women are more likely to be killed and injured during a disaster. They are also less likely to receive relief services and are at a higher risk for domestic and sexual assault after a disaster occurs. While the need for resources is immediate, the rebuilding of Nepal will be an ongoing campaign. You can help ME reach those in need by making a tax-deductible donation.

story:
Short Summary

My name is Emmet Murphy, I launched my firm Nile Point to build upon my passion to reduce malnutrition in the world’s poorest countries. In June 2015 I was in Liberia during the Ebola epidemic to write a 5 year food security strategy with FHI360 FANTA on behalf of USAID Food for Peace. 

During my time in Liberia last year, I worked with a Liberian agronomist, Macon Tubman and a colleague, Kali Erickson from FHI360. Shortly after I left Liberia, the Ebola epidemic spread quickly from remote rural areas near the Guinean border to the capital - Monrovia. By May 2015, there were 27,309 cases in Liberia, Guinea, and Sierra Leone, nearly half of those who contracted Ebola died. Liberia faced the highest death toll of 4,806. 

Some lost their entire families. Liberia was declared Ebola free on May 9, 2015 with help from the US and Liberia. But the battle is not over, 11,000 children in Guinea, Liberian and Sierra Leone have lost one or both parents and many lost everything.  

We stayed in touch with Macon after our trip to Liberia and he highlighted the significant problems that many Ebola survivors continue to face. He  introduced us to a local non-profit called Teens Focus which was created by Liberian refugees in Ghana in 2007 to help young Liberians in the camps. They returned to Liberia in 2012 to continue their work. To date, they have provided scholarships to girls and trained youth in life skills and vocations, especially pregnant teen mothers. In 2014, Teens Focus encouraged its network of young people to assist in Ebola awareness and prevention campaigns within their own communities. They are currently involved in raising awareness about the plight of orphans and other Ebola survivors.

Though international non-profits and donors were very active during the epidemic, assistance to Ebola survivors to help people get back on their feet  has been more limited.

What We Need & What You Get

We are raising funds for a few individuals significantly affected by Ebola in Monrovia, Liberia and featured in the campaign pitch video, namely Mansan Sheriff, Moses Goi, Dudu Kromah, Yusuo Kromah and Lorpu Kollie, as well as Kormassa Kollie, Allison Wesley and Irene Goi.  Help Nile Point and Teens Focus provide:

•  Rent in Monrovia for four families for one year to help people get back on their feet  (50% of funds raised will pay for rent)

• School fees for children, school uniform and materials (15% of funds) 

•  Seed money to restart a dry goods and African fabric businesses (10% of funds)

•  Funds for Teens Focus to promote Ebola prevention messages (10% of funds)

• Funds for people to replace personal effects lost during epidemic (5% of funds)

Should we exceed our goal of $10,000, we will provide support to an additional 27 orphans and 17 Ebola survivors based on lists compiled by Teens Focus. 

In addition to the budget above, we will also have to cover international wire fees and small costs related to the campaign.

If we do not reach our goal of $10,000, we will provide whatever funds we raise to Teens Focus to distribute accordingly.

The Impact

In the age of 20 second sound bites and tragic stories that capture our attention for just a moment, we feel that the after effects of the Ebola outbreak in West Africa has already been forgotten by the global media. We aspire to raise awareness of this ongoing problem in Liberia, Guinea and Sierra Leone and provide assistance to a few Liberian Ebola survivors with your generous support. 

Nile Point is a new firm, but members of our team have extensive experience in the international development sector working in various African countries, the Middle East and Caribbean. This story spoke to us personally following our trip to Liberia during the early stages of the Ebola epidemic.

Risks & Challenges

Our firm has contacts in Monrovia that will follow up with Teens Focus to ensure that funds will be used appropriately. To the extent possible, we will wire funds directly to individuals if they have their own bank accounts. Given that we do not have a presence in Liberia, we will rely upon trusted colleagues on the ground to ensure that funds are used as intended. 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you are unable to contribute, we understand. We encourage you to share this campaign with other people to get the word out about the plight of Liberians recovering from the Ebola epidemic.

The Impact
 In the age of 20 second sound bites and tragic stories that capture our attention for just a moment, we feel that the after effects of the Ebola outbreak in West Africa has already been forgotten by the global media. We aspire to raise awareness of this ongoing problem in Liberia, Guinea and Sierra Leone and provide assistance to a few Liberian Ebola survivors with your generous support. 
Nile Point is a new firm, but members of our team have extensive experience in the international development sector working in various African countries, the Middle East and Caribbean. This story spoke to us personally following our trip to Liberia during the early stages of the Ebola epidemic.
Risks & Challenges
 Our firm has contacts in Monrovia that will follow up with Teens Focus to ensure that funds will be used appropriately. To the extent possible, we will wire funds directly to individuals if they have their own bank accounts. Given that we do not have a presence in Liberia, we will rely upon trusted colleagues on the ground to ensure that funds are used as intended. 
Other Ways You Can Help
 If you are unable to contribute, we understand. We encourage you to share this campaign with other people to get the word out about the plight of Liberians recovering from the Ebola epidemic.

story:
Let me begin by saying that I love my Grandma.

She, aside from my Mother, is the strongest and kindest woman I've ever encountered in my entire life.

She mentioned to me yesterday that she wants a new chair. Randomly. 

Well, it turns out that she doesn't really want a chair as much as she actually needs a new chair. Apparently, the heating pad that is inside of her chair went out ages ago.  My Grandmother is the type that will keep going on with whatever the issue is because she doesn't want to hassle anyone. 

For example, her DVD player wasn't hooked up correctly so rather than just tell me she waited until I suggested we watch a movie. So considering that she told me about the chair yesterday, who knows when heat pad ACTUALLY went out?

So why do we need a chair? Well, my Grandma is having surgery in a few months and she'll be posted up for a good amount of time. Also, she will more than likely be puttering around in the garden prior to said surgery. Keeping that in mind, a new chair will be beyond helpful during recovery. She's old, she needs precious things like heated chairs before she kicks the bucket.

Lastly, my Grandma is on a fixed income, and at the moment I am working paycheck to paycheck... because of my habitual drinking. I did some thinking last night and rather than ask my family to throw together some cash I thought it would be more amusing to ask a ton of strangers to empty their wallets for the nicest ole' gal on the block.

We only need to raise around $300, but Indiegogo won't let you start a campaign for less than $500. So keeping that in mind, all additional funds will be used for the disposal of the old chair as well as the delivery of the new chair.

I couldn't find any photos of the actual chair, but I did manage to find and upload a few of her sitting. Those are located in the gallery tab. I hope that helps.

She's gonna kill me, so why not make it worth my while?

story:
HOW YOU CAN HELP

** Please share our campaign on social media, with friends, family and loved ones – especially those who are pregnant or considering a pregnancy!

**  Tell EVERYONE you know about this campaign that has a passion for helping, support and childbirth!

** Support us with DONATIONS of any amount. We recognize you and appreciate you for every single Dollar that you contribute!

**  Educate others around you to the difference that a Doula can make to a women’s life!

 

Why Are We Crowd funding?

Every business needs help and support especially at the beginning of the journey. In order for us to provide the much needed and requested services for pregnant women and new mothers we will need the proper resources. This will enable us to provide our services efficiently and to the highest caring standards.

We believe that the Doula service is a community service. In the Native times of  America, when a woman was found to be pregnant, the others in the tribe would take extra work so that she could focus on herself and her child. As this woman labored, she had support the entire process, many women went to her aide, and even as she nurtured her newborn, the women of her tribe continuously took up more work so that she could mother.  This is the foundation of Taluli. We want to be those women who take up the slack so that a mother will only have to focus on being a mother.

Now we come to the crowd in the same spirit and ask for your support and contributions in making our service possible.

“Try to be a rainbow in someone's cloud.” - Maya Angelou

 

THE GOAL

$7,500 IN START-UP FUNDS


The money raised will be used to invest in the business and develop the resources that we need to bring the Taluli Doula service to women in need.

We realize that any business is a big undertaking, however when that business is born out of passion it makes it easier to get up and face every new challenge every new day.  

We just want to help women through the beautiful yet challenging process of childbirth and YOU (yes, YOU) can help us to do that. 

All contributions at all levels are of course welcome.

 

About this campaign:

At Taluli Maternity we believe that every woman has the right to love, support, and guidance through the most important time in her life. 

We believe that every woman has the right to listen to her own body while birthing her baby. The mother remains the center of her experience, and every effort is made to see that she feels empowered, informed and open-hearted. Taluli’s goal is to help create a safe and loving environment, and hold space -physically, emotionally and spiritually- for your child’s arrival. 

In order to bring this vision to life and make this essential service available to women we are going to need your help and support. We are prepared for the challenge and we hope you are too!!! 

“The birth of a child is also the birth of a mother. This can and will affect her entire life. We women need a safe place where we can be educated, encouraged, and empowered.”


 

Our Mission


We have a strong desire to support women throughout their entire pregnancy and even into motherhood. We believe that every woman should have non-biased support and minimal stress, in essence, she should be honored in her pregnancy. Our concierge services allow for a mother to decrease the common stress and anxiety that can be brought on by all the tasks required during pregnancy,  and our doula services support a woman and reduce the risk of depression post delivery.

As a Doula, my mission is to serve. Starting as just one doula, our initial goal is to make Taluli Maternity a Full Doula Agency and serve women all over South Florida!

With all the different facts and opinions surrounding childbirth in this millennial age, women have lost the right and privilege to a choice. Women are judged for having both natural and medicated births, and also judged for having caesareans. 

While you're able to find evidence-based research on both ends of the spectrum, our mission at Taluli Maternity is to be a SAFE PLACE for women, free of judgment, where she can have her ideal birth-- WHATEVER that means to her! 

Taluli is a place where women are free to make their own minds about what is right for themselves and their families.


“Pregnancy and motherhood are the most beautiful and significantly life-altering events that I have ever experienced.”

- Elisabeth Hasselbeck


Why Doula’s?


 

Choosing who will help you through your pregnancy is of monumental importance, but choosing who will help you bring your baby into this world is even greater.
 

A doula’s main purpose is simply to be there for you, your baby, and your partner throughout the pregnancy and delivery.  

During labor, your doula can use numerous homeopathic techniques such as massage and different labor positions to help you through delivery. During your postpartum, your doula can help with caring for an infant, breastfeeding, and healing after childbirth.

A doula oftentimes becomes a mother’s best comrade throughout their pregnancy and labor!  

Evidence based research supports that a doula provides:
 

•31% decrease in the use of Pitocin*

•28% decrease in the risk of C-section*

•12% increase in the likelihood of a spontaneous vaginal birth*

•9% decrease in the use of any medications for pain relief*

•14% decrease in the risk of newborns being admitted to an intensive care unit

•34% decrease in the risk of being dissatisfied with the birth experience


How Taluli Works

 

As any pregnant woman or new mother knows the extent of support required by each lady is very individual, and really is unique in every situation.

At Taluli we provide a bespoke service that meets the needs of each and every family we work with.  

Our Doula Services Include: 

•Consultation

  The first meeting is a very important step in the doula service process. This one-hour “getting to know you” meeting is provided to you and your partner at no charge. We’ll discuss your desires and needs as well as how you see your doula fitting into your birthing experience.

•Prenatal Meeting

  This meeting typically takes place in your home and serves as an opportunity for you and your doula to get to know each other on a deeper level. This appointment is
scheduled after you have contracted with your doula to provide her services,
and lasts approximately two hurs. Your doula will share suggestions for end of
pregnancy positions and other relevant information to prepare for your birth.
This Prenatal meeting is for expectant mothers between 34 and 38 weeks of
pregnancy, and after your childbirth education classes.

•Labor Support

  Our package allows for full labor support. Our doula will be in an “on-call” status and will remain on-call until your baby’s birth. This ensures that your doula will be
available to you when labor begins, even with short notice. Your doula will
serve you when you need additional support and will stay with you and your partner until after your baby’s birth. Your doula will also help with the transition to the hospital and will facilitate communications between you and your health care provider at upon request.

•Postpartum Meeting

  Your doula will connect with you three to four days after your baby’s birth to schedule a one to two hour postpartum meeting between four to six weeks later. This meeting offers you the opportunity to discuss the birth experience, ask questions and share your feelings about new home life.

“Listen to the pregnant woman. Value her. She values the life growing inside her."- Ayelet Waldman

story:
Our Story

*photos at bottom*


After ten years of deckhanding other people's fishing boats, Justice Cousins finally bought his own! With one catch: she needed to be totally refurbished. The boat met with disaster last year and rolled over while fishing. Its motors and systems were saturated in salt water for weeks and there was oil in every crevice, mold festering, and last but not least the remnants of what was 10,000 pounds of rotting salmon trapped inside the fish-hold. Ammonia, maggots galore. 

Quickly our crew formed and united to help Justice with the new goal. We named her back to  Viking- the original name it carried for more than 20 years before it was changed to Elohim last year.  Week after week of camping in the rain (and few showers), we went to work to save the engines, and cleaned it up little by little. It was full of endless surprises and challenges.  We used what  little money we had to clean up and revive salvaged parts, and removed twenty plus 55 gallon drums full of oily waste water mixed with what seemed a never-ending  supply of maggots. But it was not in vain!

To our glory we got both engines turned over, and then running- a $30,000 save! One step at a time things got more and more exciting; next we flushed  hydraulics and got those systems fully functioning. 

All winter was spent rewiring  everything and replacing important electrical components, engine parts, refurbishing the cabin and thoroughly cleaning all the tanks,   We managed to have the salvaged 10,000 pound seine net  rebuilt (a $28,000 endeavor), reinforced two trailers to be able to hold the seine net and the skiff. In January Justice hopped on a cod fishing boat for 3 months, and headed out to Dutch Harbor and the Berring sea to raise more money for it all. And let us not forget the relentless cleaning that is still a daily progress.

This past spring, Justice's former captain proudly hooked him up with his old skiff, which we have been revamping and is near to being ready as well.
                                       
  We're so close to being ready to fish. 

The season is upon us. All we need is a little bit of help and we can make this happen. 

What is left the make this happen:

To buy a permit to seine for salmon in Prince William Sound right now is around $200,000. That is not in our ball park at this time, so the other option is leasing one. After many complications we have managed to find someone able to lease a permit to us for a $10,000 down payment. After that all we need is  to get the rest of the parts to complete the chiller system (keeps the fish cooled).
If we can get this last bit of money in the next week or so, we can head out to start fishing immediately and make this dream come alive while the season is still anew!

What exactly the money will go towards:

  • Permit down payment- $10,000
  • Refrigerated Seawater System electrical components- $3,500 

All in all...

After a lot of work, we got The Viking surveyed this past winter, and it was a success. Justice bought it last summer for a fraction of that amount. All in all, we have more than doubled the value of every dollar in this project since last Fall. We've worked our butts off. We feel, after getting so close to making this happen, that we deserve to go fishing this season!

All your help will be forever remembered as a contribution to the existence of this operation. 

P.S. This year was predicted to be the best salmon run in 10 years... ;)



       

  


 

 The harbor

  

 she gets splashed!

 

 

 The pre-furbished skiff

A beau.




Special thanks to Amethyst for her help last fall and Mike for his help last winter!

story:
Short Summary


The city of Sombor, Serbia is dying out. Once wide-known for its artistic and inclusive culture, recent wars and political turmoil have left it impoverished, eventless and unattractive. Its youth finds no moral nor financial support to explore its talents and express its abundant ideas, creativity and ethusiasm. With no-one to lead, or show the way, the young don't even know where to start. The prevailing culture has become that of pessimism and discouragement.

Determined to shake things up, Tanja Adzic (LinkedIn), and Serge Bajic (LinkedIn), a linguist and an MBA graduate, have took it upon themselves to make Sombor worth living in. They started "Fabrika" (Factory),  a social non profit accelerator that will provide working space, mentorship, financial support and easier access to funds to young teams with great ideas. Their vision is to change the town's culture to that of activism, creativity and innovation.

Fabrika will provide office space, mentorship, and assistance in obtaining financial grants to local teams with ideas of potentially great social value.

They need supporters who will help start "Fabrika"-s manufacturing process, and save this gorgeous town and its youth from being left behind and forgotten.

Tanja

Milica

Dragan

Majda

Goran

Trile

Some of Fabrika's founders and mentors


The Problem

Our research has shown that 1 out of every 4 persons finds it “extremely difficult” to execute any sort of idea in Sombor, citing financial difficulties, no working space and no support from the local community as some of the main problems. 

Young people (15-25 years of age) who have an idea simply don’t know what to do with it, and are overwhelmed with the scope of potential problems they would face if they would decide to execute it. They have little institutional support, no money and have no idea where to look for mentorship and financial support. 


The solution

We will create a space which will host 10-12 people (ideally 3-4 teams) who will actively work on their ideas. During the course of 5 months, we will organize a total of 20 mentorship sessions on topics relevant to NGO operations and project execution, as well as 8 awareness-raising lectures. Sessions and lectures will be hosted by distinguished Serbian activists with a long and successful track record. 
Create a space which will host 10-12 people who will actively work on their ideas; organize 20 mentorship sessions on topics relevant to project execution; Leverage our network of institutions, donors and funds to help our teams fundraise.

We will stipend every team with an encouraging amount of cash, in order to promote activism as a career choice. We will organize “demo days” in which teams will be able to present their ideas to local high net worth individuals, companies, and local patriots living abroad, in order to attract their financial support. And finally, we will leverage our own network of institutions, donors and funds, in order to help our teams fundraise. 

At all time we will be providing a friendly atmosphere in which ideas, innovation and discussion can thrive without discouragement and pessimism.

When we asked our research respondents if they would execute an idea from the field of their interest if  they had “Fabrika”-s support, all of them (36 total) said “yes”.




What We Need & What You Get

Our immediate need is refurbishment and equipment of the working space for local teams - a place where ideas will thrive without discouragement. We will invest in promotional activities, in order to encourage teams with awesome ideas to apply. We will also need to pay for fixed costs such as rent and utilities. Once we have traction and something to show, we will be able to fundraise from established funds and institutions. 

Your donation will help us stand on our feet, and get us far enough to pursue more sustainable means of funding. You can find our entire budget on this link. 

Our supporters will be rewarded with a wide range of perks, from public introduction during openning event, through local handcrafts, down to the prized local fish stew recipe. 


Risks & Challenges


Initial reaction to "Fabrika" has been awesome. There are already teams interested in participating. We have recieved a lot of praise and support for our effort, with many prominent Serbian activists offering pro-bono assistance. However, albeit welcome, we know that praise alone is not enough to make things happen. 

The main challenge we face is raising enough funds to accelerate the chosen teams in our first year of operations. There is a risk that by October, when our programme is due to start, we will not have secured a grant that would finance it.  

But even in that scenario, we will not lay down our arms. We will continue to push towards securing an investment, with our director, Tanja, tirelessly knocking on every door, and our chairman, Serge, covering monthly expenses from his own personal savings. We will fully utilize our network of advisors towards that one goal, until the money is in and we are ready to revive our city. We will never, ever give up on Sombor and its people.


Other Ways You Can Help

If you are not able to help financially, don't worry - there are other ways you can contribute. Share our campaign on your Facebook walls, and IM the persons in your network who are likely to be interested in our cause, and familiar with institutions providing grants to organizations such as ours. 


foto by Ispánovics József

Finally - a great, big thanks. If you're ever in the neighbourhood, Sombor and its majestic people and culture will welcome you. And be sure to give us a call - we'll be happy to show you around. 

We'd like to thank Aleksandra, Ena, Jovana, Marko, and English Language Academy Sombor for their help in creating this campaign.

Their vision is to change the town's culture to that of activism, creativity and innovation.



Fabrika will provide office space, mentorship, and assistance in obtaining financial grants to local teams with ideas of potentially great social value.


They need supporters who will help start "Fabrika"-s manufacturing process, and save this gorgeous town and its youth from being left behind and forgotten.





Tanja


Milica


Dragan


Majda


Goran


Trile

Some of Fabrika's founders and mentors





 The Problem






Our research has shown that 1 out of every 4 persons finds it “extremely difficult” to execute any sort of idea in Sombor, citing financial difficulties, no working space and no support from the local community as some of the main problems. 
Young people
(15-25 years of age) who have an idea simply don’t know what to do with it, and
are overwhelmed with the scope of potential problems they would face if they
would decide to execute it. They have little institutional support, no money and
have no idea where to look for mentorship and financial support. 

  
The solutionWe
will create a space which will host 10-12 people (ideally 3-4 teams) who will
actively work on their ideas. During the course of 5 months, we will organize a
total of 20 mentorship sessions on topics relevant to NGO operations and
project execution, as well as 8 awareness-raising lectures. Sessions and
lectures will be hosted by distinguished Serbian activists with a long and
successful track record. 


Create a space which will host 10-12 people who will actively work on their ideas; organize 20 mentorship sessions on topics relevant to project execution; Leverage our network of institutions, donors and funds to help our teams fundraise.

We will stipend every team with an encouraging amount
of cash, in order to promote activism as a career choice. We will organize “demo
days” in which teams will be able to present their ideas to local high net
worth individuals, companies, and local patriots living abroad, in order to
attract their financial support. And finally, we will leverage our own network
of institutions, donors and funds, in order to help our teams fundraise. At all
time we will be providing a friendly atmosphere in which ideas, innovation and
discussion can thrive without discouragement and pessimism.When we asked our research respondents if they would execute an idea from the field of their interest if  they had “Fabrika”-s support, all of them (36 total) said “yes”.




What We Need & What You Get
Our immediate need is refurbishment and equipment of the working space for local teams - a place where ideas will thrive without discouragement. We will invest in promotional activities, in order to encourage teams with awesome ideas to apply. We will also need to pay for fixed costs such as rent and utilities. Once we have traction and something to show, we will be able to fundraise from established funds and institutions. 
Your donation will help us stand on our feet, and get us far enough to pursue more sustainable means of funding. You can find our entire budget on this link. 
Our supporters will be rewarded with a wide range of perks, from public introduction during openning event, through local handcrafts, down to the prized local fish stew recipe. 





  Risks & Challenges
 Initial reaction to "Fabrika" has been awesome. There are already teams interested in participating. We have recieved a lot of praise and support for our effort, with many prominent Serbian activists offering pro-bono assistance. However, albeit welcome, we know that praise alone is not enough to make things happen. 
The main challenge we face is raising enough funds to accelerate the chosen teams in our first year of operations. There is a risk that by October, when our programme is due to start, we will not have secured a grant that would finance it.  
But even in that scenario, we will not lay down our arms. We will continue to push towards securing an investment, with our director, Tanja, tirelessly knocking on every door, and our chairman, Serge, covering monthly expenses from his own personal savings. We will fully utilize our network of advisors towards that one goal, until the money is in and we are ready to revive our city. We will never, ever give up on Sombor and its people.

Other Ways You Can Help

 If you are not able to help financially, don't worry - there are other ways you can contribute. Share our campaign on your Facebook walls, and IM the persons in your network who are likely to be interested in our cause, and familiar with institutions providing grants to organizations such as ours. 



foto by Ispánovics József

Finally - a great, big thanks. If you're ever in the neighbourhood, Sombor and its majestic people and culture will welcome you. And be sure to give us a call - we'll be happy to show you around. 

We'd like to thank Aleksandra, Ena, Jovana, Marko, and English Language Academy Sombor for their help in creating this campaign.

story:
how I started this fundraising idea ...

My name is Sze Chow, I am an artist & also the founder of Artouch HK. I learnt about this talented little blind orphan kid Nhi's story from Sunny & Alfred, who are the founders of Sunshine Action Charity . Nhi is a self taught pianist since last year, but she has shown a great musical gift. As Sunshine wanted to support this girl to send her to musical school in order to get proper training, but the school fees are not cheap. They knew I have organized several successful fundraising events, so they asked me if I could help this girl. So I made a trip to Vietnam this summer to visit her and the Te-Phan orphanage to make sure everything was kosher. After my visit I knew it is worth organizing an fundraising event to raise money for her school fees, and Nhi is so excited to come to HK on 2 Oct to perform at Artouch HK and meet the donors. 

WHY I support the Te-Phan Orphanage: they were established in 1985 as a private orphanage not backed by the government or other foundations. They currently have 59 children residing there from 14 months old to over 30 years old but disabled. 21 of the children are normal and the rest are disabled, abandoned by their families. So they are particularly concerned with their education, and see where a child has talent, like Nhi in music, and then help to support them. Education is important as it gives the children belief in themselves, and more confidence and hope can bring them a brighter future. 

Where are the funds going ?

The funds will be going to support Nhi's 2 years of musical school fees in Ho Chi Minh City conservatoire http://hcmcons.vn/ . It has only one musical school but is able to teach blind people. It costs about 150 USD per month for two days' classes per week ( one on one ) and lasts at least 2 years, so will cost around USD3600. If we can raise more then we can support other orphaned children from the Te-Phan Orphanage. Your donation is 100% going to support them, as we have zero admin fee to organize this fundraising event, and I try to make the cost as low as possible, so the cost is mainly for their flight tickets, as we have a generous donor who has offered free accommodation, and the venue is sponsored by Artouch HK . 

Your donation can open her eyes & support other orphaned children 

Besides sending Nhi to musical school to open her eyes and bring her a brighter future, I hope this fund raising will also raise awareness about this lovely orphanage. When I visited them, I couldn't imagine looking after so many kids as it is not easy especially given most of them are disabled, but they are like family as the normal kids look after those disabled ones. Also they are making handcrafted cards and paintings to sell for self funding to support their "family", so I'm hoping through this event to find more private donors to support them. If you happen to be visiting Vietnam please drop by to visit them, as those kids love to meet strangers and play with them.

My fundraising event experience

I have been organizing a variety of successful fundraising events since 2010, but this one is special, as I am bringing a blind orphan kid to HK that requires overcoming several difficulties like arranging their visa etc. I really appreciate other people's support to make this thing happen.
Please take a look our latest charity event at Artouch HK. If you donate
HK$100 or more you can get a donation receipt from Sunshine Action charity. 
Donate HK$400 and get one free entry plus 1 free drink to the fundraising event on 2 Oct,15 ( Friday) at Artouch HK, when Nhi and other musicians will perform that evening 
Donate HK$1000 and get 2 free entries to the fundraising event plus 2 free drinks, and one handcrafted cards made by the orphaned children, which will also help us cover the costs of organizing this event , 

You still can help us even if you cannot donate by please sharing out this info to your friends and family :-) 

fundraising auction

Besides the music performances, we will have fundraising auction of some beautiful paintings made by the orphaned children and some vouchers from restaurants & shops etc. So if you can't join us for the fundraising event but are still interested in the auction, then you can join our  Artouch fb page as we will post the info. there soon. Also we will announce the winner at the event night on 2 Oct 2015. Thanks again for your support !

story:
Who We Are?

We are Othermother Om LLC ™, a mission driven, web based community and ecommerce business. We recognize that many persons, besides biological parents (grandparents, foster parents, caregivers, teachers and others) contribute to the well-being of a child. We believe that every child deserves to be loved and supported in a way that leads to a happy, healthy and productive life. Our company was founded with that belief in mind. We are committed to supporting the Othermother “Om” ™ who, by providing an added layer of care and support, enhances children’s lives. Our mission is to be a resource to the Othermother community, while offering products and services, including those that promote the well-being of children and celebrate the unique bond between Om ™ and child. By contributing to this campaign you not only help to ensure our successful business launch, you will be supporting our vision of a world where every child has a village of persons surrounding her/him with care and support.

What We Need & What You Get?

We need financial investments to contribute to our start-up capital. As a web-based company having a strong web presence is critical to the success of our business. Like many start-ups, our members are financing much of our efforts out-of-pocket at this stage, while we explore and pursue responsible and sustainable means for running and growing our business. Your donations will contribute largely in part to building and expanding our web presence through website development and online marketing. In addition to our efforts, your financial contributions will undoubtedly help to boost our marketing and service. Your contributions are an investment in our cause and a show of support to the lives that we strive to inspire and touch. Our goal is to raise at least $7,500 through this campaign. Please help us to deliver and achieve our mission with quality and service. As an expression of our gratitude for your giving, we are providing some very special perks (see gallery for pics). You may be one of the first persons rocking some official Om ™ swag!

Check out some of the perks...

"more than words" - a beautiful writing pen to tell the special Om ™ or child in your life just how much you care!

"shirt off my back" - sample company logo t-shirt


Other ways you can support?

As we open our hearts and virtual home to the world we invite you to be a part of our Othermother “Om” ™ community! In addition to your donations, you can support us by sharing this Indiegogo page, following and liking us on social media, and spreading the word! We also encourage you to visit our website and register a special Om ™ in your life! Above all, the greatest support you can show is by becoming and Om ™ to a child.

story:
My motivation

4 years ago, after working for almost 20 years as a graphic designer, I decided to pursue my (then) hobby of jewelry design as a full time career.

Among the many motivations for starting my own business, I wanted to be able to help raise money for a charitable organizations through my craft.

This year, I designed a gorgeous bracelet featuring a natural Rose Quartz pink stone to help raise money for breast cancer research, while also promoting awareness of the disease. 

What We Need & What You Get

In order to produce this bracelet, I need to cover material & labor costs up front. I have already made the samples and have started efforts on social media to promote the bracelets. I am donating 50% of the profits to bcrfcure.org which is a wonderful foundation focusing on research to cure this terrible disease. My goal is to donate at the least $1000 to the foundation before the end of the year.

  • 100% of the funding will go to producing the bracelets- but it would be amazing to exceed my goal in which the extra will all go to the foundation!
  • As a perk you will receive a bracelet, check out the selections on the right.
  • Wear it to promote awareness and help support innovative research that is moving us closer to a world without breast cancer.

Shop Pink. Save Lives. 

October is Breast Cancer Awareness Month, a worldwide annual campaign involving thousands of organizations, to highlight the importance of breast awareness, education and research. 

Facts About Breast Cancer In The United States

  • One in eight women will be diagnosed with breast cancer in their lifetime.
  • Breast cancer is the most commonly diagnosed cancer in women.
  • Breast cancer is the second leading cause of death among women.
  • Each year it is estimated that over 220,000 women in the United States will be diagnosed with breast cancer and more than 40,000 will die.
  • Although breast cancer in men is rare, an estimated 2,150 men will be diagnosed with breast cancer and approximately 410 will die each year.

About BCRF:

The Breast Cancer Research Foundation is a nonprofit organization committed to achieving prevention and a cure for breast cancer. We provide critical funding for cancer research worldwide to fuel advances in tumor biology, genetics, prevention, treatment, metastasis and survivorship.

Other Ways You Can Help

Spread the word! Share it on Facebook, Twitter, Instagram! Email your friends!

Getting the word out is what will make this campaign successful, and I appreciate your support!  I can't do it without you.

story:
Short Summary

Following torrential rains that flooded Freetown on 16th September 2015, and displaced many of their homes, properties and loved ones, leaving them devastated. The official death toll announced by government is 7 people but unconfirmed sources from affected areas have voiced out that the death toll could be up to 100 or more.

At the moment , over 3,800 people have been registered as victims of the flood,most of them are women and children. Majority of them have no clothing, except for the one they were wearing as at the time they fled for safety and sought shelter for their lives. Though NGO’s and Ministries are responding with emergency food stuffs, these flood victims still need our help to pass through this trying time. Join us as we stand with the victims and help save a soul.

Donations of clothes, blankets, mattresses, food item and money are welcome. The impact of your donation to the victims will be to help them keep warm in the cold atmospheric conditions they currently dwell.

We, participants of the Young African Leaders' Initiative, Accra Regional Leadership Center, ask that you join us in our personal assistance philanthropy as we help these victims.

What We Need & What You Get

We need $10,000 from this platform to add to what we are raising on other platforms. The funds would be used for

  • Buying food items and clothing items for the victims
  • Putting up temporary structures for those displace
  • Providing medical aid to those that sustain injuries and others in need of medical aid

The Impact

Most of the victims of the flood were women and children, who are really in need of help. Your donation can save someone's life. Let help make a difference!

Other Ways You Can Help

Other ways you can help is by:

  • Asking folks to get the word out and make some noise about your campaign.
  • Reminding them to use the Indiegogo share tools!

And that's all there is to it.

story:
The House Of Open Arms,LLC offers temporary transitional housing apartments for independent  working women and their children whom make a moderate income who came to a financial crossroad that effected their housing situation due to no fault of own. 

The House Of Open Arms, LLC is a diversified Christian faith-based organization motivated by the love of God. Our goal is to empower one family at a time. We are offering temporary transitional housing apartments along with a required ( 6) week financial literacy course. Our client based is geared towards independent working women and their children who make a moderate income. We chose these clients in order to close the gap this client base has been missed and has great potential. We help independent women who has reached a financial crossroad which effected their housing situation due to no fault of their own, such as their income being fluctuated, divorced, fire victim or client has to suddenly move due to health hazards such as mold etc. and home is unfit for children . Due to clients making too much money and not qualifying for other company programs,our salary ranges from $29,500.00 to $76,500.00 we provide clients with options. The House Of Open Arms,LLC objective is to advise independent working women the basic of money management , savings and budgeting to help them prepare for permanent housing during there transition. 


The proceeds amount needed is $25,000.00  for  down payment for a building, closing cost and help fund the financial literacy course. Therefore,  the funding  will help me to pay closing cost and for down payment on a building  to start assisting  clients immediately.

The funding will allow The House Of Arms,LLC the opportunity  to "Empower  One Family At A Time”with their housing needs.

 We will need the support of our family and friends as the journey can be challenging. If others can see how you have taken the time to think it through and minimize the risks, they will be more supportive.


I am seeking partnership for referrals and sponsors.

story:
Who We Are

Welcome to LOFT. This is one in a kind, multi functional center of leisure and self-development. Here you can find separate rooms with necessary technical supplies and you can satisfy all your interests in exchange for a small hourly wage, which includes free Wi-FI, tea, coffee and sweets.

Here only smoking, alcohol and playing cards are forbidden, and what offers LOFT is described below.

What do we want 

Don't you want to spend a good time with your friends at a place like LOFT?
We are going to open LOFT in your city by only with your help. Let us to meet you at LOFT in your city, by donating just a dollar.


What you get 

1$ - 2 free hours at LOFT + one invitation
10$ - 24 free hours at LOFT + one invitation
50$ - 24 free hours at LOFT + a bag with LOFT's logo
100$ - We burn your name on the wall of the LOFT
200$ - 1 free week at LOFT + invitation to our event + a bag with LOFT's logo
500 $ - T-shirt + a bag + one invitation + burned name on the wall + 5 free days at LOFT
1000 $ - 1 free year at LOFT + T shirt with autographs of LOFT's staff.

MORE ABOUT LOFT


Self-development

A developed person can change the route of the world. But to be developed you must read. This is why LOFT has a big library with huge amount of books. Here you can find more than 200 books; professional, funny or classical depends on your taste. You can study, do your homework, participate in master classes and seminars, or you can just work.

What can be more pleasant that to self-develop in a comfortable and colorful place?

Leisure

LOFT has a special playroom, which is the best example of a good and happy leisure. Here you will have only one thing to decide: what game to choose, as our game collection is possibly the biggest one, old or new, serious or funny, intellectual or relaxing… LOFT is also a convenient place for birthdays or any other celebrations and for simply cooking some tasty stuff in our well equipped kitchen.

So this is also a place for leisure and for a good mood.

Art

For art loving people LOFT has the biggest hall furnished with comfortable and soft chairs, tables and a lot of musical instruments. Here you can gather with your friends to discuss interesting pieces of art, play your favorite instruments or just sit and enjoy the beautiful pictures on the walls. We will also host theater and movie specialist with great pleasure, who want to organize some kind of theater, shows or just master classes.

Healthy Lifestyle

LOFT thinks that healthy lifestyle is the key to a long life, and for this reason introduces its yoga/dancing hall. Here you can find a large and comfortable place for your dance moves or yoga poses, a big mirror, carpets and many other useful things and accessories. This hall is already being actively used by many specialists of dance or yoga.

multi functional center of leisure and self-development. Here you can find
separate rooms with necessary technical supplies and you can satisfy all your
interests in exchange for a small hourly wage, which includes free Wi-FI, tea,
coffee and sweets.
Here only smoking, alcohol and playing cards
are forbidden, and what offers LOFT is described below.What do we want Don't you want to spend a good time with your friends at a place like LOFT?We are going to open LOFT in your city by only with your help. Let us to meet you at LOFT in your city, by donating just a dollar.

What you get 1$ - 2 free hours at LOFT + one invitation10$ - 24 free hours at LOFT + one invitation50$ - 24 free hours at LOFT + a bag with LOFT's logo100$ - We burn your name on the wall of the LOFT200$ - 1 free week at LOFT + invitation to our event + a bag with LOFT's logo500 $ - T-shirt + a bag + one invitation + burned name on the wall + 5 free days at LOFT1000 $ - 1 free year at LOFT + T shirt with autographs of LOFT's staff.MORE ABOUT LOFTSelf-development

A developed person can
change the route of the world. But to be developed you must read. This is why LOFT
has a big library with huge amount of books. Here you can find more than 200
books; professional, funny or classical depends on your taste. You can study,
do your homework, participate in master classes and seminars, or you can just
work.
What can be more pleasant
that to self-develop in a comfortable and colorful place?
Leisure 

LOFT has a special
playroom, which is the best example of a good and happy leisure. Here you will
have only one thing to decide: what game to choose, as our game collection is
possibly the biggest one, old or new, serious or funny, intellectual or
relaxing… LOFT is also a convenient place for birthdays or any other
celebrations and for simply cooking some tasty stuff in our well equipped
kitchen.
So this is also a place
for leisure and for a good mood.
Art

For art loving people
LOFT has the biggest hall furnished with comfortable and soft chairs, tables
and a lot of musical instruments. Here you can gather with your friends to
discuss interesting pieces of art, play your favorite instruments or just sit
and enjoy the beautiful pictures on the walls. We will also host theater and
movie specialist with great pleasure, who want to organize some kind of
theater, shows or just master classes.
Healthy Lifestyle

LOFT thinks that healthy
lifestyle is the key to a long life, and for this reason introduces its
yoga/dancing hall. Here you can find a large and comfortable place for your
dance moves or yoga poses, a big mirror, carpets and many other useful things
and accessories. This hall is already being actively used by many specialists
of dance or yoga.

story:
What is Archery Tag?

Taken straight from archerytag.com, Archery Tag® is played similar to dodgeball with bows and patented foam-tipped arrows. This exciting, action-packed game offers the ultimate family-friendly experience that engages everyone. 

It is considered to be a cross between dodgeball, paintball and archery.

The video below is taken from an Australian based Archery Tag licensed operator. It should give you an indication as to what it's like.


So who are you?

My name is Fitzgerald Limisella, founder of Nerfun (www.nerfun.co.nz), a small business based in Auckland, New Zealand. Nerfun currently offers services in the form of Nerf and Laser Tag/Laser Strike battle parties. My mission is to provide fun in a safe manner and ensure a hassle-free event for my valued customers.

I started the business about 2 years ago and was the first in New Zealand to offer a Nerf battle party. About a year ago, I added laser tag to Nerfun's offering. It has proven to be quite popular as people would normally have to go to a laser tag facility to play. With Nerfun, you can play Nerf or laser tag or both in your very own backyard. 

Now I would like to bring Archery Tag, an increasingly popular sport with hundreds of operations worldwide, to Auckland. In order to do that, I need your help.

How does it all work?

Nerfun provides a mobile service, so that means I come to you whether that be your home, nearby park, or the local school hall. Archery Tag will be offered in the same way.  A level playing area of 11 m x 24 m, which is about the size of a tennis court, is ideal.

An Archery Tag session is likely to last for up to 2 hours. The first 30 minutes would probably be spent on explaining the safety and game rules, and maybe a couple of practice rounds if required. The remaining 90 minutes would then be for game play.

How do you play?

The original game set up by Archery Tag is a bit like dodgeball. Please check out the video below for a bit of info about how to play the game and general instructions about how to fire an Archery Tag arrow.


I am interested in implementing other types of games as well, such as Capture the Flag. So I envision having a couple of game types with a couple of rounds per game type. Whether or not these can be integrated into Archery Tag remains to be seen but I will keep you posted.

Will it hurt?

It could be described as being hit by a tennis ball thrown by someone. It is certainly not as painful as being hit by a paint ball which generally leaves marks and sometimes welts on your skin. It is very safe as the arrows are made with a patented foam-tipped design. The only safety equipment you need (which will be provided) is a face mask.

How much will it cost?

When it launches, the price is likely to be NZ$40 per person for the 2 hours of game time for between 8 to 16 players. If you have less than 8 players, you can still book but the minimum price of $320 still applies. Let's compare it with paintball operations. Most paintball places charge about $40 per person for their most basic package, which would give you around 150 or 200 paint balls. Depending on how trigger happy you are, you would probably last between 15 minutes to an hour. Bigger packages cost a lot more. With Archery Tag, there is no limit to the number of arrows, so to speak. For as long as you can retrieve them, which should be easy as people fire arrows at each other, then you can keep playing.

What is the minimum age?

Minimum age will be 10 years and there really is no maximum age. For as long as you are fit enough to run around, hide and pull the bow string, then you're good to go!

Ok, you've got me all excited! What do you need?

Thought you'd never ask! Well, to be a licensed operator and to purchase the Silver package, I need around NZ$15,000 (around US$10,000 currently) including shipping to New Zealand. The package includes:

  • 16 bows
  • 64 arrows
  • 16 masks
  • 1 five-spot target set
  • 6 bunkers
  • other bits and pieces, such as spare strings, bags, manuals, etc.

Currently I am aiming to launch by the end of the year or early next year, but there are factors that may change things, such as shipping delays, etc.

What do I get for contributing?

You not only get to be one of the first people to try out Archery Tag, but you also get to play it at a special rate! As most of the perks give you a free game when we launch, it is therefore lower than our proposed standard pricing of $40 per person. The higher the contribution the larger the discount is per person. There will be a window of time, probably about a week prior to the big day, where you will have a chance to pre-book to secure a spot before the general public.  It is still subject to availability as there may be another backer who wants the same date and time.

There is also a special Lifetime Membership perk. Once the Indiegogo campaign is over, this Lifetime Membership will no longer be available.  Only our Annual Membership will be available after this time, for a yearly fee of NZ$100 per person. The Lifetime Membership will never have any annual fees - so don't miss out, there are only 50 of these!
The Lifetime and Annual Memberships will offer a range of benefits, such as:
  • 10% discount on each Archery Tag booking
  • 10% discount on each Nerf and/or Laser Strike booking
  • Personalised membership ID card
  • Free entry to future league games or tournaments (only applicable to the Member, not for the entire team)
  • Other benefits as we introduce more products and/or services
All perks will have your full name immortalised on the website as well. It will be displayed on a specific Thank You page. Please do let me know if you only want your first name displayed or don't wish for your name to be displayed at all.
If it all goes well, then I'll consider adding more rewards.
Please note that all this (prices,  game duration, membership benefits, etc) could change, but any changes will be communicated.

 Stretch Goal 1 - $14,000 (or around NZ$20,000)

So if this stretch goal is unlocked, we will have 20 bows, so more people can play at once! Along with more bows, we also get more arrows, 2 target sets and 12 bunkers. Please note that if you have 20 players, it does not mean that all 12 bunkers will be deployed. Bunker deployment is subject to space availability and time constraints.

 Stretch Goal 2 - $16,000 (or around NZ$25,000)

If this stretch goal is unlocked, we will have 24 bows and even more arrows, so you can bring even more friends to enjoy this timeless sport! Bring on the battles!

I am interested, but I can't contribute at this time

That's fine if you can't contribute right now, you can still help by spreading the word. The more people who know about this, the more likely the campaign gets funded. You can share the link to this Indiegogo campaign. You can also visit our Facebook page (www.facebook.com/nerfun), like the page and let other people know about this campaign.

So, thank you so very much in advance.  Whether you aspire to be a Robin Hood, a Katniss Everdeen, a Legolas, a Hawkeye, a Princess Merida, or a Green Arrow - I look forward to seeing a new generation of super archers!

story:
All donations will get a free NEW song by Elephant Stone released exclusively for this campaign. UPDATE: Unfortunately, we're busy with recording our new album and won't be able to make a new song available until the album is ready. Sorry about this... we promise we'll make a good album though!

Paul is a music writer for the online magazine, Stereo Embers Magazine, and has been a big champion of Elephant Stone. We have become close friends over the past few years. He and his wife have come upon difficult times, and I need your help. Paul and Katie both suffer from chronic diseases. Paul has a chronic, life-threatening illness (Cardiomyopathy/Congestive Heart Failure), and Katie suffers from a multitude of debilitating illnesses that prevent her from holding a job, driving, and even being on her own. Paul has to be at home to take care of Katie and drive her to her regular doctors' appointments. Currently, the possible diagnoses include lupus and Ehlers-Danlos Syndrome (EDS), which could be life-threatening. They will visit the University of Wisconsin-Madison in February for the genetic testing necessary for an EDS diagnosis. What this means is that neither of them is able to currently work, and their bills are piling up. They were recently refused permanent disability insurance and are appealing the decision.  So, until the decision is (hopefully) reversed, I'm hoping to raise enough funds to get them through the next few months. These are people I care deeply about, and I would really appreciate your support in helping them through this difficult time.

Om shanti om

Rishi

story:
WHO ARE NOLONGER VICTIMS ? 

No Longer Victims– is an International Voluntary Organization dedicated to challenging abusers of all sorts, interrupting cycles of violence, and empowering ALL People’s to step out of their Victim’s shoes. No Longer Victims has built a network through Facebook and social media. We provide confidential direct counseling and crisis support. We actively promote better training for law enforcement, and work with authorities in local communities across the US and several countries around the world to improve community services for Women and Men breaking the cycle of domestic violence and opening people's eyes to the devastation of Child & Sexual Abuse. No abuse is ignored by us and nobody is refused our help.
Lurleen Hilliard the Founder  is a survivor of spousal violence herself,  and all of the volunteer staff have trod the path out of that abyss, and they understand the challenges confronting any victim of abuse trying to discover that core strength to overcome what was once their daily life and now hopefully what they will call their past.

WHY WE ARE ASKING FOR YOUR HELP ? 

Normally we never ask any individual or organization for help with the work that we do. However sometimes on rare occasions such as this due to the fact that we have NO funding and do all this work out of our own pockets, We really need to ask You the Public for help.  We URGENTLY need to Relocate a Family who have endured many years of Domestic Violence - Physical - Sexual - Child Abuse , They are safe for now but long term we have to relocate them as soon as possible out of the area and as far away as possible. This takes MONEY and we are BEGGING YOU TO HELP . We know that this will cost more than the amount we are asking to raise but we also know that life is hard right now for so many and we appreciate any help we can get as right now it is more than we have to offer them. 



WHAT DIFFERENCE WILL YOUR DONATION MAKE TO THIS FAMILY ? 

When I say that in helping to donate and raise funds you will be changing lives forever more I genuinely mean that. There is more to been a survivor in life than escaping your abuse, if children have lived in the home even if no abuse was perpetrated onto them it causes them to suffer from the least Mental and Emotional abuse. This form of abuse has been shown to be catastrophic for children as they grow up hiding their pain from the world, sometimes it is never known until they react badly to a situation that they should be controlled in. So the children of this family who have endured years of Mental- Physical - Sexual -Emotional -Financial Abuse will now have a chance at a future, they will now have a chance at a life free from fear and pain.  ONLY YOUR DONATION CAN MAKE THAT POSSIBLE .


The mom who just hadn't got the strength over the years to flee will be able to sleep at night without one eye open. Right now and for the last few months she was constantly when in bed at night in anticipation of somebody coming through that door or window to carry out their threats. These are not threats to be taken lightly as the actions of their abuser over the years shows he is very capable of ending all their lives if he wishes to do so. This mom feels extremely guilty for not leaving sooner but where would she go, who could she  turn to and what would she use for finances. An Abuser will ensure that his/her victim will have little or no finances as that means they can't flee and they can't and won't lose control. Thankfully she and her children got out but now the hard part getting them a life that is safe is priority 

RISKS & CHALLENGES FACING THEM NOW FOR THE FUTURE ?

All victims of abuse will continue to live in fear for a very long time, irrespective of how far away they may be from their abuser, if they have lived a life of abuse for a long time then they know that they can and they will get to them if they try hard enough. So in DONATING TODAY you will be helping to TOTALLY RELOCATE this small family so that their abuser has no way of finding them, won't be able to track them and they can then start a new life, the first step to their future.

WOULD YOU LIKE TO MAKE THIS HAPPEN - KNOWING YOU HELPED A FAMILY TO FINALLY LIVE INSTEAD OF EXISTING IN LIFE  BY SIMPLY DONATING WHAT YOU CAN - THIS IS THE KINDEST THING ANYBODY CAN DO IN LIFE TO HELP A STRANGER 

So many of you will read stories of horrific Child Abuse - Child Sexual Abuse - Domestic Violence -  Rape - Mental Torture and you will read these on Social Media or your local newspaper or even see the reports on the television. It may seem surreal to you that people can live through this and many will ask why do they stay ? Well the answer is simple they stay because they have no option but to stay, they have no family or friends who they can ask for help, they have no finances and they have no self believe to escape and to live rather than existing. IMAGINE LIVING THIS LIFE EVERY DAY - YOU WANT TO LEAVE - YOU HAVE TO LEAVE - BUT YOU CAN'T LEAVE DUE TO NO FINANCES OR SUPPORT 

WHAT YOUR MONEY WILL HELP TO DO FOR THIS FAMILY OF SURVIVORS 

People in general are fantastic at saying after the fact that they should have or they could have helped a person or family. But right now is when we need your help, hindsight is no use when it comes to abuse. This family has no home to call their own - no money to even get a weeks groceries - no friends who know where they are  with no family to support them - no money for fuel for their vehicle - no way out in their eyes. But there is a way out and that is if we all as decent human beings come together and help them to get a future. Help them to stop living in fear, looking over their shoulders and wondering if today is the last day of my life. 

They should be saying today is the first day of the rest of my life and that is what Nolonger Victims wants to do with your help. The long term counseling will continue as the devastation to them mentally let alone what they have endured physically will take many years to heal from. But they will heal and the more we can help the easier that healing process will be. On behalf of Nolonger Victims I would like to sincerely Thank all that donate anything to this worthy cause. Your kind actions are what will restore this families believe in people and society. They are no longer victims they are Survivors and let us all show them how proud we are and how we will all as humans with morals, ethics and kindness in our hearts help them to enjoy life and for once to smile without fear. 

Lurleen Hilliard - Founder - Nolonger Victims
